loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 60 years old, married, and has four adult children. She is involved in hog-raising business to help her husband generate income. They reside in a rural community and make their living through farming. Due to financial hardship, she aims to improve and strengthen the business in order to earn a higher income. 

Having inadequate capital, Mary requested a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional piglets, hog feeds, and vitamins for her hogs. She hopes that her loan request will be granted so she is able to improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase  additional piglets, hog feeds, and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over seven years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 46 años de edad que ha dedicado más de 29 años a trabajar en su propio negocio, un taller de fabricación y venta de colchones que inició en compañía de su esposo, la idea surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para solventar los gastos del hogar y así salir adelante.
Motivada por su espíritu de superación y perseverancia, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (espuma, resorte, telas), esto le permitirá tener materia prima disponible para cumplir con los encargos que tiene pendientes ya sí mejorar los ingresos por venta, que son los que le permiten disfrutar una vida digna en compañía de su esposo.
María manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es darle continuidad y permanencia a su negocio, que sea mucho más reconocido y rentable para así seguir avanzando y mejorar la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
María, 46, has been working in her own business for more than 29 years. She has a workshop where she makes and sells mattresses, which she started with her husband. The idea sprung from her need to generate earnings to cover the household expenses and move forward. 

Motivated by her desire to overcome and her perseverance, she is applying for a loan to buy wholesale supplies (foam, springs, and fabric). This will allow her to have primary materials available to fulfill pending orders, thereby improving her income from sales. This income allows her to enjoy a decent life alongside her husband.

María's greatest wish is to continue with her business and to give it stability. She wishes for her business to be much more well-known and profitable in order to continue moving forward and improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (foam, springs, and fabric).

loans.name: Zaitoon

texts.en:
Zaitoon belongs to an ultra poor family. She is the age of 50 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband sells balloons from a cart near schools and picnic places in Lahore. He hangs up balloons of various colors on his cart to offer his customers. A balloon is a flexible bag that can be inflated with a gas, such as helium, hydrogen, nitrous oxide, oxygen, or air. Modern balloons are made from materials such as rubber, latex, polychloroprene, or a nylon fabric and can come in many colors.

Zaitoon's husband wants to buy modern balloons, which have a high cost; however, due to lack of funds, he is unable to make these purchases. Therefore, Zaitoon has requested a loan for her husband to buy balloons. Zaitoon is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy balloons made of rubber, latex, polychloroprene, or a nylon fabric.

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis Décembre 2009 et est constitué de six membres qui sont tous issus de la même localité. Leur activité principale est le commerce. 

Rama debout a l’extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras, est âgée de 35 ans, est notre emprunteuse vedette.
Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont un garçon.

Avec ce crédit, Rama compte acheter 24 seaux de 15 litres de patte d'arachide pour une valeur de 300000f.

Avec son bénéfice, elle compte renforcer son épargne, assurer ses propres besoins et aussi la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in December 2009 and consists of six members, all of whom are from the same village where they work as merchants.

Rama is standing in the far right of the photo with her arm raised. She is a 35-year-old married mother of five children, four girls and one boy, and the group's star borrower. With this loan, Rama plans to buy two dozen 15-liter jars of peanut butter. The resulting earnings will help her increase her savings and provide for her family's needs, which includes the cost of education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and with seven children, six in school and one underage. She lives at her own house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees.

For over twenty years Fatuma has been operating a beauty saloon business. Her potential customers are neighbours and town dwellers. She dreams of incorporating her business to a beauty training school. 

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase hair extensions, hair treatment, and shampoos. She joined Yehu because of favorable loan requirements

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, hair treatment, and shampoos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase red oil and caustic for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, oil, etc., for her business,

loans.name: Ramana

texts.en:
Ramana is a 25-year-old lady and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is the guardian of the entire family and responsible to manage the household.

She is also doing her own business by providing educational services to school-going children. She needs some furniture, e.g. tables, stool chairs, etc. for her business purpose. She also wants to make renovation of her business place. But due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to make expanses for her business needs.

Therefore, Ramana has applied for a Kiva loan from it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will enable herself to buy the furniture for her business place and make renovations as well.
 
Ramana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial support.

loans.use: to buy furniture and make renovation for her academy business.

loans.name: Ameer

texts.en: Ameer is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Ameer has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Ameer is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To cover the cost of maintenance of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 53-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Robina is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above-mentioned accessories and also be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different accessories, including needles, threads and pieces of cloth, for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 52-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. 
Yasmeen is also providing sewing services, and earns the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g. needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy pieces of clothes, ribbons, needles, threads, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Elías Enrique

texts.es:
Elías es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 56 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.
Actualmente posee cultivos de yuca, ñame y plátano, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y 6 hijos.
Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidado de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.
Elías manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Elías is a humble farmer and hard worker. He is 56 years old and when he was young he learned all of the skills of farming thanks to lessons from his father.  Today he has fields of yucca, yams, and bananas whose yields are harvested and sold in the market in the town where he lives. This work generates sufficient income for him to provide daily sustenance for his home and to pay for the basic necessities of his wife and 6 children. 

He was motivated to seek this loan with the goal of investing it in the purchase of wholesale agricultural supplies (manure, pesticides and fertilizers). This will allow him to continue caring for his crops and to improve the productivity of his next harvest which will benefit the earnings he receives for each sale. Elías says his greatest desire is to continue struggling to achieve economic stability and to provide better living conditions and wellbeing for his family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale agricultural supplies (manure, pesticides and fertilizers).

loans.name: Atia

texts.en:
Atia is a 50-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Atia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him continue his business. 

Atia is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's Rickshaw.

loans.name: Jupita Group

texts.en:
Ashery, who is a man aged late thirties, is single. For a period of eighteen years now, Ashery has made his living by running two enterprises. One is a grocery, selling beer and soft drinks, and another is a shop, selling dry foods. He opens his business from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. each working day and is able to make a very good monthly return. 

This is Ashery's fifteenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy his plot of land for his business progress. He also bought business stocks of drinks and shop products. He managed to pay back all of his previous loans successfully. Ashery is thankful to everyone who has supported his group. He earned an extra income, which he used to save for his future and put part of it back into his business. With this new request, he will buy new business chairs and a table. He dreams to have good progress in his business. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "JUPITA" which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new business chairs and a table.

loans.name: Roepchand

texts.en:
Roepchand is 58 years old, married, and has two adult children. He worked a few years ago as a migrant laborer for a farm in French Guyana that currently is closed. He lives in his own house and has no job in Suriname.  

Roepchand requested a loan from Seva MFI for 8,000 SRD, which he use to purchase fertilizers. He wants to start planting rice on leased land.   Roepchand's goal is to have his own plots for planting rice.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en: Lali, who is a 44-year old widow woman, lives in Ozurgeti district with her son and daughter-in-law. In spite of her high education she can't find any stable job. The only source of family's income is transfers from abroad. However this income is insignificant for covering everyday costs and meeting basic needs. She has great desire to do her part for the family's welfare and tackle financial difficulties. Lali requested a loan for opening a family confectionery. She will bake a wide assortment of cakes and pastry products and will supply local stores everyday. She will generate income, will have her own customers and if necessary she will get private orders too. Lali will be thankful for having her own business and generating income as it is so necessary for her family.

loans.use: To open a family confectionery

loans.name: Averia

texts.en:
Averia is single and has three children who attend school. She operates a taxi business, which has been doing for two years. 

Averia requested a loan from Yehu for 50,000 KES, which she will use to pay school fees for her children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne  38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO I l’un des quartiers de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits,  des produits alimentaires et divers. 
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur  1er  prêt solidaire. BINTOU, 1ère femme à droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 5 pièces de wax et 5 pièces d’uni-wax. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture  et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi Group have an average age of 38 years old and three children at home. They all live in traditional extended families in Santoro, one of the neighborhoods in San/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are relatives and neighbors who work together buying and selling clothes, food and other products. 

This is the first group loan for the women of the Benkadi Group. Binou, the woman at the far right of the photo, intends to use this loan to buy five sets of wax pagnes and five sets of uni-wax pagnes. She purchases her supplies in Bamako and sells to a diverse clientele of women and men in cash and often on credit. Binou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, which she'll use on expenses related to health and food, reinvesting the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase wax pagnes (traditional wrap-arounds)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10 jerricans of kerosene

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rubber dishes for her business

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her mid 30's, is single with three children who are still in school. She has been running a business of running a grocery store for ten years now. She works from 8am to 7pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rose's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy empty crates of beers and soda so as in the future to be able to buy more business stocks. Rose bought business drinks to meet her customers' demand. She received an extra income which she used to cover school fees and household expenses for her family. Rose saved part of her business returns. She has manage to pay back all of her previous loans successfully. Rose is requesting a twelve loan which she will use to buy stocks of waters to resell to more people. She dreams that in the coming days she will be able to build a house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mapatano" which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of waters to resell to more people.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil, flour, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dried fish to expand her sales

loans.name: Nzasa Group

texts.en:
Fides is in her mid-forties and divorced. She has seven children. Four of her children are in school while the remaining three are adults. 

For six years, Fides has made her living by running a shop selling soft drinks like juices, sodas, and water. She also sells snacks to people who like to eat with their drinks. She opens her shop from 6:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. every working day and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy more stock of drinks and sell in wholesale.  

Fides dreams that one day she will be able to open and register her primary school. She own a primary school (kindergarten) which she expects to open soon after being given authority to do so by the government. 

She will share this loan with her loan group Nzasa which has three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer dinámica y emprendedora, que siempre busca alternativas que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Es por ello que, desde hace 3 años comenzó a vender todo tipo de mercancía como ropa, accesorios, perfumería y otros productos, sin embargo, notó que el producto que más le solicitan es la ropa interior, por ello se dedicó de lleno a vender este tipo de mercancía, con la que logra generar los recursos suficientes para solventar sus gastos personales.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer sus inventarios, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar más surtido de ropa interior al por mayor, así podrá ofrecer más variedad y satisfacer los gustos de su clientela, lo que se reflejará en el incremento de las ventas y el margen de utilidades que percibe con su labor.
Luz, con su perseverancia y tenacidad quiere seguir luchando para que más adelante pueda cumplir el sueño de montar su propio almacén para generar mayor rentabilidad y mejorar poco a poco su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luz is a dynamic and entrepreneurial woman who is always seeking ways to improve her living conditions. Because of this she began to sell all types of merchandise like clothing, accessories, perfume and other products three years ago. However, she noticed that the most sought after item is underwear. Because of this she dedicated herself to selling this type of merchandise through which she can generate sufficient earnings to pay for her personal expenses. With the goal of strengthening her inventory, she is seeking the support of this loan to purchase an assortment of wholesale underwear. This way she will be able to offer a wider variety and to satisfy the tastes of her customers which will be reflected in the increase in her sales and the profit margin that she will gain from her work. With her perseverance and tenacity she wants to continue struggling so that later she will be able to accomplish her dream of opening her own store to generate more profits and to improve her quality of life, little by little.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of wholesale underwear.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre de 52 años de edad, casado y padre de 3 hijos por quienes ha luchado incansablemente para sacarlos adelante.
Durante la mayor parte de su vida productiva, se ha dedicado a trabajar de manera independiente, vendiendo de forma ambulante las cremas y helados que él y su esposa producen, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y así ha logrado solventar los gastos básicos de su familia.
Actualmente se le presentó la oportunidad de tomar en arriendo una tienda de abarrotes ya establecida y dotada con los activos, pero requiere comprar más surtido al por mayor (granos, azúcar, cervezas, gaseosas, galletería, lácteos) y realizar adecuaciones locativas (revocar y pintar las paredes), así podrá comenzar con su nuevo proyecto productivo, cambiando la imagen del establecimiento y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes, de esta forma podrá generar mayores ingresos para brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
Rafael manifiesta que con el inicio de este negocio él estaría cumpliendo un sueño, pues siempre anheló tener su propio negocio en un local abierto al público, ya que así podrá evitar los riesgos que implica trabajar en la calle; además piensa que será mucho más rentable y quiere lograr una estabilidad económica que le permita seguir luchando por el bienestar de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Rafael is 52, married, and the father of three children for whom he has labored tirelessly so they can have a better future. 

During most of his working life, Rafael has been an independent businessman, selling ice cream and desserts that he and his wife prepared. Rafael learned this business by starting and operating it, and managed to cover his family's basic expenses. 

Rafael now has the opportunity to take over an established and well-stocked grocery store. He needs, however, to purchase additional wholesale goods (grains, sugar, beer, soda, pastries, dairy products) and make repairs (plaster and paint the walls). These purchases and improvements will allow Rafael to launch his new business project and improve the store's image. He'll be able to offer a greater variety of goods to meet his customers' needs and preferences, increasing his income so he can provide a better quality of life for his family. 

Rafael says that taking over this store would be the fulfillment of a dream. He's always wanted to have his own business in a site that's open to the public, thus avoiding the risks that come from working on the street. Rafael also believes that the shop will be much more profitable than his old business. He wants to achieve a degree of financial stability that will allow him to keep striving for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale goods and make repairs to his new store

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is 37 years old, married, has one child, and lives in the small village of Senaki district with her husband, son, and pensioner mother-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have two pigs, two calves, and a cow. Tea produces cheese to sell. In addition, the family grows citrus and sells the harvest locally. 

As the income is seasonal and not enough for covering family expenses Tea decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 GEL to start a retail business. She plans to purchase home products and then sell them among her villagers and generate income. With the increased income, Tea will be able to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin a trading business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia Nancy tiene 42 años de edad es casada y tiene 04 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose a la ganadería, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual  le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica  a la agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
 La socia Nancy pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real”, la socia agradece el crédito otorgado y  se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 42-year old woman who is married and has 4 children. She makes a living from two different daily activities. She has worked in stockbreeding for several years with things going well thanks to the hard work she puts into the business, and also works in agriculture. She is a responsible and hard-working person and hopes to keep working this way to support her family. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a cow. Nancy is a member of the communal bank "San Bartolomé de Tambo Real". She is grateful for the loan and promises to repay as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es:
La socia Ricarda tiene 47 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose a la ganadería y a la producción de lácteos como leche, yogurt, queso, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual  le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
 La socia Ricarda pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real”, la socia agradece el crédito otorgado y  se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Our member, Ricarda, 47, is married and has 4 children.  She keeps cattle and makes cheese and yogurt from the milk they produce.  The business is successful, she says, because she works day in and day out to make it a success.  She wants to continue the business because it generates revenue that supports her family.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a cow.
Ricarda belongs to the San Bartolome de Tambo Real community bank.  She is grateful for the support that she's received and committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her cattle business.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Riaz is 30 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. He lives with his children and his parents. Since Riaz left school, he helped his father with the rice cultivation. He is now trying to take over his father's business.  His father has always done good business with Seva MFI and Riaz plans to continue doing so. 

The challenges for Riaz are the costs of inputs at current low prices of the end produce. Therefore, Riaz requested a loan from Seva MFI for 8,000 SRD, which he will use to buy a clutter plough. With a clutter plough, he can do the soil preparation on his plot efficiently and can earn extra money through soil preparation for his fellow farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a clutter plough.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Les presento a la señorita Daniela, que ejerce actualmente primer semestre de técnico  en auxiliar de enfermería en esta prestigiosa institución, solicita que sea beneficiada con  KIVA, auxilio que de ser aprobado, será de gran ayuda, porque contara con más dinero para la alimentación y transporte, ya que se encuentra viviendo en un barrio cun poco retirado del sitio de estudio. Esta solicitud la hace porque para ella es muy importante, puesto que está dando los primeros pasos para llegar a ser una profesional para la salud.
texts.en: This is Daniela, who currently studies her first semester in Nursery Assistant Technician at a prestigious institution. She is requesting a loan from Kiva, which would be of great help to cover food and transportation expenses now that she lives far from where she studies. This is very important for her as she is taking her first steps towards becoming a health professional.

loans.use: to cover one semester tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two bags of sugar and seven bags of flour

loans.name: Osmel Edenilson

texts.es:
Osmel de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato y luego saco un técnico en ventas, está soltero y vive con sus padres y 4 hermanos menores, es empleado en una comercial y labora desde hace 1 año,  la distancia para llegar a su trabajo es de 45 minutos en bus y el horario de trabajo es de 8 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde.

Necesita el préstamo ya que quiere pagar una deuda en la comercial, pues compro una motocicleta y la cuota le queda elevada, la motocicleta  es para ahorrar tiempo y por la distancia de su hogar ya no hay buses cuando sale del trabajo.

El sueña con tener una casita propia para poder independizarse y a futuro formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Osmel is a 20-year old man who studied up to high-school and then graduated as a sales professional. He is single and lives with his parents and 4 younger siblings. He has worked in a store for a year. It takes him 45 minutes to arrive to work by bus and he works from 8am to 6pm. 

He needs the loan to repay a debt he has with the store. He bought a motorbike and got it financed. The motorbike will save him time and will allow him to get home at night, given that there are no buses when he finishes work. 

His dream is to have his own house so that he can live independently and to have a family in the future.

loans.use: to repay a debt he has with the store after buying a motorbike.

loans.name: Garigmaa

texts.en:
Garigmaa is 34 years old, widowed, and has one son who attends school. She lives in a ger, a traditional nomdic yurt, in Uvs province, Mongolia. Garigmaa has been working as a chef in a local cafeteria and is now starting her own business of a souvenir shop in a local market rental booth. Her sister runs a souvenir shop in Ulaanbaatar city and Garigmaa used to run a small retail store and has experience in running a small shop. 

Garigmaa is requesting a loan for 1,500,000 MNT, which she will use to purchase starting inventories for her new souvenir shop. She is hardworking, trustworthy, and honest.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventories for her new souvenir shop

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
Leni runs a small stall selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in West Bandung, a semi urban area about 3 hours from Jakarta. Leni is married and living with four persons in the family home.

Leni began working with Ruma 1 month ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. For the last month, she has earned around $8-9 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Geny Narciza

texts.es: Narciza, es una mujer de 40 años de edad, casada tiene 3 hijos, el mayor que ya es independiente, su hijo de 17 y su hija de 13 años que van al colegio, vive con ellos y con su esposo, ella es muy responsable en el negocio que tiene, que es la compra venta de joyas por catálogo. El sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente para sostener su hogar por lo que decidió iniciar hace 12 años con este negocio. Ella necesita el préstamo para abastecerse de productos y poder llegar a vender a mas clientes. Su meta a futuro es darles una buena educación a sus hijos y establecer un local comercial donde pueda vender sus joyas y ampliar su negocio y poder también vender ropa.
texts.en: Narciza, 40, is married and has 3 children.  Her 17-year old son and 13-year old daughter are in school and live at home.  Her oldest child is grown and lives away from the family.  Narciza operates a business buying and selling jewelry.  She started the business 12 years ago because her husband's income didn't stretch far enough to cover the family's expenses.  Narciza will use the loan to stock her business and attract more customers.  Her income from the business will support her children's schooling.  For the future, Narciza wants to expand her business and open a shop of her own.

loans.use: to stock her jewelry sales business.

loans.name: Mamdoh

texts.en:
Mamdoh is a 30-year-old single man from Deir Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family needs. So, he also works in transferring goods using his rickshaw. This helps him cover additional family expenses. 

Mamdoh took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products and transfer them to the local traders using his rickshaw. By taking this loan, Mamdoh will be able to increase his sales and also his income. Mamdoh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products and transfer them to the local traders using his rickshaw

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Albertina, la socia continua dedicándose a la ganadería y a la producción y venta  de leche, la socia Albertina lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca. 

La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Our member Albertina raises cattle as well as produces and sells milk. She has been in business for years, and her business is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She is a very responsible and persevering person and in this way she can help her family succeed. She seeks a loan to buy a cow.

Albertina is very thankful to KIVA for helping her grow her business and she promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food ingredients such as peppers, bitter ball (squash), Vita, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a used car for work.

loans.name: Bigle Nixe

texts.es:
Ella se llama Bigle Nixe, estudia administración en salud, va en segundo semestre, en el Instituto Educativo Campo Alto. Ella decidió estudiar esta carrera por que le gusta, le intriga mucho el área de la salud, es una buena parte para estudiar además da buenas opciones económicas que le favorecen mucho, además quiere estudiar para salir adelante y darle un buen futuro a la hija. 
Ella necesita el convenio con kiva ya que es madre cabeza de familia, vive sola con la hija, paga arriendo, servicios, mercado, colegio de la hija, en este momento no cuenta con el apoyo ni la ayuda de nadie.
texts.en:
Our member, Bigle Nixe, is a first-year student of health administration at Campo Alto college.  She says that she decided to study health administration because it is a subject that interests her and because it offers good prospects for a future career.  She wants to get ahead in the world for herself and her daughter.
Bigle Nixe hopes Kiva lenders will help her because she has no one else to depend on.  She is raising her daughter alone and is responsible for rent, her daughter's school fees and other costs.

loans.use: to pay college costs.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú y se dedica a la venta de artesania. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de artesanía y le va muy bien. Rosa es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

Rosa solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como chompas de alpaca.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in southern Peru and she sells artisan pieces. She has had this business selling artisan pieces for years and it is going very well. Rosa is a very responsible and persevering person as this is the way she can help her family succeed.

Rosa seeks a loan to buy merchandise such as sweaters made from alpaca wool.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sweaters made from alpaca wool.

loans.name: Najdi

texts.en:
Najdi is a 51-year-old married man from Deir Al-Balah city. He is a father of two sons and five daughters. He works as an employee in a local company where he earns a low income. He also has a minimarket where he sells food and candy for kids. This is a good business and earns a good income. 

Najdi took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to improve his minimarket by buying more products for his store to resell. By taking this loan, Najdi's income will increase and he will be able to improve the living conditions for his family. Najdi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to improve his minimarket by buying more products for his store to resell

loans.name: Señor De Muruhuay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Nohemy Yolanda ella es casada y tiene 65 años. La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas. 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de pan, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the SENOR DE MURUHUAY community bank live in Cusco province.

The featured member, Nohemi Yolanda, is 65-years old and married.  She operates a business raising and selling farm animals.  She fattens the animals and sells them in various local markets.  Her income from the business helped her to support her children and give them an extra leg up.  For the future, she would like to open a shop where she can sell her animals.  For now, she is applying for a loan that she will use to buy animals--guinea pigs and chickens--and animal feed.  

The bank's other members have a range of businesses from bread sales to restaurants.  

Nohemi Yolanda is grateful to all those who provide this form of lending and is committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy animals for her animals sales business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a married woman and has 7 kids who attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity or piped water. 

She has operated a taxi business for the past 2 years. She dreams of buying another car in the future. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to service her vehicle for business continuity. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to service her vehicle for business continuity

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has five children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

For the past three years, she has had a porridge-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby and also market people.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase a stock of flour and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, etc for her business.

loans.name: Nelson Mauricio

texts.es:
Nelson de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, opción mecánica automotriz en un instituto nacional, está soltero y vive con su madre y dos hermanos, es empleado en un taller automotriz y labora desde hace 1 año y 4 meses. Para llegar a su trabajo se va en bus y aproximadamente viaja 15 metros y el horario de trabajo es de 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Necesita del préstamo pues con él complementara un dinero para comprar un vehículo para transportarse al trabajo y realizar mandados  laborales o familiares, desea seguir trabajando para independizarse y en un futuro tener casa propia y formar una familia.
texts.en:
Nelson is 20 years old, completed high school and automechanic studies in a national institute. He is single and lives with his mother and two siblings. He is employed in a garage and has worked there for 1 year and 4 months. In order to arrive to work he takes the bus and travels approximately 15 kilometers. He works from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon.

He needs the loan as with the loan he will have enough money to buy a vehicle he can use to get himself to work and also do errands and odd jobs. He wishes to continue working to become self-supporting and in the future have his own home and start a family.

loans.use: to gather money and be able to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Dini

texts.en:
Dini runs a small stall where she sells groceries, snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Dini lives in West of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Dini is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Dini began working with Ruma two months ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last two months she has around $12 - 13 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es una joven emprendedora, dinámica y luchadora de 24 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como empleada de oficios varios en una empresa, pues por la falta de un título universitario y de experiencia laboral, sólo se pudo emplear en esta labor. Sin embargo, tiene muchos deseos de progresar y convertirse en una profesional íntegra y exitosa, por ello desea aprovechar la oportunidad que se le presentó para comenzar a vender productos por catálogo de una marca muy reconocida a nivel mundial, actividad que realizará de manera independiente y alterna a su empleo, con el fin de complementar los ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para luego invertir en su educación, pues su familia es muy humilde y no cuenta con los recursos para pagar los estudios universitarios.
Esto la impulsa a solicitar el crédito con el que comprará mercancía al por mayor (cremas corporales y faciales, suplementos dietarios, vitaminas, productos de aseo personal y para el hogar), así tendrá la posibilidad de comenzar con su nuevo proyecto productivo, ofreciendo variedad de artículos para atraer muchos clientes y tener buenas ventas.
Natalia manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es sacar adelante su negocio y ser totalmente independiente para así comenzar a realizar estudios universitarios y convertirse en una profesional y aplicar sus conocimientos para el crecimiento de su proyecto productivo y velar para que su familia tenga mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Natalia is a hard-working, dynamic, and determined young woman. She is 24 years old and works as an employee doing odd jobs for a business. As she doesn't have a university degree or work experience, she could only get this job. Nevertheless, she has a great desire to grow and become a successful professional. Therefore she wishes to take advantage of the opportunity that presented itself to begin selling globally well-known products by catalog, a business that she will do by herself along with her job, with the goal of using both incomes to support her home and save to then invest in her education as her family is very humble and doesn't have the economic resources to pay for university courses.

This has motivated her to seek a loan with which she will buy merchandise at wholesale such as body and face cream, dietary supplements, vitamins, personal care products and products for the home. In this way she will have the possibility of beginning her new project productively, offering a variety of items to attract many customers and have good sales.

Natalia indicates her primary goal is to have a successful business and be totally independent in order to then begin studying at the university and become a professional, applying her knowledge to grow her project productively and ensure that her family has better living conditions and well-being.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale (body and face cream, diet supplements, vitamins, and other personal and home products).

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en:
Rabab is a conservative person who prefer not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Rabab is a 33-year-old married woman from Deir Al-Balah city. She lives with her husband and three kids; one son and two daughters. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family needs. So, he also works in transferring goods using his rickshaw. This helps him to cover additional family expenses. 

Rabab took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy more products and resell to the local traders using his rickshaw. By taking this loan, Rabab's husband will be able to increase his sales and also his income.

loans.use: to help her husband to buy more products and resell to the local traders using his rickshaw

loans.name: Resti

texts.en:
Resti runs a small stall where she sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Resti lives in West of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Resti is single and living with four people in the family home. 

Resti began working with Ruma two months ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last two months, she has around $20 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Brenda Alicia

texts.es:
Brenda de 29 años de edad,  estudio solo sexto grado de primaria y es madre soltera, vive solo con sus hijos se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también a la agricultura, su primo le ayuda a desempeñar el trabajo de la agricultura, su primo le ayuda a desempeñar, el trabajo de la agricultura ya que desde hace unos cuatro años vio que su mamá se dedicaba a este tipo de labor y le iba bien, decidió también ella ponerlo en práctica.

Ella necesita el dinero para pagar alquiler de la  tierra y comprar abono y demás insumos para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 de frijol, a ella le gustaría que estudien sus hijos y sacaran una carrera universitaria aunque a ellos les gustaría aprender el trabajo de la agricultura.
texts.en:
Brenda, 29, left school after the sixth grade.  She is a single mother and lives with her children.  She makes a living working as a cleaner and farm worker.  She started farm work four years ago.  She saw that her mother was able to make a living at it and decided to give it a go.  Her cousin helps her with the work.

Brenda is applying for a loan that she will use to rent land and pay for the supplies she needs to maintain the business.  She plans to grow 7,000 square meters of maize and 3,500 square meters of beans.  Brenda wants her children to finish school and go on to college even though they say they would like to learn farm work.

loans.use: to rent land and buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Nabin

texts.en:
Nabin is 39 years old, a differently-able man who lives in a small village of Odisha, India with his parents and his brother. Currently he is the only earning person in his family and he owns a variety shop in a nearby market. Currently he is earning 3,000 INR per month which not sufficient for his family's monthly expenses as his father is ill, so he has to pay for a medical facility for his father.

Nabin has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 INR to purchase items like betel-making raw materials, cosmetic items and renovate  the showcase. He is very responsible and committed to paying back this loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase items like betel-making raw materials, cosmetic items and renovate  the showcase.

loans.name: Daitari

texts.en:
Daitari is 37-year-old differently able man living in the small village of Sonepur in the state of Odisha, India, with his wife and two children. His children go to school near his house. Daitari is engaged in a weaving activity. He weaves bed sheets, pillows, blankets, saris, etc. He earns 4,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from this activity. His wife helps him with the business.

Daitari has requested a loan of 25,000 INR to purchase weaving items, like thread, colours and embroidery, and to repair his weaving machine. He hopes to build a house for his family and also wants to educate his children as his children are very good in their studies.

loans.use: To purchase weaving items, like thread, colours and embroidery, and to repair his weaving machine.

loans.name: Silviya

texts.ru:
Сильвия продает женскую одежду на рынке. Она уже брала ранее кредиты в КИВЕ. С их помощью она смогла увеличить количество товаров на 10000 гривен.

В бизнесе возникли некоторые проблемы - упал спрос. Такое уже было раньши и Сильвия знает что, чтобы поддерживать уровень торговли нужно увиличить ассортимент, т.е. больше вкладывать денег, чтобы заработать, как и прежде.

Сильвия просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 15 000 гривен на закупку сезонного товара: блузы, штаны и юбки. Она хочет увеличить доход, чтобы оплачивать проживание и учебу сына в другом городе. Сильвия благодарна всем, кто помогает ей получить этот бизнес кредит.
texts.en: Silviya sells women's clothing at a market. She has already had loans from KIVA in the past. They helped her increase her amount of goods by 10,000 hryvnia. A few problems surfaced for the business - demand fell. This has happened before, and Silviya knows that to maintain the same level of sales she needs to expand her inventory and invest more money in order to earn the same as before. Silviya is asking for a 15,000 hryvnia loan to buy seasonal goods: shirts, pants, and skirts. She wants to increase income so that she can pay for the living expenses and education of her son in another city. Silviya is grateful to everyone who helps her obtain this business loan.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing items for resale

loans.name: San Francisco De Asis De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN FRANCISCO DE ASIS DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Nelly ella es conviviente y tiene 35 años y tiene 2 hijos. La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y también la socia vende productos secos como maíz, trigo y cebada y también la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de pan, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the SAN FRANCISCO DE ASIS DE URUBAMBA community bank in Urubamba province.

The featured member, Nelly, 35, is married and has 2 children.  She operates a farming business, buying and selling animals and growing maize, wheat and barley.  She fattens the animals--guinea pigs and chickens--and sells them in various local markets.  The business provides her a way to support her children and help them get ahead in the world.  For the future, she would like to open a shop where she can sell her animals.  Nelly is applying for a loan that she will use to buy animals and animal feed.  Nelly was unable to join the other members for the group photo and we have added a separate photo of her in the lower left-hand corner of the group photo.

The bank's other members operate a range of businesses from animals sales to restaurants. 

Nelly is grateful to all those who make this form of lending possible and says that she is committed to repaying your loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy animals for her animals sales business.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia, who is a 45-year-old married woman, lives in the village of Likhauri. She has a husband and three children. Maia's husband works as an artisan and generates 250 GEL (Georgia laris) per month. Maia works hard on family-owned agricultural land, where maize, nuts, mandarin and kiwi are grown. Maia uses these products for local trading and has a small income. 

As a parent, she can't meet all the increased needs of her children, and Maia plans to start another activity. She has already purchased stock of used clothing, and now, with the requested money, she will buy additional products and have money for working capital. Maia will attact more clients and get more profit with the increased assortment of used clothing. She relies on the goodwill of lenders and will be grateful for those giving her a chance to generate more income.

loans.use: To start trading used clothing

loans.name: Panalal

texts.en:
Panalal is a 31-year-old differently able man who lives in a small village in Odisha, India, with his wife, a son, parents and a brother. Panalal is engaged in paddy [rice] cultivation and also owns a grocery shop near his house. His wife and his brother help him in this activity. He earns 7,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from these activities. He is a very hardworking and responsible man as he has taken on all the family responsibilities alone.

Panalal has requested a loan of 50,000 INR to purchase high quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and to renovate his grocery shop. He hopes to make a good amount of money from this investment. He is very thankful to Kiva for this kind help.

loans.use: To purchase high quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and to renovate his grocery shop.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru: Людмила уже несколько раз пользовалась КИВА кредитами и считает их очень выгодными для своего бизнеса. В прошлый раз благодаря КИВА кредиту Людмила увеличила объем продаваемого товара и получила дополнительную прибыль. Сейчас Людмила хочет закупить сезонный товар - искусственные цветы, которые хорошо продаются весной. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить быт своей семьи. Людмила просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 21,000 гривен. Людмила всегда ответственно относится к выплатам и выплачивает их вовремя.
texts.en: Ludmila has used KIVA loans several times and considers them very helpful to her business. Last time, thanks to a KIVA loan Ludmila  increased the quantity of goods she has for sale and earned additional income. Now Ludmila wants to buy seasonal goods - artificial flowers, which sell well in spring. She hopes to earn additional income and improve life for her family. Ludmila is asking for a 21,000 hryvnia loan. Ludmila takes repayment seriously and always repays loans responsibly and on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy nació en la ciudad de Lima pero actualmente vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú, ella se dedica al empaquetado de materiales de limpieza. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como jaboncillo y otras cosas mas. Agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo y se compromete a cumplir con pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Lucy was born in the city of Lima and today lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in southern Peru. She has a business packaging cleaning supplies. She has had this business for a few years and it is going well. At this time she needs a loan to buy materials for work such as soap and other items. She is thankful to the investors for the loan and is happy for the support. She promises to make her payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business such as soap and other items.

loans.name: La Retama Group

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal LA RETAMA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Mónica  tiene 28 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, colonias, entre otros, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los demás socios se dedican la venta de artesanía, venta de comida, brindando el servicio de taxi, docentes, guía de turismo, imprenta, agencia de viajes .
texts.en:
This lending club member belongs to LA RETAMA, a bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Monica, 28, lives with her partner and has two children. She combines her daily household activities with her business selling beauty products like perfumes, colognes and other things. She sells to customers by order, and things are going well thanks to the determination that she puts into her business every day. She is responsible and determined, and this business is how she helps her family to get ahead.

Monica asks for a loan to buy perfumes for her business. She is grateful for the credit given to her and promises to make the established payments.

The group members in the attached picture asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work obligations. The other members of the group work in artisan crafts, food sales, taxi services, education, tourism, printing and travel agencies.

loans.use: to buy perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Kadriye

texts.en:
Kadriye lives with her daughter. When she separated from her husband, she started her own business – a hair salon – with a microloan. She continues to use loans. She has started doing waxing and epilation at her salon. She buys bulk goods to earn more. Her work is taking a leap forward. With this loan, she will buy bulk dye, wax and other things she needs for her store. Kadriye is a driven woman who enjoys work.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Kadriye Hanım  kızı  birlikte yaşıyor.  Eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra işini kurabildi.  Kuaför dükkanı var. İşini   mikro kredi ile kurdu.  Kredi kullanmaya devam ediyor.kuaför dükkanında ağda ve epilasyon yapmaya başladı.  Toplu mal  alıyor.  Daha fazla kazanıyor.  İşinde büyük aşama kaydetti.  Şimdi kullanacağı kredi ile  toplu boya,ağda ve dükkanı için gerekli  malzemeler alacak.  Kadriye hanım çalışmayı seven ve hırslı bir bayan.

loans.use: to buy bulk dye, wax and other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more locks, hinges, door catches, etc., to expand her business

loans.name: Belgin

texts.en:
Belgin is married and has two children. She struggled for years doing small jobs for little money. Now, the small, low-paying jobs won’t suffice for her daughter to go to college. She began to look for a different job where she could earn more. While continuing her knitting work, she also began to sell cosmetics and linens. Because she needed capital, she applied to Maya. She will use the loan to buy products and supplies. Asked about her skills, Belgin says she is well known locally and hardy.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Belgin Hanım, evli ve 2 çocuğu var.Küçük işler yaparak,az para kazandıran  işlerle uğraşmış yıllarca.  Ancak,kızı üniversitede okuduğu için, küçük işler ve az para yetmemeye başlamış.  Bu arada daha farklı daha iyi para kazandıran iş araştırmasına girmiş.  El örgülerine devam ederken kozmetik ve çamaşır işine başlamış.  Sermaye ihtiyacı olunca,mayaya başvurmuş.  Mal ve malzeme alabilmek için Maya’dan kredi almış.
Belgin hanım,yeteneklerini konuşturan,çevresinde iyi tanınan yürekli bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy products and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an electric iron-box and shoe-making accessories.

loans.name: Leonid

texts.ru:
Леонид занимается уборками в домах, квартирах, чисткой подушек, одеял, ковров. Орендует помещение в центре города под офис. Туда люди приносят ковры для чиски, подушки для чистки и переделки добавление пера, замена ткани. Занимается клининговым бизнесом уже  5 лет.

Леонид женат, у него трое маленьких детей - три дочери: Кристина (5 лет), Есения (2 года), Полина (1 год). Леодин дорожит своей семьей и делает все что в его силах, чтобы обеспечивать свою семьи всем необходимым. 

Леонид хочет расширять свой бизнес. Для этого Леонид планирует закупить дополнительное клининговое оборудование: мини мойка, резервуары для воды, мини мойка высокого давления, пр. Леонид просит предоставить ему кредит 30,000 гривен.
texts.en: Leonid cleans homes and apartments, pillows, blankets and rugs. He rents a place in the city center for an office. People bring him rugs for cleaning, and pillows for cleaning and re-filling or to change the fabric. He has been in the cleaning business for five years. Leonid is married and has three young children - three daughters: Kristina (5 years), Yeseniya (2 years), and Polina (1 year). Leonid values his family and does everything in his power to provide them with what they need. Leonid wants to expand his business. To do so he plans to buy additional cleaning supplies: mini washers, water tanks, high pressure mini washers, etc. Leonid is asking for a 30,000 hryvnia loan.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his cleaning business

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en: Mwanalima appreciates the previous support of her Kiva loan. She is now requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to add stock of wheat flour, beans, maize flour and other food ingredients to her business.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat flour, beans, maize flour and other food ingredients to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to use instead of the old one

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en: Mwatime gives thanks for the help of the Kiva loan. She appreciates it very much, and again, she is requesting another loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy wheat flour, sugar, salt and other food consumables for her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, salt and other food consumables for her business.

loans.name: Alba Gloria

texts.es:
Alba de 21 años de edad,  estudió hasta  6º grado debido a los escasos recursos económicos abandonó la escuela, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja haciendo ladrillos en una ladrillera, tiene dos hijos y uno está en la escuela y nadie mas vive con ellos.

Ella  se dedica desde hace 2 años a vender tortillas y dice que fue la necesidad que la llevó al negocio, antes trabajaba como domestica, pero al acompañarse dejó de trabajar y para ayudar a su pareja en los gastos del hogar puso una venta de tortillas, su jornada comienza a las 4:30 AM pues tiene que coser el maíz y a las 8:30 AM lo lleva al molino porque a las 10:00 AM ya hay clientes esperando, su jornada termina a las 5:00 PM, ella comenta que lo hace con muchas ganas pues su deseo es que no le falte nada a su familia.


El préstamo será invertido para mejorar la vivienda donde vive, pues ya no le sirve la lamina y la madera. Comprara 2 docenas de laminas y madera para cambiar el techo.

Sus metas son,  instalar un comedor, que sus hijos se preparen en el estudio ya que ella no pudo, con la ganancia espera pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Alba, 21, left school after the 6th grade because her family didn't have enough money for her to continue.  She is partnered now and has two children, one of whom has started school.  Alba's partner earns a living making bricks.  She has operated a food business for 2 years, making and selling tortillas.  She used to work as a cleaner, but she quit after she met her partner so that she could work at home.  She started the food business because it was a way to both work at home and generate an extra income too.

Alba starts her day at 4:30am because she has to prepare maize for milling by 8:30am in order to deliver tortillas to her waiting customers at 10:00am.  Her day only ends at 5:00pm.  She says that she has many hopes, but her dearest hope is that her family have everything they need.  She is applying for a loan that she use to buy materials for making repairs to the family's house.

The investment will cover wood and roofing materials for replacing the roof.  In the future, Alba wants to add a dining room.

Alba expects her earnings to cover the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy materials for house repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Lyuba

texts.ru:
Люба вдова. Она уже брала ранее кредиты в КИВА. Люба смогла увеличить доход на 1000 гривен с помощью предыдущего кредита.

Со времени предыдущего кредита в семье Любы произошли изменения. Один из сыновей  Любы женился, а вот  младший все еще живет с мамой и помогает ей по дому.

Любовь просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20 000 гривен на ремонт фасада здания. Она очень хочет, наконец, закончить ремонт дома и таким образом улучшить свои жилищные условия.
texts.en: Lyuba is a widow. She has taken loans from KIVA before. Lyuba was able to increase her income by 1000 hryvnia with the help of the previous loan. Since the time of her previous loan some changes have taken place with her family. One of Lyuba's sons married, while the younger still lives with his mother and helps her around the house. Lyuba is asking for a loan of 20,000 hryvnia to repair the outside of her house. She very much wants to finally finish repairs to the house and thus improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to fix the outside of her house

loans.name: Maryana

texts.ru:
Маряна замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет свой бизнес.
 
Маряна имеет большой участок земли и две теплицы.  Она выращивает цветы в горшках. В бизнесе задействована ее семья. Также Маряна торгует детской одеждой на рынке, чтобы получать дополнительный доход.  Во время сезона работы в теплицах, на рынке торгует продавец.

Маряна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20000 гривен на закупку семян, пленки, удобрений и дров. Со временем Марьяна по-прежнему планирует построить дома еще одну дополнительную теплицу для расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Maryana is married. She has two children. She runs her own business. Maryana has a large piece of land and two greenhouses. She raises flowers in pos. Her family takes part in the business. Maryana also sells children's clothing at the market to earn additional income. During the season for work in the greenhouse, a seller does the market sales. Maryana is asking for a 20,000 hryvnia loan to buy seeds, film, fertilizer, and firewood. In time Maryana intends to build another greenhouse on her property to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, film, fertilizers and firewood

loans.name: Marlon Jonnathan

texts.es:
Marlon  de 27 años de edad, estudió  hasta 9º grado debido a la pobreza tuvo que abandonarla escuela, está casado y su esposa vende platos típicos, tiene 3 hijos y uno está en la escuela y nadie mas vive con ellos.


Marlon se dedica a ala venta de CD desde hace 7 años y comenta que la necesidad lo llevó a vender, dice que comenzó comprando 50 CD, luego 100, hoy en día cuenta con 400, antes los compraba en la capital del país, pero hoy los compra en en una ciudad más cercana, para ir a traerlos  toma un busque lo lleva a la Ciudad, en su recorrido hace una hora, luego compra y regresa, él tiene un pequeño puesto en la calle y ahí vende todo el día, todas las mañanas traslada su venta en una bicicleta y por la tarde la vuelve a llevar, esa es su rutina diaria, pero dice que cada mañana él se levanta siempre alegre y positivo que le va a ir bien en su negocio, todo lo hace por su familia que son lo mas importante para él.


El crédito será invertido en la compra de más CD de música más variada, para mejorar el negocio, pues hay producto que le buscaban y él no lo tiene y necesita comprar un bafle para probar sus CD.

Desea construir un local seguro, ya no estar trasladando todos los días la venta, que sus hijos logren prepararse en una profesión, comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa( actualmente vive en casa ajena) y pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Marlon is 27 years old and completed 9th grade, abandoning school due to poverty. He is married and his wife sells traditional prepared dishes. He has three children and one is in school, and no one else lives with them.

Marlon has been selling CDs for 7 years and he says that need drove him to his business. He says that he began selling 50 CDs, then 100, and today he has 400. Previously he bought them in the capital city but today he buys them in a nearby city to bring them to his city, a trip that takes an hour. He then buys and returns to his city. He has a small stand in the street and there he sells every day. Every morning he rides his bicycle and in the afternoon he returns. This is his daily routine, but he says that every morning he gets up always happy and positive that his business will go well, and everything he does for his family is the most important to him.

The loan will be used to invest in buying a variety of CDs in improve his business, as there are products that his customers seek that he doesn't have. He also needs to buy a loudspeaker to test his CDs.

He wishes to construct a secure locale so he doesn't have to move inventory every day. He wishes that his children study for a professional career, and he wants to buy land and construct his own home (today he lives in someone else's home) and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of music CDs and a music speaker to test his CDs.

loans.name: Chitaranjan

texts.en:
Chitaranjan is a 24-year-old differently able man living in a small village in Odisha, India, with his parents and two younger sisters, who are going for schooling. Chitaranjan has owned a grocery shop for the last 5 years. He earns 4,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from this activity. He sells daily household consumables and cosmetic items. He is a very hardworking and responsible man. His father helps him in this business sometimes. His father is a farmer who cultivates paddy [rice] and vegetables.

Chitaranjan has requested a loan of 25,000 INR to purchase rice, edible oil, biscuits, flour, sugar, etc. He hopes to make a handsome profit after this investment, and he is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this help.

loans.use: To purchase rice, edible oil, biscuits, flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has 7 kids who attend school. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a tailoring business for the past 3 years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents and she dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase 8 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 8 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en: Magnolia is a 46-year-old married woman, and a mother of four children, from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband runs a key duplicating business. Magnolia is a coconut wine distributor. She is also engaged in retail sales of cosmetic products like perfume, make up, lotion and toiletries. She buys from her trusted supplier, then delivers to her regular customers. Magnolia is asking for a loan to buy more cosmetic products to sell to her customers, and containers for her coconut wine business. Magnolia hopes to make her businesses successful.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell and containers for her coconut wine business.

loans.name: Lesly Argentina

texts.es:
Lesly es una joven de 26 años de edad, su educación es de primaria completa gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio de sus padres quienes le apoyaron para que pudiese estudiar y tener el conocimiento básico, no pudo continuar por problemas económicos ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos. Ella está casada y su esposo trabaja como productor de café. De su matrimonio tienen tres hijos menores, el primer hijo está en cuarto grado, el segundo hijo está en primer grado y el ultimo está en el kinder todos por la gracia de Dios estudian. Su único medio de ingreso es el trabajo de campo ya que toda su familia se dedica a este rubro y en la actualidad en su matrimonio no es la diferencia. Por más de 2 años han cultivado café y granos básicos (maíz y frijol) pero estos únicamente para el consumo del hogar. Su mercado es local ya que venden el grano de café a las diferentes bodegas de la zona. El terreno que cultivan es propio el cual está ubicado en la misma propiedad donde está construida su casa de habitación por lo que se le facilita dar el mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos.
Sus metas, esperanzas y sueños mejorar su calidad de vida, poder brindar de forma completa la educación a sus hijos para que puedan superarse y ser mejores hombres cada día. Hoy en día Lesly solicita se le apoye para la  compra de insumos como fertilizantes, abono entre otros ya que tiene la fe de que pueda ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA para poder resolver su necesidad de poder brindar la asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Lesly, 26, left school after the sixth grade.  Her parents sacrificed a lot for her to get even that far, but they weren't able to pay for her to continue.  She is married now and has three young children: sons in the fourth grade, the first grade and kindergarten, respectively.  She is thankful, she says, that her children can go to school.  Lesly's husband makes a living growing and selling coffee.  The main source of income here is farm work.  Everyone in Lesly's family makes their living from farming, she and her husband too.  They grow maize and beans for their own use and coffee for sale.  They have grown coffee for 2 years and sell what they harvest to local buyers.  Lesly and her husband own the land where they plant their crops and live in a house on the land.

Lesly has many hopes and dreams for a better life.  She wants her children to finish school so that they have easier lives than she has had and she wants them to be good men.  For now, she wants your help to buy the supplies she needs--fertilizer, manure, etc.--to carry on her coffee farming business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer dinámica, carismática y espontánea, que le gusta servir a la gente.  A sus 56 años de edad, es madre de un hijo y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo.
Hace más de 9 años comenzó a desempeñarse como comerciante independiente, inicialmente vendía pollo despresado y luego comenzó a vender mercancía por catálogo, obteniendo muy buenos resultados, pues tiene muy buena clientela; así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para brindar educación y sustento a su hijo.
