El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de surtido de contado (cremas corporales, cosméticos, accesorios, perfumería), esto le permitirá obtener descuentos por pago de contado y de esta forma podrá brindarle crédito a algunos clientes, ampliando la posibilidad de incrementar las ventas.
Luz, con su empuje y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para avanzar y cumplir el sueño de darle permanencia en el tiempo a su actividad generadora de recursos, con los que podrá continuar brindándole educación y una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Luz is a dynamic, charismatic and spontaneous woman who likes to take care of people. 56 years old, she is the mother of one son and the head of her household since she separated from her husband. For more than 9 years she as worked as an independent merchant. She started out selling chicken in parts, and later started selling catalog merchandise with very good results. She has a good clientele, by which she has generated enough resources to take care of her son and pay for his education.

She will invest her loan in the purchase of products like body creams, cosmetics, accessories, and perfumes. This will allow her to get discounts by paying in cash, so that she can give credit to some of her clients and increase her possibilities for sales. Luz, with her drive and tenacity, wants to keep fighting to get ahead and achieve her dream of giving her business permanence, so that she can keep educating her son and giving him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a stock of body creams, cosmetics, accessories and perfume.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with 5 children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a food kiosk business selling food including maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned high cost and seasonality as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase slippers, rice, and soap for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes, bread, soap, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Natalia Andrea

texts.es:
Natalia, a sus 30 años de edad, es madre de un hijo  de 10 años y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo.
Durante 4 años de su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en diferentes restaurantes y cafeterías, donde adquirió la experiencia y el conocimiento sobre el manejo de este tipo de negocios, esto la impulsó para tomar la decisión de independizarse y montar su propio restaurante, desde hace un año cuenta con el apoyo de una empleada directa; así ha logrado mejorar los ingresos para brindarle educación y sustento a su hijo.
Con la ayuda del crédito, podrá comprar surtido e insumos (verduras, carnes, granos, gaseosas), esto le permitirá tener materia prima disponible para elaborar los alimentos y así satisfacer los gustos de sus comensales, logrando aumentar las ventas e ingresos.
Natalia, con su tenacidad y espíritu de superación, quiere seguir luchando para consolidar su negocio y en un futuro desea tener la capacidad de montar otras sucursales para mejorar la rentabilidad y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida, educación y bienestar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Natalia is 30 years old and mother to a 10 year old son. She is the head of the household since she separated from her husband. For the past 4 years she has worked in different restaurants and cafeterias, where she gained experience and knowledge about operating these types of businesses. This inspired her to make the decision to become independent and open her own restaurant. Over the past year she has had the support of one employee. In this way she has been able to improve her income to provide an education for and support her son.

With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy stock and supplies (vegetables, meat, grains, soda pop), which will also provide her ingredients readily available for preparing food and in this way satisfy the needs of her customers, resulting in an increase in sales and income.

Natalia, with her tenacity and spirit to succeed, wants to continue fighting to build her business and in the future she wishes to have the ability to open other branches to improve profitability and guaranteed a better quality of life, education and well-being for her son.

loans.use: to buy stock and supplies (vegetables, meats, grains, soda pop).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre trabajador y pujante, a sus 28 años de edad ya es propietario de su propio negocio, un taller de confección que inició hace aproximadamente 8 años, el oficio lo aprendió por medio de su madre, quien toda su vida se dedicó a esta labor, inició colaborándole a ella y poco tiempo después heredó algunas máquinas con lo que logró independizarse, poco a poco fue adquiriendo buenos clientes y con los ingresos que obtenía compró otras máquinas, así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos básicos del hogar.
Su principal motivación es poder hacer crecer su negocio, esto lo impulsa para solicitar el crédito como un apoyo para comprar una máquina ojaladora, así podrá aumentar su capacidad instalada y logrará agilizar y optimizar el tiempo de producción, con el fin de cumplir con las entregas oportunas a sus clientes y abrirse camino para obtener nuevos contratos.
Juan manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es llegar a confeccionar prendas de su línea propia y lograr comercializarlas para así generar mayor rentabilidad, con lo que podrá seguir reinvirtiendo en su negocio y disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is hardworking and strong. At 28 years old, he is already the owner of his own business, a sewing workshop that he started about 8 years ago. He learned the trade from his mother who has worked in it all her life. He started out collaborating with her, and soon after he inherited some machines which allowed him to become independent. Little by little he acquired good customers and with the profits he bought other machines. He now makes enough income to cover the basic costs of his home.

His main motivation is to be able to grow his business, which is what pushed him to ask for a loan in order to buy a holemaking machine. This way he can increase his capacity and will be able to speed up and optimize production time, with the goal of completing orders for his customers and opening the door for new contracts.

Juan says that his greatest wish is to be able to make his own line of garments and sell them to generate more profits, with which he can reinvest in his business and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a hole-making machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice, who owns a hotel in central market, lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a single mother charged with the responsibility of looking after two children. She started this business to improve on her welfare and provide her children with basic needs. Despite challenges such as customers who don’t pay on time, she dreams of expanding her business into new markets. Joice intends to use the loan to buy more products like beans, sugar and cooking oil to use in her hotel.

loans.use: to buy more products like beans, sugar and cooking oil to use in her hotel.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a hardworking single parent with two children and lives in Hoima, Uganda. She owns a hotel where she gets daily income supplemented by extra income for outside catering services. She ventured into this business to improve on her welfare and educate her children. She faces a difficulty of bad debtors yet she wants to re-invest the income into her business. She has a vision of having a well-established and high standard hotel in town. Sarah has asked for a loan to purchase food such as bananas and rice to use in her hotel.

loans.use: to purchase food such as bananas and rice to use in her hotel.

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.en: Muhamadi is 59 years old, with six children and lives in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in produce, mainly maize and beans. To supplement his income, he also owns a bar and does farming. He faces a problem of bad roads that make delivery of the produce to his customers difficult. His dream is to build a mosque for his fellow Muslim community. Muhamadi needs the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Jehová Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: Este grupo esta conformado por 4 integrantes, todas se dedican al comercio, aunque venden diferentes productos como: perfumes, ropa interior, maquillaje y demás artículos personales. La mayoría son jefas de hogar con ganas de superarse y salir adelante gracias a su actividad productiva. Doña Ana es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 53 años de edad, su actividad es la venta de productos de catalogo, que distribuye a las diferentes vecinas y empresas de la zona, ha logrado consolidar una cartera de clientas amplia, por lo que desea este crédito para continuar invirtiendo en los pedidos que le realizan. Gracias a esta actividad ella paga los estudios de su hijo menor y un nieto que esta cuidando, genera ingresos al hogar de manera independiente ya que en la zona no hay suficientes fuentes de empleo. Ella desea continuar con su actividad y en un futuro ofrecer diferentes productos desde su casa sin necesidad de esperar que llegue el pedido 10 días después. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la facilidad de los tramites y baja tasa de interés.
texts.en: This group consists of 4 members, all of whom are dedicated to sales, though they sell different products such as: perfume, lingerie and underwear, makeup and other personal articles. The majority are heads of household with the desire to succeed and be successful thanks to their productive activity. Ana is the president of the group, is 53 years old, and she sells items by catalog that she distributes to different neighbors and businesses in the area. She has been able to gather a good customer base, so she seeks a loan to continue investing in the orders that they make from her. Thanks to this work she pays for her youngest son's schooling and supports a grandchild who she cares for, generating household income in an independent manner for in her geographic area there aren't many sources of work. She wishes to continue with this work and in the future offer different products fro her home without having to wait for the items to arrive 10 days after the initial order. She selected Fundación Mujer for its processes and low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is 56 years old with three children living in Hoima, Uganda. She operates a restaurant alongside rentals where she gets additional income. As a loving parent, she dreams of finishing the construction of a boys’ quarters for her children although she is challenged by tenants who don’t pay her on time. Constance is requesting a loan to buy materials like sand and cement to finish her boys’ quarters.

loans.use: to buy materials like sand and cement to finish her boys’ quarters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coal, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of used clothes to add to his current stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her business

loans.name: Twiga Group

texts.en:
Zawadi is a mother of three kids who are in school.  She is in her late twenties and single.  For one year now, Zawadi has been managing her family by running a food stall, called a mamalishe.  A business commonly known in Tanzania for being used by lower class income to earn money.  Her business is open from 6 am to 11 pm per working day and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This is Zawadi's first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania.  Zawadi will use this loan to buy utensils like cups, sauce pans, plates and food ingredients for business purposes.  She dreams in the coming years that she will be able to buy a private car and build a daycare and primary school.  She will share this loan with her loan group "TWIGA" which consists of five members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy utensils like cups, sauce pans, plates and food ingredients for business purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair so she can expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cold water, body spray and other products.

loans.name: Mosoq Ñusta Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MOSOQ ÑUSTA,  él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Pisaq, provincia de Calca y departamento Cusco.
La socia Hilda tiene 59 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cabinas de internet, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de sus maquinas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican  a la venta de artesania, venta de chicha, tienda de abarrotes, restaurante, panadería, transporte, moto taxi.
texts.en:
The featured member belongs to the communal bank MOSOQ ÑUSTA, located in the Pisaq district, Calca province, Cusco department. Hilda is 59 years old and has 4 children and is married. She alternates between her daily chores with an internet cabins business. Her business has been going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She is a responsible and hard-working member, and she wishes to be able to continue working and in this way supporting her family.

Hilda seeks a loan to do maintenance on her machines. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her established payments.

The other members of the group sells artisan items, chicha, a grocery store, restaurant, bakery, transportation, and motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to do maintenance on machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dry goods such rice, magi cub, candle, toothpaste, flour, sugar, oil, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Manowara

texts.en:
Manowara is 41 years old and lives in the village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She could not attend school due to the lack of financial resources.  She is married and has one son. Her husband Monirudfin, 57 years old, is also uneducated.  They live in their own kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw).

Manowara’s husband has worked in agriculture all of his life.  His father taught him how to work in the fields. He grows vegetables and sells at the local markets. But these days, it is not sufficient to cover all the expenses.  He is looking for a way to improve his family's conditions.

Thus, Manowara has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS, to purchase dairy cows to start a milk supply business. She wants to buy two dairy cows with the loan. She is a very energetic and hardworking woman.  She plans to sell the milk in her locality, which will provide more profit.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase dairy cows to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Doña María tiene 48 años de edad solo curso el sexto grado ya que cuando ella estudio no habían muchas opciones para lograr seguir con sus estudios, sin embargo sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. Ella tiene 2 hijos quienes estudian en diferentes grados en la escuela de la comunidad. Su fuente de ingreso es el rubro del café actividad que por generaciones tanto en la familia de su esposo como en la de ella han llevado a cabo y hoy en día no es la excepción ya que por más de 8 años en compañía de su esposo su familia trabaja la siembra y cultivo de café y alguna hortalizas únicamente para el consumo de su hogar. Doña María agradece a Dios porque su tierra es productora ubicada en la misma comunidad donde ella habita a la cual se traslada a más de 10 kilómetros en el autobús de la comunidad. 
El mayor sueño de doña María es graduar a sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro, y la mayor meta es que su negocio crezca diversificar sus productos para no depender únicamente del café y eso lo lograra mejorando su cultivo actual para poder por medio de las ganancias poco a poco ir logrando sus metas. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el propósito de comprar insumos agrícolas para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café para esta nueva temporada.
texts.en:
María, 48, only finished 6th grade since when she was in school there weren't many opportunities for continuing her studies. However, her parents taught her to work the land from a young age. She now has two children of her own who are in school in their community. She makes her income from coffee, a trade that has been in her family, as well as her husband's, for generations. They have carried on the trade for more than 8 years, planting and cultivating coffee as well as some vegetables just for their household. Maria thanks God because her land is productive and is located in the same community where she lives, about a 10km bus ride.

Maria's dream is for her children to graduate so that they can have a better future, and her goal is for her business to grow and diversify so that she isn't dependent only on coffee. She will achieve this by improving her current crop and earning profits which little by little she will use to reach her goals.

Because of this, she has asked for a loan from the cooperative COMIXMUL with the goal of buying agricultural inputs to maintain her coffee crops for this new season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to help with maintaining her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, margi, pepper, tomatoes, etc. from a wholesale market to add to her current inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a bale or two of used clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggs wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel lives in Kericho, a very rich tea-growing area in the South Rift in Kenya. He is married and has four children, all of school-going age. He has been farming for over 20 years and his income comes from selling milk, eggs and tea. He also has a retail business. In farming, he loves milking his dairy cow, but his major challenge is insufficient funds.

Samwel chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because their loans are offered at a very low interest rate. This loan will enable him to educate his children more because of the extra income he will get from the dairy cow. There will be an improvement in their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.en: Maria Celia is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is trying hard to provide for their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. She is in the agriculture business, growing and selling bananas with the support of her husband, who purchases additional bananas for her to sell in bulk in the market. Through this, she earns a good amount of income to support the household expenditures. In order to increase her sales in the near future, she has requested a loan to buy organic fertilizer and to pay banana replanting costs.  She expects this to boost her earnings and profits. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to pay banana replanting costs

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Kericho, a very rich tea-growing area in the South Rift of Kenya. He is married and has four children, all of school-going age. He has been farming for over 25 years and his income comes from selling milk, eggs and tea. He also has a retail business. In farming, he loves looking after his animals, but his major challenge is feeding the animals.

John chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because their loans are offered at a very low interest rate. This loan will enable him to educate his children more because of the extra income he will get from the dairy cow. There will be an improvement in their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair his butcher shop and put tiles and aluminum door.

loans.name: Bishakha

texts.en:
Bishakha is a 32-year-old woman.  She is a housewife who is illiterate and only knows how to sign her name.  She is married to Nabakumar and together they are raising two children (one son and one daughter).  Both are getting an education and read in grades 9 and 7. Bishakha's husband is also uneducated and only knows how to sign his name.  They live in their own house in Netajipara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Bishakha's husband is engaged in a clothing business.  He buys clothing (saris, frocks, shirts etc) from the wholesale market and sells them to his neighbors.  He has been running this business from his house for the last 10 years. He is completely dedicated to his job.  Bishakha assists her husband in this business.
 
But now Bishakha and her husband want to expand their business by increasing their stock and purchasing more varieties of clothing to fulfill the needs of their customers.  But they don't have sufficient capital.

Bishakha has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase more clothing to help her husband and to expand the business.  She estimates that this loan will help her satisfy her customers' demands and, with the profit, she will be able to cover the basic needs of her family.  She is hoping to give her children a better education to be successful in life. Her plans for the future are to maintain her business and build a concrete-made house for the family.

Her full thanks go to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Chhaleya

texts.en:
Chhaleya is a rural woman. She is from the remote village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married, 47 years old, and a housewife. Both Chhaleya and her husband are uneducated and can only sign their names. She and her husband are raising three school-going children (one son and two daughters). They are in grade 12, grade 10 and grade 3. They have a kachha house (a house which is made of straw, mud and bamboo.)

Chhaleya's husband is a farmer who has been involved in land cultivation for many years. Specifically, he cultivates potatoes and green vegetables. Chhaleya, though mainly a housewife, helps her husband after managing the household jobs. They give hard labour to grow good quality vegetables to satisfy their customers. They sell their produce to local wholesalers. They are very enthusiastic about running their business in a sustainable way to ensure a good income for the family. Now they have decided to expand their agribusiness by cultivating more potatoes to earn more profit in order to cope with the day-to-day price increases in necessary products.

Chhaleya heard about Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) and has taken out a loan from them. She wants to utilize the loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers. She hopes this will enable her to make additional profit to help the family get over the financial hurdles they are facing at present. She will be able to give proper education to the children to be established in life and will also be able to improve her farm and continue her agribusiness.

She is very much thankful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy machines and do maintenance on machines she already owns.

loans.name: Suvra

texts.en:
Suvra is a 37-year-old housewife, and there are three members in her family, her husband and one daughter. Her husband, Utpal, is 39 years old.  Suvra completed her education up to grade 12, whereas her husband is illiterate and can only sign his name. Their only daughter is in grade 4. They have their own house in the small town of Dhupguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Suvra’s husband cultivates different crops on their own small piece of land. He has been working with agriculture for many years and produces beans, onions and other seasonal vegetables for the family's consumption and to sell in the local markets. 

The small income of Suvra’s husband is not sufficient to get over the financial hurdles of their family, so she decided to start cultivating potatoes on their land. For this she needs capital, which they do not have, so she applied for the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing potato seeds and fertilizers. 

She hopes the profit that will be generated from their new business will meet the financial needs of their family, as well as help her to give her child a better education. She hopes to upgrade their financial condition and dreams to purchase a mini-tractor for her agricultural use.

Suvra is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for this financial support.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Maravy

texts.en:
Maravy is a 23-year-old young man who is single and eager to get ahead. He has been studying law for four years and also helps his mother selling breakfast in his free time. He will use the loan to pay for his second semester and buy a computer that he needs in order to do his thesis at the end of his course for a degree. He has been saving for a long time to be able to do so.

Maravy’s dream is to become a successful lawyer, and he wishes to financially help his parents when they become older. He is very happy and grateful for the loan funded via the program like Kiva to enable poor students to pursue a higher level of education while contributing to the future development of Cambodia. Maravy is pictured with his mother in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for his second semester and buy a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large and wide quantity of cosmetics to add to his current stock for sale

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is married and is a mother of three who operates a piggery business. She also had a retail store selling groceries in their village to earn a living.

For three years, she earned enough to support her family's needs and her children's education. She joined GDMPC and she has gained access to micro- finance services. She borrowed a loan to buy feed and additional piglets. 

She plans to improve the shelter to use it for her piggery expansion. She wants to improve her business to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat is a 61-year-old married woman and a widowed mother of three children living with her in a rural commune of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. For more than 30 years, she has been in the agriculture business growing and selling rice in the local market, and she earns income for the family, which is vital for them.

Phat has applied for a loan to drill a well and build water storage to ensure there is enough water for her family's daily consumption. She is hoping that with the well, she won’t face a water shortage in the future or she won't need to spend much time collecting water from the far-distant areas, so that she can pay more attention to her business and earn more income to support her family. She is very thankful to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to drill a well and build water storage to ensure enough water for the daily consumption of her family.

loans.name: Ma. Aurita

texts.en:
This is Ma. Aurita, 41, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. Her partner is Mark and they have a child. She, together with her partner, manages their household while operating the business. She and her partner work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Ma. Aurita maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands, such as Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is paid for in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 37,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Ma. Aurita dreams of having her own store for her products and hopes to give her child a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Emelynda

texts.en:
Emelynda is 51 years old and has three children. Emelynda is married and has one child who is still in school.

Emelynda is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Emelynda requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emelynda has been farming rice for 16 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Emelynda would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Grace is 42 years old and has one child who is in school.

Grace has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Grace has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan works hard to support her family. Joan is married and has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines.

Joan requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

Joan has been in this business for 4 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy is 35 years old and married. Precy works very hard to provide for her family.

Precy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Precy has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, noodles, dried fish, eggs, cereals and coffee. 

In the future, Precy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice and other food stuffs.

loans.name: Giovanna Patricia

texts.es:
El día 1 mayo nació Giovanna Patricia, la mama de la niña la señora Aidé vivía con una tía por que el papa de Johana  el señor Joaquín  nunca respondió por ella,  desde ese entonces la mamá de Johana le  ayudaba a la tía con los niños mientras la tía trabajaba, Johana era como la hermanita menor de Alexis y Camilo, fueron inseparables hasta los 5 años, cuando   Aidé y Johana decidieron irse para el campo a donde una tía llamada Inés, hay duro unos meses y después se fue para donde un tío de Johana que se llamaba Mario quien ya murió, hay estuvo 4 años,  Johana estudio un año en la escuela donde hizo pre-kinder.  
Un día la abuelita de Aidé, bisabuela de Johana, le  dijo  a  Aidé    que se fueran para la finca de ella, Aidé aceptó y se fueron para la finca de la abuelita estando allí   Aidé trasladó a Johana a estudiar en la escuela, allí estudio toda la primaria, en el 2006, en esa colegio estudio hasta  grado noveno, Johana dejo de estudiar porque ella quería trabajar, así que decidió irse a otra ciudad, donde se da la mejor naranja del país, trato de trabajar y estudiar pero el tiempo no le ayudo, estando en pacho distinguió a un muchacho llamado Ariel con quien tuvo una relación seria, Ariel  extrañaba la tierra así que le propuso a Johana irse para allá, así que la enamorada pareja decidió irse un año, cuando regreso en el año 2010 Johana estaba embarazada, la familia le ayudo pero el novio de Johana no la apoyo, Johana al ver que él no la ayudaba con el bebé decidió no volver con él, Aidé  y las tías apoyaban a Johana para que terminara los estudios, pero en ese momento, primero quería tener al bebé que se llamó Felipe, Por fin comenzó a estudiar en la Institución la Merced en la noche, en el día trabajaba y veía  del bebe, por fin finalizo el bachillerato, Pero al año siguiente no pudo estudiar por problemas económicos y por la salud de Felipe, quien estaba enfermo de las rodillas. Este año quiere estudiar porque con ello puede darle un mejor futuro al bebé además enseñarle a Felipe que siempre se puede así las cosas se vean difíciles, el convenio con kiva seria de gran ayuda para ella, ya que es madre soltera y los gastos que tiene que cancelar mensual mente son un poco costosos y si le dan el convenio con kiva los gastos que ella tiene se reducen un poco y podría terminar la carrera.
texts.en:
Giovanna Patricia (Johana)was born on May 1st. Her mother, Aidé, lived with her aunt because Johana's father, Joaquín, wasn't in the picture. Johana's mom helped her aunt with the kids while her aunt worked. Johana was like a younger sister to Alexis and Camilo and they were inseparable until they turned 5, when Aidé and Johana decided to move to the country where another aunt, Inés, lived. They stayed there for a few months and later moved in with Johana's uncle Mario, who has since died. They stayed there for 4 years and Johana attended a year of preschool.

One day, Aidé's grandmother, Johana's grandmother, told Aidé to come to her farm. Aidé accepted and they moved there, where Aidé put Johana in school. She stayed there through primary school. Johana left school in 2006, in 9th grade, because she wanted to work. She decided to go to another city, known for the best oranges in the country. She tried to work and to study but she didn't have time. She entered into a serious relationship with a chubby boy named Ariel. Ariel missed the land, and proposed to Johana that they leave to go there. The enamored pair decided to leave for a year, and when they returned in 2010 Johana was pregnant. Her family helped her, but her boyfriend did not support her. Seeing that he wasn't helping, she decided to leave him. Aidé and her aunts helped Johana to finish her schooling, but in that moment all she wanted was to have her baby, whom she named Felipe.

She eventually began to study in the Merced school at night, working and looking after the baby during the day. She finished high school, but the next year she wasn't able to study because of financial problems and Felipe's health.

This year she wants to study because she will be able to give her baby a better future, and also to teach Felipe that you can do things that seem difficult. The agreement with Kiva will be of great help to her, since she is a single mother and her monthly expenses are costly. With the loan she will be able to reduce her expenses a little and finish her degree.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is 60 years old with four grown-up children. She manages a sari-sari store (community based store). Josefa is a very hardworking mother for her age and she wants to sustain the needs of her family. Josefa is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, snack foods, rice and cooking oil. She hopes that she can expand her business to save enough money for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jonelle

texts.en:
This is Jonelle, 58, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Angelico, a vendor, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Jonelle operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to pay for cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Jonelle dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her family will always stick together. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
Fátima es una mujer trabajadora de 29 años de edad, actualmente está casada y tiene un hijo de 8 años d edad que se encuentra estudiando en la escuela, ella y su familia viven en casa de su suegra. 

Fátima trabaja en la unidad de salud de la ciudad desde hace 7 años, es promotora de salud y además se dedica a vender productos de belleza que comercializa con sus compañeros de trabajo, y su esposo trabaja como policía en la ciudad donde residen.

El préstamo que ella está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para reparar su casa, ya que quiere hacer un pequeño muro pues se acerca la época lluviosa y la tierra se erosiona, y teme que sea un peligro para ella y su familia, por lo cual quiere construir el muro lo más antes posible.

En un futuro Fátima sueña con tener una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas, así también le gustaría tener un negocio amplio del cual pueda obtener  ingresos económicos extras, los cuales son necesarios para los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Fátima, 29, is a hardworking woman. She is married and has an 8 year old son who is in school. She and her family live in her mother-in-law's home.

Fátima has been working for the city health unit for 7 years. She is a health promotor, and also sells beauty products to her coworkers. Her husband is a policeman in the city where they live.

The loan from CrediCampo is needed to repair her house. She wants to build a small wall since the rainy season is coming and the dirt will erode, which she fears will be dangerous for her family. Because of that, they need to build the wall as soon as possible.

In the future, Fatima dreams of having an adequate home. She would also like to increase her business and earn more extra income, which is necessary to cover the costs of the home.

loans.use: to repair her house and build a wall.

loans.name: Sovan's Group

texts.en:
Sovan is 42 years old and is a resident from the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and blessed with five children, three of whom rely on her, as two are in school and the remaining one is too young for schooling.  

Sovan struggles to earn a living; she does rice cropping with support from her husband, as her main source of income. Besides helping her on this rice farm, her husband also works as a motor-taxi driver to earn additional income for the family. 

She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She teamed up to make a group of two to get the first loan of 400,000 KHR each. As the group’s representative, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop. She highly believes that she can gain a good yield - better than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en:
Saran, aged 55 and a mother of seven children, is a citizen from Kampong Cham province. She strives to make a living via two hectares of rice farming, which she has been involved in for years in order to support her entire household.

She has been with this business for 36 years. This is the first microloan for Saran with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  With the same loan cycle, she and her co-borrowers are seeking 400,000 KHR each. Saran, who is the group leader, will spend her entire loan in order to buy potash, fertilizer, and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield - better than before.

loans.use: to buy potash, fertilizer, and insecticide for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Shephali

texts.en:
Shephali is a married woman from Dhupguri who lives with her husband and has three sons. One of her sons is a school student but the other two sons are engaged in different businesses. She is associated with a mosquito net business while her husband is engaged in a cycle repairing business.

She has been doing this business for many years so she is sure that if she can run this business successfully, she will be self-sufficient. She buys varieties of nets, prepares the mosquito nets and sells them in the local market and in her neighborhood. There is a high demand for her mosquito nets in her locality.

She decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more bundles of different varieties of net pieces to enhance her business, which will improve her financial condition. She dreams of being a good entrepreneur in the business field. She hopes she will gain more profit from this business as her village neighbors are deprived of getting any help in surviving acute diseases like malaria, typhoid etc.

Shephali is thankful to BJS and Kiva for this funding.

loans.use: To purchase more bundles of netting to make mosquito nets

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin is 33, married, and together with her husband raises three children in a rural commune of Rokhak Kiri district, Battambang province. All of the children are attending school and are still dependant. Since farming is the main source of her family's livelihood, Sarin continues working and expanding her farming business to ensure a higher production. Having been in this occupation for over 10 years, she is able to earn well to support her family.

Sarin has applied for a loan which will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sarin is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and to improve her household sanitation practices.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is 38 years old and she is happily married to Juan who works as a carpenter. God has blessed them with loving children and all of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Mary Jane owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, an egg or other items. She gets her product from a wholesaler at a lower price then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to make a profit. She also sells fruits and vegetables for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns PHP 300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a loan of PHP 27,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Mary Jane desires that her business will continue to grow and she hopes to have more customers. It is also her dream to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 53 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is still in school.

Sonia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Sonia requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Sonia has been raising livestock for 6 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Sonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Sarifa

texts.en:
Sarifa is a 26-year-old married woman and her husband is 28 years old. Both Sarifa and her husband are illiterate and just know how to sign their names. Sarifa is a mother of two children and lives in a small village in Dhupguri. Her husband is a farmer. For farming, lots of money is required to cultivate crops and land is also required. Her husband farms in some other fields and has to give a certain amount of money to the person who holds the land. It was becoming very difficult for Sarifa to arrange for the basic necessities of life. So she decided to start a business of her own. She learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and took a loan of INR 12,000 so that she could purchase goats and sell the milk in the markets. 

She hopes that she will help her husband so that he can do cultivation on his own and can purchase a plot for farming with the profit from her business. She also dreams of giving an education to her children. 

Sarifa is grateful and thankful to BJS and Kiva for extending a helping hand to her.

loans.use: To purchase goats and sell their milk

loans.name: Mayna

texts.en:
Mayna is a 42-year-old married woman and has two children. She has received a little education. Her husband is 50 years old. Mayna is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. They live in the small town of Dhupguri. 

They have a small plot of land in which her husband cultivates different crops. As the plot of land belongs to them, the whole profit comes to them only. Mayna has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds for potato cultivation so that they can enhance their business and can cultivate another variety of vegetable to earn more. They dream of giving a good and bright future to their children. Mayna also hopes to buy more farmland. 

Mayna is thankful to BJS and Kiva for extending a helping hand to her.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Mahima

texts.en:
Mahima is a 46-year-old woman raising her three children. She lives in a small village in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is engaged in cattle and sells milk to look after her children and meet the expenses of her family. 

Mahima has an interest in the milk supply and dairy products business and it is admirable that she is able to do that along with maintaining her household work.  But now-a-days, when the prices of the essential commodities are increasing day by day, it is impossible for her to run her family smoothly with her small income. She wants to buy one more cow to expand her business. Then she came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan to buy one more cow. She hopes it will help her to develop her business, which will generate an extra income to meet the financial needs of her family and give a better education to her children. She also hopes to set aside the extra profit to make a dairy farm of her own.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Ngorn

texts.en:
Ngorn is 48 years of age, and married with three children. Ngorn and his wife raise their children in a rural area of Santuk district, Kampong Thom province. All of his children are attending school and depend on their income. Despite the hardship of living, Ngorn aims to continue sending his children to school, so that they will become professionals and have a bright future someday. Farming rice is the major source of income for his family. He has been a farmer for more than 25 years and earns well to support his family.

Ngorn would like to improve his living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, he is asking for a loan in the sum of 500 USD to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL.  After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t spend much money on fuel, and lessen the smoke from wood or charcoal. Upon construction completion, NBP provides a flat rate subsidy of 150 USD per plant into the borrower’s saving account for the purpose of making loan repayment.  After that, HKL will provide a new repayment schedule to the borrower. Accordingly, there is the possibility of a small variation in loan amount when reporting monthly repayments to Kiva.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester.

loans.name: Luz Magnolia

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 50 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y pujante; pues siempre va en busca de alternativas que le permitan progresar.
Desde hace muchos años se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica por medio de la observación y, poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos por medio de la práctica, esto la impulsó para iniciar su propio taller, para lo cual adecuó un espacio en la casa donde reside y, con unos ahorros que tenía compró sus primeras máquinas, trabaja sola todos los días, pero en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de una persona, dependiendo de la cantidad de contratos que tenga; así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar.
El  crédito que solicita es un apoyo para el fortalecimiento de su labor, pues con el dinero comprará una máquina fileteadora, con la que podrá agilizar el proceso de producción y adquirir más contratos, generando mayor rentabilidad en el negocio.
Luz manifiesta que su mayor desafío es la competencia en el mercado, sin embargo esto la sigue motivando para seguir prestando un mejor servicio y luchar para que el sueño de la acreditación de su negocio se haga realidad y le permita generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de las personas que influyan en la labor.
texts.en:
Luz is 50 years old, hard-working and thriving. She is always seeking alternatives that will permit her to grow. She has worked in the sewing field for many years, work she learned empirically through observation, and little by little she perfected her technique and expanded her knowledge through practice. This inspired her to open her own shop, for which she created space in the house where she lives, and with the saving she had she bought her first machines. She works every day, but occasionally has the help of another person, depending on the quantity of contracts that she has. In this way she has generated sufficient income to meet her household expenses.

The loan she seeks is in support of strengthening her work, as she will buy a serger sewing machine, which will make her process much more agile and she will be able to acquire more contracts, generating greater profits in her business.

Luz states that her greatest challenge is the competition in the market, nevertheless this motivates her to continue providing better service and fighting so that her dream of a successful business becomes reality and it enables her to generate employment opportunities for others, and in this way improve her quality of life and that of others who work with her.

loans.use: to buy a serger sewing machine.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 37 years old, married and a housewife. She lives with her husband and four children. Evelyn and her husband have a motorcycle business. It is a revenue-generating business with a solid five years of experience. She is the main breadwinner for the family. Due to the increase in the prices of essential commodities, it is now difficult for her to cover the family’s needs. She needs to expand her business in order to satisfy the needs of her family.

She will utilize the loan to buy tires and gasoline for her business. This will increase their income, which will be used to meet her family’s needs, children's educational expenses, and in the future, to upgrade their house to a concrete house.

loans.use: to buy tires and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos los cuales están estudiando y le ayudan a su padre en el trabajo agrícola.

Berta se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero eso no le impide tener ese espíritu de emprendedurismo, en su familia además de dedicarse a la agricultura también siembran hortalizas. Berta se dedica también a la crianza de pollos de engorde,  ya que es muy demandado por los consumidores del cantón y también ella elabora tamales y pan, productos que sle a vender de casa en casa, de modo que realiza variedad de actividades para obtener ingresos económicos para mantener a su familia.
El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar 200 pollos, para engordarlos y luego de un tiempo salir a venderlos a los clientes del cantón, y obtener buenas ganancias.

 El sueño de Berta es ver a sus hijos graduarse en una carrera universitaria, además quiere reparar su casa, para que sus futuros nietos puedan tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Berta, 52, is married and her husband is a farmer. They have four children who are in school and help their father on the farm. Berta works in the home, but this doesn't stop her from having an entrepreneurial spirit. In addition to farming, they also plant vegetables. Berta also raises chickens that she fattens, because they are very in demand by consumers in her village. She also makes tamales and bread which she sells from house to house. All of these activities provide income to maintain her family.

She needs a loan to buy 200 chickens, fatten them up, and later sell them to customers in the region for a good profit. Berta's dream is to see her children graduate from college. She also hopes to repair her home so that her future grandchildren can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 200 chickens, fatten them up, and sell them.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 59 años de edad, lastimosamente por circunstancias económicas solo estudió hasta quinto grado, pero eso no le ha impedido ser un hombre trabajador, está soltero y actualmente vive con un sobrino en la misma casa.

Miguel trabaja como ayudante de albañil, y además tiene familiares que le dan trabajo en una hacienda donde se hacen oficios de alimentación de ganado.

Él está solicitando este préstamo, para comprar los materiales que le hacen falta para terminar de construir su casa ya que le faltan 2 paredes y el techo de madera y tejas, con el crédito se le estará aydando a que viva en mejores condiciones y a tener un hogar seguro. 

Miguel quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida y quiere amueblar su casa.
texts.en:
Miguel, 59, left school after the fifth grade.  His family didn't have the money for him to continue at school and he has had to work hard to make up for so little education.  He's single and lives with a nephew.   

Miguel makes a living from construction and farm work.  He has family who can hire him for work tending cattle on a local hacienda.  

Miguel is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the construction materials he needs to finish building his house.  He still needs to put up two walls and replace the roof with one of wood and tile.  The investment will make the house safer and more comfortable.

Miguel wants to furnish the house, as well.

loans.use: to buy materials for finishing his house.

loans.name: Soriya's Group

texts.en: Soriya, a mother of four kids, is from Battambang province where she grows paddy rice and runs a grocery business. Presently, only three of her children are relying on her - one of them is in school and the remaining two are too young for school. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages with successful repayment of her past six loans which has enabled her to improve her lifestyle. Now, she leads a group of three. The total loan amount of her entire group is 4,000,000 KHR, 1,400,000 KHR of which is her loan portion. As the group representative, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes that she can earn a decent income and keep improving her lifestyle so that she can keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en: Sophan, aged 46, is from Kong Meas district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school. To support her family, she sells khmer noodles as the main source of income and does construction work for extra income. She has been with this business for 12 years. Including this loan, she is a four-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans completely, with a positive improvement in her living conditions and she can keep her kids in school. Now, she is seeking a loan of 2,500,000 KHR in order to renovate her house. She hopes that her family will live in a decent house and be more comfortable than before.

loans.use: To renovate her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is a 44-year-old married woman who is trying hard to provide her family's needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. She is in the agriculture business, growing and selling bananas with the support of her husband. Through this, she earns well to support their household expenditures. In order to improve her farm in the near future, she has requested a loan to purchase organic fertilizer and buy additional banana seedlings.  In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and buy additional banana seedlings

loans.name: Blanca Lastenia

texts.es:
Blanca de 38 años de edad, solamente estudió hasta segundo grado de educación básica, está acompañada y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad y nadie más depende de ella.

Blanca se dedica al trabajo de corte y confección desde hace 12 años, este oficio lo aprendió de su madre, que también se dedicaba a la misma actividad para sacar adelante a su familia. El trabajo de corte y confección le ha ayudado muchísimo a Blanca pues ahora está trabajando para la escuela del municipio haciendo uniformes para los alumnos.
El préstamo que Blanca está solicitando, lo necesita para comprar productos agrícolas, como abono, herbcidas, pesticidas, etc ya que por el momento los precios están cómodos y la época de siembra se acerca y es por eso que quiere tener sus insumos, al final del año cosechar los granos básicos para el gasto del hogar.
Su perspectiva para un futuro es tener un negocio amplio, donde pueda tener venta ropa y todo tipo de artículos que ella pueda elaborar, y con estos ingresos poder darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Blanca, 38, only studied until 2nd grade She is married and has two children, ages 8 and 3. Blanca has worked as a seamstress for 12 years, a trade that she learned from her mother who also did the same work to support her family. The work has helped Blanca a lot, since she is now working for the local school making uniforms for the students.

Blanca is asking for a loan to buy agricultural products like compost, herbicides, pesticides, etc because prices are low right now and the planting season is coming up, so she wants to have her inputs. At the end of the year she will harvest basic grains to cover their household expenses. Her goal for the future is to have a large business where she can sell clothing and other articles that she makes, and with the income she will give her family the quality of life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products like compost, herbicides, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Originally from Kampong Cham province, Chea is a mother of two kids. The rest of her family rely on her rice cropping and vegetable farming business. She has been involved in the business for 15 years and it has returned her about 25,600 KHR per day. Lack of capital is the main challenge for her to support the business. To overcome this problem she is seeking her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) of 4,000,000 KHR to buy cucumber seeds for replanting and to buy a decent motorbike to support her business. She hopes that she can gain a good yield with a better selling price than last year.

loans.use: To buy cucumber seeds for replanting and to buy a decent motorbike to support her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en: A villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Phy is 43 and a widowed mother of two kids. To cover her family’s needs, she does cassava and rice farming as the main source of income. She has been with this business for 20 years and it has returned her 25,800 KHR per day. This is the fifth loan cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her past loans with success and now her living conditions are getting better than before. Now, she teams up as a group of two to get a loan of 2,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her  loan portion to buy pesticide and to pay for plowing and labor fees. She hopes her business will produce good crop yield to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and to pay for plowing and labor fees

loans.name: Rafika

texts.en:
Rafika is a 24-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband’s name is Dulu and he is 27 years old. One of their children receives an education while the other two are too young to receive an education. Rafika and her family live in the small town of Dhupguri. 

Rafika is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. They have taken this loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to enhance the business of farming so that they can buy seeds and fertilizers for potato farming and can harvest potatoes to sell at the market.  According to them, selling potatoes is very profitable. For that reason, they decided to cultivate potatoes. Like every mother, Rafika also dreams of giving a bright future to her children and supporting her family. She dreams of buying a rickshaw in the future with the profit generated by her business.

She is thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva for supporting them.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for farming potatoes.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara opened Dreadful Thoughts Natural Hair Salon earlier this year. Originally from Jacksonville, Florida, Barbara established the family business in New Jersey with her daughter who has over 15 years of experience as a licensed cosmetologist. 

Previously a nurse, Barbara says she will continue to work in that field. She looks forward to receiving business coaching from the Intersect Fund to better her venture.

The loan will be used to purchase equipment, such as salon chairs, sinks, and a reception desk. Barbara hopes to start a franchise of natural hair salons and expand to south Jersey in the future.

loans.use: To purchase salon chairs, sinks, and a reception desk for her family-run hair salon

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica worked at a large computer company in the marketing department. After a couple years there however, she realized that there was a glass ceiling for women in the company and there was a lot of resistance to her progress in the company. These challenges eventually led Jessica to go into business for herself as a real estate agent. 

Growing up, Jessica always admired her grandfather who was a real estate investor and thus took a keen interest in the real estate market. A San Diego native, Jessica is bubbly and down to earth and loves working with people. She finds it extremely rewarding to see the satisfaction and joy in the lives of new homebuyers. For Jessica, it’s not just about closing the deal, but helping people find their dream home.

This $10,000 Kiva loan will help Jessica with her marketing expenses and allow her to hire an assistant to help support her growing business. Jessica needs to get her name out there so that she can continue building her solid reputation in the community. She hopes to find her niche working with professional athletes and large corporations and dreams to be the “go-to real estate agent” in San Diego. 

Jessica, a married mother of three, hopes that her growing business will allow her to continue providing for her family. She also wants to continue supporting Give Back Homes, a social enterprise that provides a platform for business professionals such as real estate agents to make contributions to building homes for families in need.

loans.use: to pay marketing expenses and to hire an assistant

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence operates a service-based business that provides transportation in their village, and her husband is a driver.  She earns well from this to provide for the needs of the family. She has to work hard aside from farming in order to provide her child a better education. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for buying tires. Recently, she took a new loan to cover the motorcycle maintenance cost. In the near future, she plans to build a store for her to earn daily income. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: with motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
After having her first son and losing her mother, Angela decided she needed to stay home and take care of her family. It felt natural to her to begin home-based childcare. 

Angela owns and operates MPD Child Services, a business that provides a safe and nurturing environment to promote well rounded, precocious children. Born and raised in the Dominican Republic, she has lived in the United States for 26 years and chose to follow her passion for childcare. 

She currently works with a small number of children, but due to her success and insatiable desire to help young boys and girls, Angela hopes to expand her services to teach more children, and even open the possibility of educating adults. 

With this loan, Angela will start a website to market the business and bring in more clientele.

loans.use: to build a website for her business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng is 21 years old and single, living with his parents and other siblings in Preah Sihanouk, Cambodia. He has been studying information technology for three years and also works part time for a private company. A little salary earned from his job allows him to help his parents cover his tuition fees. 

Heng will use the loan he received to pay for his tuition fees and the materials that he needs in order to do his course work at the university. He will try his best to complete his course and receive a degree. After graduation, he hopes to be a successful IT man and earn well to help his parents when they are old. Heng is very happy and grateful for the loan funded via the program like Kiva to enable poor students to pursue a higher level of education while contributing to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees and the materials that he needs in order to do his course work at the university.

loans.name: Monica Alexandra

texts.es:
Mónica nació en Latacunga, en la parroquia La Matriz perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi de la República del Ecuador, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres bellos hijos, actualmente vive arrendando en la ciudad de Latacunga, en la parroquia La Matriz sector muy reconocido por ser una muy comercial, viven ahí desde hace 3 años, con la ayudada de sus padres terminó sus estudios secundarios, pero por falta de oportunidades no pudo concluir sus estudios para poder obtener una profesión, y después de haber terminado el colegio tuvo que trabajar, la vida para Mónica ha sido realmente dura ya que sola tiene que sacar adelante a sus hijos.
El mayor sueño de Mónica es poder darles a sus hijos todo lo que ella algún día no tuvo, espera que sus hijos sean unos grandes profesionales del Ecuador y que al igual que ella nunca se den por vencidos y luchen con todo su corazón por tener una mejor vida.
Mónica tuvo muchos obstáculos en su vida personal pero con la ayuda moral de sus hijos y de sus padres pudo salir adelante. Ella aún espera a la persona ideal que la llene de amor y comprensión. Actualmente trabaja en una cafetería escolar de la escuelita Plinio Fabara, esta escuelita es muy reconocida de la ciudad de Latacunga, está ubicada frente a la Universidad técnica de Ambato, y esta escuela es quien le abrió las puertas a Mónica para que pueda obtener algunos ingresos
Por el momento solicita un crédito para invertir en el mejoramiento de su cafetería escolar, comprando sillas y mesas para que los niños se sientan más a gusto al comer ahí y que a su vez sus utilidades sean más altas, ya que el número de niños en la escuela también se ha incrementado en este último año.
Hoy Mónica quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Mónica was born in Latacunga, in the parish of La Matriz, in the province of Cotopaxi, in the Republic of Ecuador. She is 29 years old. She is a single mother and has three beautiful children. She currently rents in the city of Latacunga, in the parish of La Matriz, an area known for having a lot of businesses. They have lived there for 3 years. With her parents’ help she was able to finish high school, but due to a lack of opportunity she wasn’t able to finish her studies so that she could have a professional career. After finishing high school, she had to work. Life has been truly difficult for Mónica since she has to provide for her children by herself.

Mónica’s biggest dream is to be able to give her children everything that she didn’t have. She hopes that her children will be successful professionals for Ecuador and that, like her, they will never give up and that they will fight with all their heart for a better life.

Mónica had several obstacles in her personal life, but with the support of her children and her parents, she was able to make progress. She is still awaiting the ideal person who will fill her with love and understanding. She currently works at the cafeteria in the Plinio Fabara School. This school is very well-known in the city of Latacunga. It’s located in front of the Technical University of Ambato. It was this school that opened the doors to Mónica so that she could earn an income.

For the moment, she is requesting a loan to invest in the improvement of her school cafeteria. She will buy chairs and tables so that the children will be more comfortable when they eat and so her profits will be greater, because the number of children in the school has increased during this past year. 

Mónica would like to express her sincere thanks and greetings to Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible the growth in her work and personal life.

loans.use: to invest in improvements in her school cafeteria.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Minu is a 35-year-old married woman. Her husband is 43 years old. Minu is the mother of two children. One of her children is in grade 4 and the other one is below the school-going age. She lives in the small town of Dhupguri.

Minu is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. Minu wants to help her husband in his cultivation and expansion of their family business. Minu always wants to be with her husband in every situation so that their family runs smoothly and their children are not affected by poverty and ignorance. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for farming peas on her own farmland. She hopes to do the agricultural work on a large scale to be a good entrepreneur.

Minu is grateful and thankful to Kiva and BJS for their support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for pea cultivation.

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en: Sopheak is a resident from Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is 37 years old and a mother of four children. Presently, three of them rely on her, two in school and one is under schooling age. To deal with the basic needs of her family, she has had a rice farming and pork selling business for 15 years. Now, she is the group leader of three;  all of them including her have not taken loans with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) in the past. She and her joint borrowers are seeking 400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer seeds, pesticide for her crop and to buy more pork for resale. She hopes to double her income so she can expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer seeds and pesticide for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Jonathan  Alexander

texts.es:
Jonathan es un joven muy emprendedor que tiene 19 años de edad, actualmente está estudiando primer año de bachillerato y vive con su madre y dos hermanos menores, por lo tanto se esfuerza por ayudarle a su madre en el tiempo libre. 

Jonathan tiene 7 años dedicándose a la venta de pollos aliñados, los compra en piezas y luego los vende, pues desde muy pequeño él ha apoyado a su madre en dicha actividad, él se levanta  muy temprano junto a su madre para poder preparar la venta del día.

El préstamo que él está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para comprar más pollos, ya que por el momento le hace falta apoyo económico para seguir con su negocio, él compra los productos para revender del cual obtiene los ingresos económicos necesarios para su familia.

Los propósitos de Jonathan son tener un negocio en crecimiento constante para que sus ingresos cada vez sean mayores, y con las ganancias él espera estudiar una carrera universitaria, para formarse como un profesional, así también apoyar a sus hermanos.
texts.en:
Jonathan, 19, is an enterprising young man.  He is in his first year at college and lives with his mother and younger brothers and sisters.  His food sales business helps with family expenses.

Jonathan buys and sells dressed chickens.  He buys the pieces and resells them to his customers.  His mother started the business and they are carrying it on together.  He and his mother get up very early to get ready for the day's sales.  

Jonathan is applying for a CrediCampo loan because he doesn't have the funds he needs to take the business forward.  He will use the loan to buy chickens that he will then resell.  The investment will provide an income for the family.

Jonathan's goal is to establish a steady business that will provide an ever-growing income.  He wants to earn enough to pay his college costs and start a paid career.  He hopes, too, that he can help his younger brothers and sisters with their schooling.

loans.use: to buy chickens for his food sales business.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Ganbaatar, 25 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as a plumber at a power station since 2012. His wife used to be a cook at a restaurant but now she works as a hairdresser. Last year using his previous loan, he managed to renovate his house. But due to this year's strong storms, the house became quite deteriorated. So he is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy cement and shingles to repair the roof and floor which were damaged.
