As a result, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants will be released into the air.

loans.use: to buy cement and shingles

loans.name: Charmie

texts.en: Charmie has been helping her husband operating their own repair shop while running her retail store. For more than three years, she has earned well from it.   She has successfully repaid her previous loan used in purchasing equipment to be used in their shop. To improve sales, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DIALAKORO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits laitiers et ses articles divers. 
 Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur  1er  prêt solidaire. AWA, 2ème femme à droite  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 300 litres de lait frais. Elle s’approvisionne sur place, souvent dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women from group Danaya are on average 45 years old with five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Dialokoro / Segou, (Mali’s fourth administrative region).

These women met through their families. They trade in dairy products and various other items.

This is the first solidarity loan for the women of group Danaya. Awa, the second woman from the right in the photo,plans to purchase 300 liters of fresh milk with her loan. She buys her supplies locally, often from neighboring villages. She retails to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and often extends credits.

She is planning on an average monthly profit of 25,000 XOF, which will be used to pay expenses relative to healthcare, food, clothing, and school. Any remained will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Leap, 55 years old, is married with three children. Leap describes herself as an illiterate woman but hardworking and honest in her daily farming work. She has a few pieces of land where she and her husband grow rice for income which they use to provide their family with all necessary things. Having been in the business for more than 30 years, she is able to earn a daily income of $10 US per day. 

At this time, Leap has applied for a loan which will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank so as to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Leap is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Sal

texts.en:
Sal is a 40-year-old married woman with five children, who live with her and her husband in Trapeang Chong, Bakan district, Pursat province.  She is involved in farming and takes care of the rice farm with great support from her husband. She sells the gathered harvest in the local market and earns for the family, which is vital for them. She has been a farmer for over 20 years.

At this time Sal has applied for a loan which will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and so as to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sal is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: M.jamil

texts.en:
M.jamil is 32 years of age, and lives with his family in the area of Sahiwal, Pakistan. 
He has been running a small general store for five years; he offers all kinds of goods related to book depot, tailoring and cosmetics. His shop is situated in a populated area and lots of customers are available here to buy miscellaneous items, this is the reason he keeps stock of all kinds. He tries to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable on a daily basis. He wants to offer additional bakery items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches and patties, but his major problem is the shortage of funds. Therefore, M.jamil has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy the additional items. He is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will be able to fulfill all requests and abstain from disappointing his customers. In this way he will be able to generate the maximum profit from the sale of additional bakery items and can cherish his children in a better way. 
M.jamil is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy bakery items such as bread, jam, milk packs, cookies, butter, sandwiches and patties.

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna is 48 years old and married She lives in Bhawalpara in the Dhupguri region, Jalpaiguri district. Her husband is 55 years old. Jyotsna and her husband completed their education up to grade 7 & grade 8, respectively. They have three children. None of their children received an education due to poverty The children are engaged in their bag business. 

Jyotsna stitches different types of bags & her husband sells those bags in the market. They have chosen this business because it profitable and bags are demand in their area. Jyotsna has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that they can purchase more materials for making bags to sell in the market. By selling the bags, their earnings are good and they are running their family. She hopes in the future, with the profit from this business, she will be able to open a bag shop in the market.
 
Jyotsna is very much grateful and thankful to BJS and Kiva for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase material to make bags

loans.name: Sandra Yamileth

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 20 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, ya que no pudo continuar por motivos económicos, está casada, su esposo trabaja de vigilante en un banco y solo tienen un hijo. 

Sandra tiene 4 años dedicándose al comercio de ropa, practica esta actividad desde que estudiaba, pues cuando terminaba las clases le ayudaba a su madre a vender ropa en un local,  actualmente tiene su propio negocio del cual obtiene los ingresos para mantenerse. 

El crédito que ella está solicitando, lo utilizará el para surtir más la venta de ropa, ya que necesita hacer crecer el negocio porque tiene una gran demanda de clientes en el mercado

Sus planes a futuro son tener un negocio estable que le permita sacar más ganancias para cubrir sus estudios universitarios, y así poder obtener una profesión que le permita conseguir un buen empleo.
texts.en:
Sandra, 20, studied up through high school but didn't have the money to be able to continue.  She's married and her husband works in security at a bank.  They have only one child.

Sandra has been selling clothing for four years.  She has been doing this job since she was a student; when her classes were over she helped her mother sell clothing in a store.  Currently Sandra has her own business and earns the income to support herself.

Sandra's requesting a loan to stock her clothing business.  She needs to expand her business because she has a lot of customer demand in the market.

Her plan for the future is to have a stable business so she can earn more profits to pay for her college education.  That way she'll be able to have a profession and get a good job.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Francisco Moisés

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 52 años de edad, solamente estudió hasta cuarto grado debido a que su familia era de escasos recursos económicos, vive con sus padres, actualmente está soltero y solo tiene un hijo.

Él tiene 5 años de dedicarse al comercio de frutas y verduras, además se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería, es de estas actividades que obtiene sus ingresos económicos.

Él utilizará este préstamo, para comprar frutas y verduras al por mayor, ya que él las pone a la venta en una tienda que tiene en su casa, también sale a vender a los municipios aledaños.

Francisco planea tener un negocio en su casa, para obtener ingresos suficientes que le permita tener una vida mejor ya que por la edad él se cansa al trabajar en el campo.
texts.en: Francisco is 52 years old. He only studied until Grade 4 as his family had very low income. He lives with his parents. He is single and has one son. He has been in the business of selling fruit and vegetables for 5 years. He also farms and raises livestock. This is how he makes his income. He will use this loan to buy fruit and vegetables and will put them on sale at the store he has in his house. He will also sell in the adjoining municipalities. Francisco plans to have a business in his house to generate sufficient revenues which will permit him to have a better life. At his age he is tired of working in the fields.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Abdul Rasheed

texts.en:
Abdul Rasheed is a 52-year=old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a small crockery store in which he sells utensisl and crockery items such as plates, platters, dishes, cups, jars, glass, jugs, mugs, cauldrons and buckets. 
Abdul Rasheed is a father of three children and single responsible person for all of them. He has only one source of income; he has to cover the expenses of utility bills and household expenses alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark according to the living standard.
Abdul Rasheed wants buy more inventory to sell because most of his female customers purchase utensils in large quantities for creating a dowry. For this reason more inventory is required to cope with the sudden increases in demand.
Abdul Rasheed has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan so he can buy utensils and crockery items that could generate additional income for cherishing his family in a better way.
Abdul Rasheed is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed him a beam of hope to fulfill his desires.

loans.use: To by more crockery such as plates, platters, dishes, cups, jars, glass, jugs, mugs, cauldrons and buckets.

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe TERIYA ont en moyenne  41 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments alimentaires et  des articles divers. 
 Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe TERIYA sont à leur  11ème  prêt solidaire. FATOUMATA, 1ère femme à gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 25Kg de riz, 10Kg de haricot, 5Kg d’ognon, 5 Litres d’huile et 1 paquet de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of group Teriya are on average 41 years old with four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Kimparana / Segou (Mali’s fourth administrative region).

These women met through their families and neighbors. They trade in condiments and various other items.

After repaying their previous loans, the women of group Teriya are on their eleventh solidarity loan. Fatoumata, the first woman from the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to purchase 25 kilos of rice, 10 kilos of beans, 5 kilos of onions, 5 liters of oil, and one package of bouillon cubes. She buys her supplies locally. She retails to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and often extends credits.

She is counting on an average monthly profit of 45,000 XOF, which will be used to pay expenses relative to healthcare, food, clothing, and school. Any remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Chinda Group

texts.en: Chinda is 49 years old.  She is a married woman who has five children in Pursat Province. She sells a bread with meat and meatballs and she is a leader of this group loan. Now, she would like to apply for a loan to buy construction materials to build a latrine. This loan helps her live in good conditions. In the future, she hope she can build a kitchen and her children can get diplomas and get jobs.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a latrine

loans.name: Ankadignogoye Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe ANKADIGNOGOYE  ont en moyenne  52 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments  alimentaires et divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe ANKADIGNOGOYE sont à leur  10ème  prêt solidaire. SITAN, 1ère femme à gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 20Kg de riz, 15Kg de fonio, 5Kg d’ognon, 5 Litres d’huile, 3Kg de Sel de cuisine et 1 paquet de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women from group Ankadignogoye are on average 52 years old with six children. They all live in traditional extended families in Kimpara / Segou (Mali’s fourth administrative region).

These women met through their families and neighbors. They trade in condiments and various other items.

After repaying their previous loans, the women of group Ankadignogoye are on their tenth solidarity loan. Sitan, the first woman from the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to purchase 20 kilos of rice, 15 kilos of fonio (a type of grain), 5 kilos of onions, 5 liters of oil, 3 kilos of cooking salt and one package of bouillon cubes. She buys her supplies locally. She retails to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and often extends credits.

She is counting on an average monthly profit of 50,000 XOF, which will be used to pay expenses relative to healthcare, food, and school. Any remained will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Furaha -Chanika Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is mid forty years old. She is a widowed woman who makes her living by running a business selling retail shop items like dry foods, airtime, matchboxes, sweets, fruits and vegetables. This is a business type commonly known as genge duka.  Zainabu opens her business from 07:00 am to 06:00 pm per working day and is able to make a small monthly profit.
Zainabu together with other seven members has formed a group called "FURAHA -CHANIKA" and she has been selected as a vice-chair of her group. Every member of this group has his/her own small business, the business having a small return due to the small capital outlay. But they believe that if they get loan support, their business returns will improve and make their lifes better.  The group members will jointly hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.    
From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Zainabu’s fourth loan request which she will use to buy stocks of fruits, vegetables, rice, beans, sweets and other items for her business. With the previous loans, all of which repaid successfully, she used the loan to repair her business place and purchase fruits and vegetables. She managed to earn extra income which she used to buy sacks of cement for her house building and to cover home expenses.  Zainabu dreams that one day she will be able to expand her genge duka business so as to make her life better.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruit, vegetables and rice, beans, sweets and other items for their business.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely  is  34 years old.  She is married and has four children of school-age.  She is a resident of Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She earns a living through farming.

She is a member of PMPC since 2011 and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of Php 10,000 to buy farming inputs and fertilizers.

Emely deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy farming inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Ricarido

texts.en:
Ricarido previously accessed an 40,000 PHP loan that he used buy more meat needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household and for business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to purchase more meat needed in his business. His profits from business will definitely help him sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ricarido hopes to be successful in his business and dreams of having more customers. He joins with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and there he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more meat needed in his business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita is 57 years old.  She is married and has five children. She is from Mitimos, Rizal. Her means of income is through hog raising. This has been running for three years. She signed up her membership with Paglaum Multi Purpose COoperative in 2011 and this is how she got her capital for her business. She applied for a loan with the Cooperative to buy additional piglets to raise. Mercedita wants to save more for the education of her children and hopes to live a comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan tiene 28 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador que con mucho esfuerzo busca la manera de salir adelante, lamentablemente solo pudo estudiar hasta cuarto grado de educación básica, está soltero y no tiene hijos.


Juan tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la elaboración de pan, él aprendió muy bien esta actividad gracias a que asistió a varios talleres educativos, luego él decidió comprar un horno para comenzar el negocio de pan, lo que le ayudó a perfeccionar esta técnica la cual es muy importante para él, debido a que es de ahí de donde obtiene sus ingresos económicos para sostenerse.

Él necesita este préstamo, para comprar harina y demás productos necesarios para la elaboración del pan, él quiere comprar por cantidades mayores ya que la demanda es grande y obtiene más ganancias.

Juan tiene muchos propósitos a futuro, pero principalmente él desea tener su casa bien amueblada y reparada, espera lograrlo con las ganancias de su negocio de pan ya que espera ampliarlo y poder comprar otro horno para que los ingresos aumenten y con ello poder ayudarle a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 28, is hardworking and puts a lot effort into looking for a way to get ahead. Unfortunately, he could only study through 4th grade. He is single and doesn't have children. Juan has been baking bread for many years. He learned the trade through attending workshops and later decided to buy an oven to start his own bread business. This helped him to perfect his technique, which is very important to him since this is how he earns his income to take care of himself.

He needs this loan to buy flour and other products needed for making bread. He wants to buy in bulk because demand is high and he will make more profit. Juan has a lot of goals for his future, but the main one is to furnish and maintain his home. He hopes to achieve this using the earnings from his business. He also hopes to increase his business and buy another oven to be able to make more money to help out his family.

loans.use: to buy flour and other products needed for making bread.

loans.name: Santos Alfredo

texts.es:
Santos tiene 41 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado pues no tenía quien le apoyara para continuar sus estudios, por lo que mejor se dedicó a aprender un oficio, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos y son los únicos que dependen de él. 

Este hombre trabajador, tiene 4 años dedicándose a la cría de pollos de engorde, esto lo aprendió gracias a sus padres, lo que le genera buenos ingresos para su familia, además él trabaja de motorista en un horario de de 5 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde, mientras que la esposa le ayuda cuidando su pequeña granja.

Santos necesita este crédito, para comprar más pollos de engorde, comprar alimentos como concentrado, esto le permitirá criarlos muy bien y tener a la venta pollos de calidad.

Él sueña con tener una granja más grande que le genere buenos ingresos económicos y a la vez garantizar la alimentación de su familia de modo que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Santos is 41 years old. He was only able to study until 6th grade because he didn’t have anyone to support him while he continued his studies. Instead, he learned a trade. He lives with his partner and has 2 children. They are his only dependents.

He is a hardworking person. He has been working for 4 years in the business of raising chickens. He learned this business from his parents and it generates a good income for his family. He also works as a driver from 5:00am until 4:00pm, while his wife helps him by taking care of their small chicken farm.

Santos needs this loan to buy more chickens for fattening and also concentrated feed. This will allow him to raise them well and have good chickens for sale.

His dream is to have a bigger chicken farm that will generate a good income and also guarantee that he will be able to feed his family and make sure they lack for nothing.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for fattening and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.es:
Doña María Delfina tiene 43 años de edad, madre de 5 hijos quienes son menores de edad y colaboran en las diferentes actividades que se desarrollan en el hogar y en el campo. Doña María Delfina tiene un grado de educación de primaria completa la cual curso en la escuela de su comunidad gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio de sus padres quienes no pudieron seguirle apoyando para que estudiara en la secundaria por la falta de economía. Por generaciones toda su familia se ha dedicado a la actividad de la agricultura especializándose en la siembra y cultivo de hortalizas (papa). Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad ya que no pudieron darle la oportunidad para que estudiara y se pudiese preparar. El terreno que ella en compañía de su esposo trabaja es propio y está ubicado muy cerca de su casa de habitación al cual se dirigen diariamente caminando. 
Ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder comprar semilla de papa de primera calidad, insumos agrícolas entre otros que ayuden a mantener la semilla que cultivara fuera de peligro mediante alguna plaga o enfermedad. Sus sueños dar a sus hijos una buena educación la oportunidad de poder estudiar a nivel universitario, verlos crecer como personas y como profesionales ya que es lo menos que ellos se merecen.
texts.en:
Doña María Delfina, 43, has 5 children who help her with the work she has to do to keep her house and farm.  Doña María Delfina has a sixth-grade education and she is grateful for it because her parents had to sacrifice a lot to keep her in school.  There wasn't enough money for her to continue beyond the sixth grade, though, and she has had to work hard ever since.  Her family have earned their livings from farming for generations, specializing in vegetable crops (potatoes).  She learned farming from her parents when she was very young.  She and her husband own the land that they farm now and the land is very near their house.  

Doña María Delfina is applying for a COMIXMUL loan that she will use to plant her next potato crop.  The investment will pay for the supplies she needs--seeds, etc.--to carry on the business and protect the crop from plant diseases.  For the future, she hopes to send her children to college and see them in paid careers.  She says that they deserve that chance.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 28 años de edad, estudió sexto grado, es madre soltera la cual vive junto con sus padres y su hija.

Gloria se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en dicha actividad, la cual aprendió de sus padres dado al índice de pobreza que tenían ella no pudo estudiar, por lo tanto no pudo optar a trabajar en la agricultura.

El crédito que Gloria está solicitando lo necesita para comprar 4 terneros los cuales repastará en el mismo lugar donde ya recolectó su cosecha y espera dentro de 5 meses poder venderlos y con la ganancia cubrir algunos gastos de su familia 

Sus sueños son tener vivienda propia y darle a su hija la educación que ella no tuvo, ella le pide a Dios que le de salud y mucha vida para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Gloria is 28 years old. She is a single mother who lives with her parents and her daughter.

Gloria works in agriculture. She has done this since she was 10 years old, so she has a lot of experience in the business, which she learned from her parents. Due to their level of poverty, she wasn’t able to study, so she didn’t really have a choice about working in agriculture.

Gloria is requesting the loan to buy 4 calves, which she will pasture in the same place where she recently harvested her crop. She hopes to sell them in 5 months and use the profit to cover some expenses for her family.

Her dreams are to have her own house and to give her daughter the education she didn’t have. She asks God to give her health and a long life so she can achieve this.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves.

loans.name: Allah Makono Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Allah makono  vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Somonodougouni dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le  commerce de condiment et la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fatoumata (la femme assise devant dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de poisson frais  dans le village de Somonodougouni et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de poisson frais. La vente se fait au restaurant après avoir transformer en plat de tout genre au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  15 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour  des frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The seven women of group Allah makono live in polygamous families. They are on average 40 years old with three children. They all live in the village of Somonodougouni in the Segou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through their neighbors, kinship, marriage, and profit-generating business relations. They trade in condiments and food products. In order to increase their working capital, members of this group have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, and are now on their fifth solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Fatoumata, the woman sitting at the front in the photo, is a major retailer of fresh fish for Samonodougouni and neighboring villages. She plans to use her loan to purchase a large quantity of fresh fish. She sells at the restaurant after cooking the fish into a variety of dishes. Her clientele is of both genders. She takes cash and often extends credits.

With this loan, Mrs. Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 XOF. It will be used to pay for her children’s school expenses and to increase her business’s assets.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is a 68-year-old married woman who is trying hard to provide her family needs, including food, health ans clothing. She is in the agriculture business of growing and selling rice doing it to support her husband. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm inputs. In order to improve her farm in the near future she has requested  a loan recently to purchase organic pesticides.  In the future she wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic pesticides

loans.name: Sajjad Hussain

texts.en:
Sajjad Hussain is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with his wife and a son. He is a wholesaler of artificial jewelry.  He sells artificial jewelry such as bracelets, bangles, lockets, necklaces, rings and earrings. He makes golden jewelry on demand also. He purchases raw materials such as platinum, palladium, titanium, or silver.  He makes a large amount of jewelry on order from the goldsmith and sells it to the jewelry stores. Most of the retailers request  beauty products, also.  He wants to offer beauty products in bulk but does not have cash in hand. Therefore, Sajjad Hussain has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy beauty products such as lotions, lipstick, nail polish, talcum powder, perfumes, etc. In this way he can easily fulfill the increasing demand and can generate more profit as well. 
Sajjad Hussain is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan .

loans.use: To buy beauty products such as lotions, lipstick, nail polish, talcum powder, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Cecilia to improve her business.  She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day.  She will buy some additional supplies, such as  beer, bread, noodles, cigarettes, salt, milk, eggs and rice. She has been involved in these business activities since 2013. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Cecilia independent because she can be responsible for herself and is also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy beer, bread, noodles, cigarettes, salt, milk, eggs and rice

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita busies herself tending to her sari-sari store. She is 64 years old, married, and has three children. She is from Mabini, Baliangao.

Her store helps to pay for her living expenses and supports the needs of her children for their education.

She joined Paglaum in 2009 and has enjoyed the benefits of being a member in good standing since then. Recently, she requested a loan to re-stock her store with basic commodities. Specifically, she wants to purchase goods such as bags of rice, canned goods, and laundry soap for retail sale purposes. In the future, Carlita hopes to expand her store and to have a comfortable home.

loans.use: to re-stock her store with basic commodities (e.g., rice, canned goods, and soap)

loans.name: Silvia Marlene

texts.es:
Silvia de 26 años de edad, es casada nació en la ciudad de Latacunga, en la parroquia la Eloy Alfaro, San Felipe, vive en su casa propia desde hace 8 años atrás junto a su esposo y a su pequeño hijo, con el sacrificio de sus padres pudo culminar sus estudios primarios, pero lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por falta de oportunidades no terminó sus estudios y tuvo que empezar a trabajar y pues eso fue muy difícil debido a que la sociedad misma excluye y discrimina a las mujeres, afortunadamente Silvia encontró a un gran hombre en su camino que la lleno de amor, comprensión y respeto. Luis su esposo, es al igual que ella, un joven luchador y emprendedor que de igual manera no pudo concluir sus estudios, es un joven muy respetuoso que ama a su esposa, se casaron desde muy jóvenes, y es por ello que tuvieron que aprender a trabajar hombro con hombro muy duro para poder educar a su pequeño hijo y para poder sobrevivir ellos mismo.
Silvia cuando se casó con Luis tuvo que aprender a trabajar y es eso, lo que ahora les da de comer todos los días. Silvia aprendió a vender chatarra de sus suegros quienes son unas personas muy buenas y trabajadoras y han intentado cimentar en ellos ese espíritu de lucha constante. Silvia trabaja todo el día bajo sol y lluvia, sin embargo se da su tiempo para poder compartir con su esposo y su hijo, es una familia muy unida y eso es lo que les ha llevado a superarse.
Lorena  se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra, muchas personas la conocen y es por eso que sus ventas son altas en todo el sector. Y en estos últimos meses Silvia a sentido el incremento de clientes y está convencida de que necesita aumentar su mercadería 
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de más mercadería y para poder terminar el techo de su humilde hogar. Esto le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos, utilidad, y a tener un mejor estilo de vida para ella y su familia.
Silvia quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Silvia, 26 is from the city of Latacunga.  She is married and lives with her husband and young son in a house she has owned for 8 years.  She left school after the sixth grade.  She is grateful, she says, that her parents kept her in school for so long, but she had to leave after the sixth grade because her parents didn't have the money for her to continue.  She had to go to work, something that was especially hard for her, a woman, in a society that discriminates against women.  She was luckier in the man she married, a man who loves and respects her and shares her sensibilities.  Her husband, Luis, is as enterprising and hard-working as she is.  They married when they were young and have worked together, shoulder to shoulder, to make a life for themselves and their son.  

Silvia has a scrap business.  She learned the business from her in-laws who, she says, are good, hard-working people who have tried to instill the importance of getting ahead in her and her husband.  Silvia works every day, rain or shine, but still manages to make time for her husband and son.  They are a team and their love and faith in one another has been an important reason for their success.  

Silvia says that the business has grown over the last few months and she has a good customer base now.  She needs more scrap to sell and is applying for a loan partly to stock the business.  She will use the rest of the loan to finish the roof on her small house.  The investment will help her to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living.  She wants lenders to know that she is sincerely grateful for their support and sends her thanks to Fundacion Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for helping her grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for

loans.name: José Horacio

texts.es:
José tiene 64 años de edad, por motivos del bajo nivel económico sus padres no le pudieron dar el estudio ya que en las épocas de su niñez era un privilegio contar con esta oportunidad, pues no habían escuelas cercanas donde ellos vivían, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 5 hijos, y con él vive una nieta.

José se dedica a trabajar en la siembra de maíz en la época de invierno y a la crianza de semovientes y animales de granja, en la época de invierno trabaja todo el día desde la mañana hasta por la tarde, ya que también la esposa cuida de sus animales y lo apoya en ocasiones en la agricultura, su esposa le prepara los alimentos para que pueda llevarlos al lugar de trabajo.

Los fondos del crédito que está solicitando, serán utilizados para comprar laminas y arreglar las paredes de la casa, ya que se acerca el invierno y quiere estar preparado para esta temporada.

Él tiene como objetivo trabajar y no depender de sus hijos y con mucho esfuerzo terminar de arreglar su vivienda
texts.en:
José is 64 years old. Due to his parents’ humble economic situation, they weren’t able to provide him with an education. When he was a child, it was a privilege to have such an opportunity because there weren’t any schools near where they lived. He lives with his partner, who is a homemaker. He has 5 children and one granddaughter lives with him.

José makes a living by planting corn in winter and raising livestock and farm animals. During winter he works all day, from the morning until the afternoon. His wife takes care of the animals and sometimes helps him with the agriculture. His wife prepares his food for him so he can take it to where he works.

The loan will be used to buy metal roofing sheets and to fix the walls of his house. Winter is coming and he wants to be prepared for the season.

His goal is to work and to not depend on his children, and, through hard work, to finish fixing his house.

loans.use: to buy metal roofing sheets and to fix the walls of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items such as sugar, rice, grains, and canned goods.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is applying for a loan in the amount of $800 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin). She is 28 years old and lives in a town near a school.

To earn a living, she runs a kiosk in front of her house. She explains that her kiosk is located in a strategic place, where many people, especially students, come and go.

She is applying for this loan to buy inventory to keep in her store, including sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes, bread, noodles, slippers, and coffee. She is making good money from her current operations and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (e.g., sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes, bread, noodles, slippers and coffee)

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 45-year-old married woman residing in Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur.

She earns a living through farming activities.

Since 2008, she has been a member of PMPC. She explains that she enjoys the privileges that come along with being a member of the cooperative and that she hopes to remain a member in good standing in the future. Now, Evelyn is applying for a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy farming materials and fertilizers.

loans.use: to improve her farming operations by purchasing farming materials and fertilizers

loans.name: Angela Kenn

texts.en:
Angela Kenn is single, 22 years old and lives in Maranding, Lala, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. She is studying at Christ the King College De Maranding for a Bachelor's degree in Elementary Education, majoring in General Education. She has requested a loan to pay her tuition fee this semester. 

Angela Kenn has been a member of PMPC for six months. In the future, she hopes to become a teacher.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 58-year-old married woman living in Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur.

She earns a living through farming activities.

Since 2010, she has been a member of PMPC. She explains that she enjoys the privileges of being a member of PMPC and that she hopes to remain a member in good standing in the future. Now, she is applying for a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy farming materials and fertilizers.

loans.use: to improve her farming operations by purchasing farming materials and fertilizers

loans.name: M. Ikram

texts.en:
The person shown in the picture is named M. Ikram. He is 34 years old and living in the populated area of Sahiwal, Pakistan. He has been running a general store for several years. He is the father of a daughter and three sons. He has been running the small general store for many years and it is not working very well due to a shortage of merchandise. His shop is situated in a populated area and a lot of customers are available here for him to offer miscellaneous general store items. He wants to keep all the stock to offer to his customers, however, due to a lack of funds; he is unable to buy the most-demanded items  With this loan, he will succeed in selling more products and growing his income as well. He wants to offer the most-demanded products such as flour, pulses, detergents, rice and cooking oil.
 
Therefore, M. Ikram has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy stock such as flour, pulses, detergents, rice and cooking oil.

M. Ikram is very happy after receiving this loan and is hopeful that he will be successful in fulfilling each request from his customers and avoid disappointment.  He is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his general store

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Doña Eulogia tiene una edad de 35 años de edad, agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 2 hijos quienes son menores de edad y estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Doña Eulogia cuenta con un grado de escolaridad de primaria completa la cual curso gracias al apoyo económico y moral de sus padres quienes a pesar de su corta economía hicieron lo posible para que ella tuviera conocimientos básicos. A parte de agricultura doña Eulogia también se dedica a la cría y engorde se cerdo actividad que aprendió gracias a su esposo quien le apoya en el campo en el trabajo y mantenimiento del café. En el invierno Doña Eulogia se dedica también a la siembra de maicillo. Ella tiene capacitaciones recibidas sobre el cuidado y el mantenimiento de sus animales gracias a una institución del área local.
Hoy en día ella solicita apoyo financiero para la compra de concentrado de engorde para sus cerdos así como también vitaminas y complejo de crecimiento. Con este mismo financiamiento ella también podrá construir una porqueriza un lugar adecuado para mantener sus animales y adecuado para el cuido de los mismos. Sus metas, esperanzas y sueños, poder convertirse en una gran productora de carne de cerdo en la zona así como también poder exportar en embutido a otros países por lo que ella pide ser apoyada para que sus metas esperanzas y sueños puedan llevarse a cabo.
texts.en:
Eulogia is 35 years old. She is a farmer, housewife and mother of two children who are still minors and study in the local school. Eulogia finished her Primary school education thanks to the economic and moral support of her parents who despite a poor financial situation did everything possible for her to have a basic education. Besides farming Eulogia also raises and fattens pigs something she learned from her husband, who she helps with the work in the fields and taking care of the coffee. In the winter Eulogia also grows sorghum. She has had training about the care and maintenance of her animals from an institution in her area. 

Today she is requesting financial help to buy concentrated feed for her pigs as well as vitamins and growth formula. Also with this loan she can construct a pig stye in a good place to keep her animals and take care of them. Her goals and dreams are to become the largest producer of pork in her area and be able to export cold cuts to other countries. So she is asking to be supported so she can bring these dreams to reality.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrated feed to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Isidra has been working on her own farm to make a living.  She has successfully repaid her previous loans that contributed much to improve her farm. She solely supervises her farm in order to earn an income. Recently, she took a new loan to improve her farm and pay weeding maintenance costs. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Nohelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nohelia, a sus 51 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Al ser cabeza de hogar, ella necesitaba buscar alternativas que le permitieran generar ingresos y, gracias a una amiga que le obsequió un dinero, ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio de producción y venta de arepas, el oficio lo aprendió por tradición familiar y poco a poco fue adquiriendo más clientes, por lo que tuvo que mandar a hacer un fogón más grande en cemento, que funciona con leña para poder cocinar el maíz y asar las arepas de forma artesanal, para satisfacer la gran demanda de su producto que aumentaba cada día.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para realizar modificaciones en el fogón de leña, comprar ollas y parrillas y adecuar mejor el espacio de trabajo (revocar y pintar), esto le permitirá dar una mejor imagen a su puesto de trabajo y podrá elaborar sus productos con una mejor higiene y calidad, pues de ello depende que su negocio se mantenga en funcionamiento, generando mejores ingresos por ventas para llevar el sustento al hogar.
Nohelia manifiesta que su principal anhelo es seguir generando recursos para apoyar a sus hijos brindándoles educación, salud y alimento diario, para que logren ser personas íntegras y exitosas.
texts.en:
Nohelia, age 51, is a single mother of four children, whom she has gotten ahead through great effort and dedication.

As the head of her household, she has needed to look for possibilities that allow her to generate income and, thanks to a friend who gave her money, she decided to start her own business making and selling arepas.  She learned how to do this by family tradition, and little by little she got more customers, so she had to order a new cement wood stove to be made.  It works with firewood to cook the corn and roast the arepas in an artisanal manner.  This met the large demand for her arepas, which was increasing daily.

Currently she is asking for the support of a loan to make modifications to the wood stove, to buy pots and grills, and to improve her work space (plaster and paint it).  This will allow her to project a better image on her work stand and she will be able to make her product with better quality and hygiene.  Her work depends on keeping it well maintained, generating a better income through sales, in order to take care of her home.

Nohelia shares that her main desire is to keep making money to support her children, giving them education, health, and daily nourishment, so that they can manage to be trustworthy and successful people.

loans.use: to make modifications in the wood stove, to buy pots and grills, and to improve her work space (plaster and paint)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Muranga area of central Kenya, She is married and has four children. She loves farming and has been doing it for 30 years. Her primary source of income is tea. She enjoys farming the most because it is her main source of income. Her biggest challenges are labor and transport for her produce.

Mary chose Juhudi Kilimo because they assist farmers to improve their way of living and they give better services and products to farmers.Through this loan, the labor will decrease because she will use a chuff cutter to cut Napier grass for her dairy cows and her revenue will increase, which will improve their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Johana Carolina

texts.es:
Ella se llama Johana Carolina, vive en Bogotá y tiene 24 años, estudia en Campo Alto,  está en segundo semestre  de la carrera de Auxiliar Administrativo en Salud, ha sido una persona responsable y puntual en las tareas.
Escogió esta carrera porque siempre le ha llamado la atención trabajar en el área de salud y porque la carrera le enseña a tomar decisiones y enfrentar retos de cualquier empresa en el campo de la salud, Campo Alto le ha brindado las herramientas para que optimice las tareas y tenga un enfoque integral y de gestión.
Quiere pertenecer al Convenio KIVA, ya que en este momento no tiene un trabajo fijo y esto ha dificultado los pagos oportunos, desea el convenio para terminar los estudios y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Johana Carolina, 24, lives in Bogotá and studies in Campo Alto.  She's in her second semester of the program in health assistance administration.  She has been a responsible person and punctual with her work.

She chose this program because she has always been interested in working in the health field.  Also, the field teaches her to make decisions and face challenges in any health-related enterprise.  Campo Alto has given her to tools to make the most of her tasks and to focus on the management.

Johana Carolina wants to have a Kiva loan because she doesn't have a stable job at the moment.  This has made it difficult to make timely payments.  She wants the loan so she can finish her program and have a better quality of life and work opportunities.

loans.use: to pay her tuition for the semester

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel has been selling barbecue in her village to support her husband's income from his employment. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for her small business. She earns well from this and is able to support the household expenditures. In order to increase sales, she has requested a loan to buy raw ingredients to prepare barbecue for sale.  In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare barbecue to sell

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: José Blas Antonio

texts.es:
José tiene 35 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casado y su esposa se dedica al trabajo doméstico, José ha procreado dos hijos de los cuales solo uno está en la escuela, por lo tanto de él solo dependen su esposa y sus hijos. 

José se dedica a la reparación de radios desde hace 16 años, este oficio lo aprendió de su papá, esta es la única actividad que realiza José, el trabajo lo hace en su casa pero también hace reparaciones a domicilio si las personas le llaman que les reparen cualquier tipo de electrodoméstico, este trabajo lo hace en un horario de 6:00 AM a las 4:00 PM.

El préstamo que José está solicitando a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar polines y lámina para terminar de construir su casa, con el crédito se le estará ayudando a tener una casa en mejores condiciones para él y su familia.
 
Sus sueños son, ir mejorando poco a poco su casa para que sus hijos crezcan en un lugar agradable y si Dios se lo permite, poder trabajar en la reparación ya que es algo que disfruta mucho.
texts.en:
José, 35, studied through high school.  He's married and his wife is a homemaker.  José has had two children, only one of whom is in school.  José's wife and his children depend on only him.

José has earned a living repairing radios for 16 years.  He learned this trade from his father and it's his only job.  He works at home but also goes to houses if people call him to repair some household appliance.  He works from 6 a.m. until 4 p.m.

José's asking CrediCampo for a loan to buy beams and metal roofing to finish building his house.  The loan will be helping him have a house in better condition for himself and his family.

His dreams are to keep on improving his house little by little so his children grow up in a nice place and, God willing, to keep working in repairs because it's something he enjoys a lot.

loans.use: to buy beams and metal roofing

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABALY ont en moyenne  37 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des fruits et légumes  et divers. 
 Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABALY sont à leur  14ème  prêt solidaire. KADIA, 2ème femme à droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 250Kg de banane  et 150Kg d’orange. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabaly Group have an average age of 37 years old and four children at home. They all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, one of the neighborhoods in San/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are relatives and neighbors who work together buying and selling fruits, vegetables and other products.

After successfully repaying all previous loans, this is the fourteenth group loan for the women of the Sabaly Group. Kadia, second from the right in the photo, intends to use this loan to buy 250kg of bananas and 150kg of oranges. She purchases her supplies in neighboring villages and sells to a diverse clientele of women and men in cash and often on credit. Kadia hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, which she will use for expenses related to health, food, clothing and school fees. She will reinvest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est né le 18 Mars  2003 à l'inauguration du Banc villageois, ces femmes ont pu acquérir une expérience solide vu qu’elles viennent d’entamer leur vingt deuxième cycle dans le programme.   Les membres du groupe habitent le même village  et sont animés d’un esprit d’entre aide et de soutien mutuel. Elles sont très actives dans le petit commerce et la culture sous pluie.

Madame Ndèye (assise à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est veuve, est âgée de 45 ans et prend en charge ses 04 enfants dont deux garçons et filles. Son activité s’inscrit dans la vente de chaussures, accessoires et de draps de lit qu’elle achète le plus souvent à la capitale pour la revente dans sa localité.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter 15 draps de lit à 10 000  F CFA pièce, 30 paires de chaussure pour femme à 5 000 F CFA l’unité.

Les bénéfices l’aideront à poursuivre la construction de sa maison encours.
texts.en:
This borrowing group was created on March 18, 2003 through the inauguration of a banc villageois. Over the years, these women have acquired solid business experience - they have just started their twenty-second season together. The members of the group live in the same village and believe strongly in the spirit of mutual support and working together. They are very active in small business and rain-fed crop cultivation.

Madame Ndèye (seated far right) is the group's star borrower. She is a 45-year-old widow who supports four children, two boys and two girls. Her business is in the sale of shoes, accessories and bed sheets, which she buys most often in the capital for resale in her village. With this loan, Ndèye will buy 15 bedsheets at 10,000 FCFA each and 30 pairs of women's shoes for 5,000 CFA per pair. She will use the profits to continue building her home.

loans.use: to buy 15 bedsheets and 30 pairs of women's shoes

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 32 años de edad, sus padres con mucho esfuerzo lograron darle el estudio hasta sacar bachillerato, luego ya no pudieron debido a los pocos ingresos, ya que solo se dedican a la agricultura, Rosa está acompañadan y tiene un hijo quien actualmente está pequeño, su compañero de vida se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura .

Rosa se dedicaba a ayudarle a su madre, después que se acompañó vio la necesidad de ayudar a su compañero de vida a obtener ingresos para mantener a su familia,  luego se fue a vivir cerca de una escuela y comenzó un pequeño negocio de venta de antojos y churros para los niños que llegaban a la escuela, progresivamente lo fue ampliando comprando mas productos, para dejar todo listo tiene que levantarse muy temprano para preparar los ingredientes que requieren para la venta yuca, enchiladas, refrescos y otros, su compañero al igual que ella se levanta a ayudarle para que pueda salir a tiempo con el pequeño negocio y luego él se dirige donde tiene su trabajo.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados en la compra por mayoreo de productos como yuca, bebidas y otros, ya que la demanda de alumnos en la escuela es grande y quiere ampliar su negocio.

Ella espera seguir adelante con el negocio, para seguir aportando ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old.  With great effort, her parents managed to give her a high school education.  Later, they no longer were able to, due to their small income, because they only work in agriculture.  Rosa has a partner and a child who is still young.  Her partner works in farming.

Rosa used to work helping her mother.  After she got together with her partner, she saw the need to help him to make money to support her family.  Then she went to live near a school and began a small business selling snacks and churros to the children arriving at school.  Bit by bit, she grew her business, adding more products.  To have everything ready, she has to get up very early to prepare the ingredients that she needs to sell yuca, enchiladas, drinks, and other items.  Like her, her partner gets up to help her so that she can leave on time with her little business.  Later he heads out to where he works.

The loan money will be used to purchase products such as yuca, drinks and other items in bulk, because the students in the school have a high demand, and she wants to expand her business.

Rosa hopes to move forward with her business to keep earning money for her family.

loans.use: to buy products such as yuca and drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Abelina

texts.en:
Abelina is a 56-year-old married woman with seven children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Abelina has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Abelina requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Abelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 56 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Angelina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angelina has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is a 38-year-old woman of Maynaguri. She has two children who are studying in different classes respectively. Her husband has completed education up to higher secondary level, and she has read up to grade 9. She is used to making sure her children are well educated to be established in life.

Her husband has a business, but his income is inconsistent. Lili decided to start a new business of making quilts and thin mattresses for the winter season. She is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase the raw materials like cloth pieces, cotton, coconut coir, etc. for making quilts and mattresses to sell door to door. 

There is a great demand for quilts in Maynaguri because people get subdued in the cold atmosphere. For this reason, she hopes she will gain more profit from this business. She hopes that she will be able to overcome these socio-economic hurdles with the help of her business profit.

Lili is now trying to expand her business effortlessly and is thanking BJS, as well as Kiva, because without their help, it would not be possible for her to go forward.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making quilts and thin mattresses to sell door to door.

loans.name: Jhon Darwin

texts.es:
Jhon es un joven emprendedor de 19 años, soltero, oriundo de parroquia Machachi del cantón Mejía de la Capital de los ecuatorianos actualmente vive en la Parroquia de Pastocalle. La vida le golpeo desde muy pequeño al quitarle a sus padres y quedar huérfano a los 11 años, tuvo que irse a vivir con unos familiares muy lejanos, Jhon ha sufrido realmente mucho el mundo se vino encima cuando se quedó sin las personas que le dieron la vida, y pues lo irónico de esto es que la vida misma le arrebato a esos seres, es por esta razón y por la falta de recursos económicos que solamente pudo terminar sus estudios primarios. 
Jhon sin embargo demostró a todos que el pude salir adelante, él pudo haber seguido malos pasos, pero las ganar de ser alguien más en la vida fueron más grandes y no se dejó llevar por malas amistades, sino todo lo contrario se unía una Fundación en la parroquia que lo acogió Pastocalle, en donde le ayudaron a aprender ciertas actividades del campo como es la crianza de algunos animales (polos, cerdos, ovejas, etc). Y ese fue el muevo inicio para Jhon se dedicó mucho aprender eso, pues solo así podría obtener algunos ingresos y sustentarse así mismo. 
El mayor sueño de Jhon es poder algún día encontrar a una mujer buen, trabajadora que le llene de amor y que juntos puedan construir una bella familia algo que el no pudo tener.
Con la experiencia que Jhon ha adquirido a través de los años y experimentando el crecimiento que ha tenido la venta de cerdos en los últimos años, se siente preparado para dar un paso de crecimiento para lo cual solicita un crédito que lo utilizará en la compra de cerdos y para poder terminar con una pequeña construcción, que harán que sus ventas e ingresos aumente y a su vez para que Carlos pueda mejorar sus estilo de vida.
Jhon agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en: Jhon is a 19-year-old single entrepreneur.  He comes from the parish of Machachi, in the canton of Mejia, in the Ecuadorian capital.  He now lives in the parish of Pastocalle.  Life dealt him a blow at a very young age when his parents died, and he became an orphan at the age of 11. He had to go to live with relatives far away. Jhon has suffered a lot; his world collapsed when he was left without the people who gave him life, and it is ironic that life then robbed him of these people.  For this reason and due to a lack of financial resources he was only able to complete primary school.  However, Jhon showed everyone that he was able to get ahead.  He could have taken a bad path, but his desire to be something more in life was stronger, and he did not allow himself to be influenced by bad friends.  Instead, he joined an organization in the parish of Pastocalle, where they helped him to learn activities such as raising animals (chickens, pigs, sheep, etc.)  This was the first step for Jhon, who dedicated himself to learning so that he could earn some income and support himself.  Jhon's main dream is to meet a good, hardworking  woman some day who will fill him with love, and with whom he can create the beautiful family that he never had.  With the experience that Jhon acquired over the years, and the growth in the sale of pigs in recent years, he feels ready to take a step forward.  For this reason he is requesting a loan, that he will use to buy pigs and to finish a small construction project. In this way he can increase his sales and income and improve his lifestyle.  Jhon is grateful to the Fundacion Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making this growth possible in his work and his personal life.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and to finish a construction project.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 40 years old, married and lives with her family. She has a retail store serving snacks to her customers; she sells assorted food and beverages to generate additional income while her husband works abroad. 

Virginia has three years experience in this business. Virginia works every day in order to provide income for the family and to show her responsibility and love to her family. 

Virginia requested this loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits to continue assisting her family with the additional income. The couple wants to give their two children a better education.

The story of Virginia and her business is just one of the many examples of GDMPC working for economic development clients.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Mehrubon

texts.en:
Mehrubon is widowed and has two adult children. Her son is 21 years old and her daughter is 26 years old. Fifteen years ago Mehrubon began her own business selling candies and chocolates. Before that, Mehrubon worked as waitress. She began her business thanks her first loan from IMON. 

Now, her business is going well. She has a lot of customers. This is her eleventh loan from IMON and she has a good credit story. Mehrubon is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy candies and chocolates for increasing working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy candies and chocolates for increasing working capital

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en: Florentino, 56 years old, is married with four children. He is engaged in farming business. Florentino is very hardworking father, and he always makes sure that he can provide all the needs of his family. That's why he is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer and seed for his farming business. He wishes to save enough money for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his farming business.

loans.name: Bemelinda

texts.en:
Bemelinda is 44 years old and married with five children.

Bemelinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like soft drinks, shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, beers and more to sell.

Bemelinda has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an  income from raising livestock.

Bemelinda aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like soft drinks, shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, beers and more to sell

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda works hard to support her family. Emelda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Emelda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, seasonings, hotdogs and other items for her food vending business.

Emelda has been in this business for 10 years now.

Emelda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, seasonings, hotdogs and other items for her food vending business

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth is 32 years old and married with two school-age children. She presently resides in Siloy, Calamba, where she does her farming activities. 

The farm has been doing well for 6 years now and is able to support their family needs. 

Jenneth joined Paglaum in 2007. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase additional eggplant seeds, watermelon seeds, and fertilizer. 

Jenneth smiles at the thought of seeing all her children finish their studies and hopes to live a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en: Sokun is 30 years old and a married mother blessed with one kid. For the sake of her entire family, she sells clothes and raises pigs as the main source of income. It is the business that she has had for 10 years. This is the third loan for Sokun and the first loan for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to timely support her business and to improve her livelihood better than before. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more piglets to raise, to build a pigpen, and to buy pig feed. She truly believes that she can raise her pigs healthily so that she can sell them at a good price.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise, to build a pigpen, and to buy pig feed

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat was born in 1962. She lives with her 3 children. Her husband died some years ago. 

20 years ago, Karomat began her own business by selling food items. She sells food items in a local market. Karomat works hard because her business is their only source of income. Karomat’s daughter helps her with managing the business. 

Karomat wants to increase her working capital because there is a great demand for food items in a local market. Karomat is asking for a loan of 1500 USD to buy food items such as butter, pasta, sugar and other items for increasing working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food items such as butter, pasta, sugar, and other items for increasing working capital

loans.name: Elinita

texts.en:
Elinita is 56 years old and is married with four children.

Elinita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elinita has borrowed and paid back 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Elinita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad enjoys her farming activities in Siloy, Calamba. At the age of 42, married with 2 children to feed, she labors a lot to provide for their daily needs and for the education of her children.

Being a farmer, she earns an average income of PHP 6,000 per harvest. Felicidad sign-up her membership with PMPC in 2007 and has taken several loans already. 

For this cropping season, she wants to take out a loan to purchase seeds and farm fertilizers. The profits she earns in her business will be used to invest in a sari-sari store as additional income, and the other funds for the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a meter, square, spirit level, and trowel

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a young and successful woman. She is 27 years old. Jamila is married and has no children. She began her own business with sewing eight years ago. She has enough experience to develop her business. Jamila sews women’s national dresses. She provides services to her clients in her house. She has regular customers. Jamila needs a new sewing machine because her sewing machine has broken. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Tajikistani Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory and other equipment to start his business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a well-established farmer living in Muranga area of central Kenya with his wife and five children. He enjoys farming because of its good returns.  He has been doing it for 40 years with his primary income sources being milk and tea, while his biggest challenge is labor and capital.

James said he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this dairy loan because he is after development and Juhudi always encourages farmers to develop more in agriculture. During the training session offered, he learned how to farm well.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es: María, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 4 hijos, reside en una aldea cerca al municipio de Gracias Lempira. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio y a la agricultura, vende mercadería y en temporadas vende café el que produce en su propia finca que esta ubicada en una zona montañosa. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace seis años. Lleva invirtiendo 10 ciclos de préstamos con el actual que es por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes para dar asistencia al cultivo de café para su venta. Su plan es mejorar las cosechas y los ingresos para ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old and in a common-law relationship with her husband. They have four children and reside in a neighborhood near the town of Gracias Lempira.

María has always worked in trade and agriculture. She sells merchandise and coffee on a seasonal basis. Her crop is produced on her own farm located in a mountainous area. She has been in this business for six years.

María has invested 10 loans. Her current loan is in the amount of 15,00 HNL and will be used to buy fertilizers for maintaining the coffee crop that she will sell. Her plan is to improve her crops and use the income to help her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for maintaining her coffee crop.

loans.name: Dúo Fragancia Viva Group

texts.es: Dúo Fragancia Viva este grupo esta conformado por la señora Sandra Carolina de 32 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones desde hace 10 años, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materiales para seguir elaborando refacciones para vender, espera que la puedan apoyar ya que este negocio le ha sido de mucha ayuda para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
The group “Fragancia Viva” includes Sra. Sandra Carolina. She is 32 years old and has been selling snacks for 10 years. Sandra is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy supplies so that she can continue preparing snacks to sell.

She hopes to receive support for her business since it has been a great help with moving her family forward.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing and selling snacks.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en: Maricris is 33 years old, married, and has three children. All her children attend school and are in need of daily allowances. She manages a small store in their village and sells grocery items in retail. She usually gets 3,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) each month, which supplements her family's needs. She wanted to increase her income but had insufficient funds; that is why she is asking for 17,000 PHP to buy sardines, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell. It will help increase the sales capacity of her business. She will also keep selling good products and services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy sardines, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Marivic has been in this business for four years. Marivic earns more income from raising livestock.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 42 years old and married with one child. 

Cheryl is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cheryl has been involved in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cheryl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
Medarda owns and operates an agricultural business, raising pigs for sale in the local community. For more than thirteen years, her income has increased. 

Aside from this, she also manages her cocoland (a piece of land planted with coconut trees), harvesting coco for sale. This is her main source of income. She has successfully repaid the previous loan used on her farm. She needs to improve the farm, so she requested a new loan to purchase fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Milton Ramiro

texts.es:
Milton es un joven de 22 años de edad nació en Latacunga perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi a este cantón se le conoce como uno de los mejores lugar por sus tradiciones entre ellas está la muy tradicional Mama Negra que es, un patrimonio cultural del estado.
El  mayor obstáculo en su vida ha sido el no poder haber concluido sus estudios ya que solo terminó la primaria, pues sus padres no cuentan con los recursos necesarios para poder dar la educación a Milton y sus hermanos, desde muy pequeños han trabajado en labores de agricultura y cuidando animales (vacas, cerdos, borregos,  pollos etc.) para poder solventar los gastos en su casa, y es por esta razón que Milton con toda la experiencia que ha tenido en su corta vida hoy en día se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos, con esto ha podido ser un gran apoyo moral y económico para su familia, nunca se ha dado por vencido y pese a todas las necesidades que ha  tenido que pasar ha sido un joven luchador , trabaja de cuatro a cinco horas diarias todos los días de la semana.
