A Milton se le dificulta mucho el cuidado de sus animales ya que no tiene un lugar adecuado donde cuidarlos, hoy solicita un crédito de mil dólares para la construcción de un galpón para que estos no se enfermen y estén mejor cuidados, también comprara más pollos.
Milton ha salido adelante junto a su familia quienes son su mayor orgullo y por eso está muy agradecido con  Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Milton, 22, was born in Latacunga in the province of Cotopaxi.  This canton is best known for its traditions, which include the very traditional Mama Negra, a state recognized cultural heritage.

Milton's greatest challenge in life was not being able to finish his education, as he only finished elementary school.  His parents could not afford to educate Milton or his siblings so they started working in agriculture and raising animals (cows, pigs, sheep, chickens, etc.) from a very early age to help cover household expenses.  Therefore, with all the experience he has in his short life, Milton now buys and sells chickens and is a great moral and economic support to his family.  He has never given up despite the hardships he has had, and he is a determined young man, working four to five hours a day every day of the week.

It is becoming difficult for Milton to care for the animals because he does not have an adequate space to do this, so he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to build a pen so the animals do not get ill and are better cared for.  He will also buy chickens.

Milton has been able to get ahead together with is family, his greatest pride.  Therefore, he is very grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making his personal and work growth possible.

loans.use: To build an animal pen and buy more chickens.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling herbal medicines in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of herbal medicines to sell to her customers for her business buying and selling herbal medicines.

Maricel has been in this business for five years. Maricel earns more income from direct selling personal collection products.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of herbal medicines to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ami's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis Décembre 2010, est constitué de 14 membres qui sont tous issus de la même zone.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Binta qui se trouve debout a l’extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras est la représentante du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants dont un garçon. Elle a comme activité la restauration.

Avec son crédit, elle va acheter 02 sacs d'arachide à 10000f l'un et 02 brebis a 15000f l'un et les 35000f seront investis dans la restauration .

Avec son bénéfice, elle désire assurer la scolarité de ses enfants, la santé et les besoins vitaux de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created in December 2010 and is made up of 14 members who all come from the same area. Their main activity is commerce.

Binta, who is standing on the far right of the photo and raising her arm, is the group representative. She is 51 years old, married and the mother of 8 children, one of whom is a boy. She runs a restaurant. She will use her loan to buy 2 bags of groundnuts (at 10 000 francs a bag) and 2 ewes (15 000 francs each) and a further 35 000 francs will be invested in her restaurant business. She wishes to use her profit to make sure her children get an education and to take care of her family's health and basic needs.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and sheep.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José tiene 64 años de edad, no sabe leer ni escribir, debido a la situación económica de sus padres ya que  en su época de juventud era muy difícil poder estudiar, es un padre soltero pues su compañera de vida lo abandonó dejándolo con sus dos hijos que estaban pequeños en aquel entonces, hoy son personas mayores que no han olvidado todo lo que su padre hizo por ellos, le retribuyen con ayuda económica, se dedicó a sus hijos y no quizo volver a formar otro hogar hoy en día vive con su pequeño nieto que está estudiando.

José se dedica a la venta de cocos desde hace dos años, buscando las formas de sobrevivir y poder ocupar su tiempo en alguna actividad pensó que le podría funcionar esta actividad, fue entonces que decidió iniciar con la venta de cocos, al principio como todo negocio no veía rendir ganancias poco a poco fue agarrando clientela y esta actividad empezó a dar frutos, tiene un carretón donde se va por toda la comunidad a a vender, lo realiza todos los días por las mañanas hasta llegar al medio día.

Él  utilizará el préstamo para comprar una mayor cantidad de cocos, debido a la época calurosa que tenemos necesita abastecer mas su carretón  para obtener un buen beneficio al vender mas cocos, lo que le genera mas ganancias.

José planea en un futuro reforzar su carretón para vender mas cocos, ayudar en todo lo necesario a su nieto que vive con él, de las ganancias él guarda un poquito ahorrando  para su futuro siendo él una persona de edad adulta.
texts.en:
José, 64, does not know how to read or write because his parents could not afford to pay for an education.  He is a single father since his common-law wife left him with two children when they were little.  Now they are adults and have not forgotten what their father did for them and they help him economically.  He dedicated himself to them and did not want to start a new family.  Now he lives with his young grandson who attends school.

José has been selling coconuts for two years.  He was searching for a way to earn an income and stay active so he thought about this business.  At first, like all businesses, he did not make any profit; but little by little he started attracting more customers and business took off.  He has a cart that he uses to sell throughout the entire community every day, working in the morning until noon.

He will use the loan to buy more coconuts.  In the hot season he has to have more stock to earn a good profit selling coconuts.

José plans to reinforce his cart to sell more product and help his grandson as much as he can.  He saves a bit of his earnings for when the grandson becomes an adult.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 30 years old and married with two children.

Annaliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 27,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Annaliza has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from selling food.

Annaliza aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Uviely Janneth

texts.es:
Uviely, una mujer de 34 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una mujer pujante y luchadora; durante 14 años de su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar de manera independiente en el campo de la confección y durante 4 años alternó su labor con otras actividades pero luego, decidió dedicarse de lleno a su negocio y comenzó a producir prendas de línea propia, las cuales comercializaba entre sus familiares, amigos y vecinos; trabaja sola todos los días de 9 am a 6 pm y así ha logrado generar los recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y para brindar sustento a su hijo de 3 años.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, lycra, hilos), esto le permitirá producir prendas deportivas lo que le permitirá tener más diversidad de ropa para ofrecer y satisfacer los gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes, logrando aumentar los ingresos familiares.
Uviely tiene como propósito, independizar el taller de su unidad residencial, pues así mejorará las condiciones de trabajo y podrá aumentar su producción, garantizando una mayor rentabilidad para que le permita brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Uviely, 34 years old, is a forceful and determined woman. For 14 years of her life, she has dedicated herself to working independently in the sewing business. For four years, she combined this work with other activities, but after that she decided to throw herself fully into her business and started to make garments for her own clothing line. She sold these to her relatives, friends, and neighbours. She works alone every day from 9 am to 6 pm. In this way she has managed to generate the income needed to help her spouse with household expenses and to support her three-year-old child.

She will invest the loan that she is requesting in the purchase of wholesale inputs (fabrics, lycra, and thread). This will allow her to make sports apparel, so that she will have a more diverse clothing line to offer her customers. This way she will be able to satisfy the tastes and requirements of her customers, and she will increase her family's earnings. 

Uviely's goal is to move her workshop outside of her home, which would improve her working conditions and allow her to increase her production. This would guarantee better profitability so that she could provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy inputs (fabrics, lycra, thread) wholesale .

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Ben vivent toutes dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes au quartier Angoulême l’un des quartier de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font la restauration et le petit commerce de haricot. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Salimata (la deuxième femme assise à droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande restauratrice dans le quartier d’Angoulême et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de fonio dans le but d’en faire de plat de fonio  à la sauce a base de poisson de poisson et de la viande. La vente se fait au restaurant au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Salimata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour  des frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The 4 women of the Ben group all live in monogamous families. They have an average age of 37 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in the Angoulême district, one of the districts of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and family relationships and marriage, and through their revenue-generating activities in the district. They sell prepared food and beans. The members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business activities and are on their first group loan cycle.

Salimata (the woman sitting on the right in the photo) runs a successful restaurant business in the Angoulême district. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of fonio with which to make a fonio-based meal with a fish or meat sauce. She makes her sales in her restaurant for cash and often credit to a mixed clientèle. Salimata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 francs thanks to this loan. The profit will be used to cover her children's education expenses and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy fonio for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Missira l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce, de produits cosmétiques, d’habillement, de condiment et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Oumou (1ére  femme assise à droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de produits cosmétiques  dans le quartier de Missira et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de produits cosmétiques pour la satisfaction de sa clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Oumou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  25 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour  des petits besoins de ses enfants, aider son mari et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The 7 women of the Danaya group all live in monogamous families. They have an average age of 39 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in the Missira district, one of the districts of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and family relationships and marriage, and through their revenue-generating activities in the district. They sell beauty products, clothing, condiments and prepared food. The members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business activities and are on their first group loan cycle.

Oumou (the woman sitting on the right in the photo) is a well-known seller of cosmetics in the Missira district and the surrounding area. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of beauty products in order to satisfy her customer demand. She makes her sales for cash and often credit to a varied clientèle. Oumou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25 000 francs thanks to this loan. The profit will be used to cover her children's small needs, to support her husband and also to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Meuy's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Battambang province, Meuy, who is aged 55, lives with her husband and a daughter who is a garment worker. Meuy and her husband have been farming rice on their two hectares of farm land for almost 30 years and this is their primary business and main source of income for the family. 

To make additional income, Meuy sometimes helps her neighbors on their vegetable farms for fee. Meuy is not a new client of VisionFund. After successfully paying her previous loans, Meuy decided to take another loan, her sixth, from VisionFund to pay plowing fees for her rice farm. Meuy hopes to make more profit by selling the rice so that her family can upgrade their living conditions to a better level.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is 31 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice on her own farmland in Bakan district of Pursat province. Farming has been the major source of income for her family and she has been in this occupation for nearly 15 years. From her current business, she can provide basic necessities for her family and educate her children at school.

This time, Chanthou has applied for a loan which will be used to build a hygienic latrine and build water storage for the sake of her family members and so as to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Chanthou is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and build water storage for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and tools,

loans.name: Express Group

texts.en:
Yotam is a father of two kids who are in school. He is in his early thirties and makes his living by running a business selling electrical goods, like cables, wires, bulbs, sockets, extensions, and other power items. He has been in this business for two years. Yotam also manages another business of electronic money transfers through M-pesa and Tigo Pesa. He opens his shop from 9 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is Yotam's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous two loans to restock new goods and replace sold out stock in order to meet demand from his customers. He managed to pay back his previous loans successfully. He used the profit he earned to cover food expenses for his household and school fees for his family. Yotam is requesting another loan, which he will use to recharge his vaults of telephone money transfers, so that he can service more people. In coming years, Yotam would like to be a successful businessman.

Yotam will share this loan with his loan group "Express" which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to recharge his vaults of telephone money transfers to service more people.

loans.name: Ruel Brandon

texts.en:
Ruel Brandon is 21 years old and has been a private employee for more than a year. He serves as mechanic in his workplace offering repairs and maintenance in the shop. 

He joined GDMPC recently and took a loan to purchase fertilizer to improve the farm which his parents cultivate. Farming is the main source of income for his family and he has to support his parents in order to make a living. In the future, he wants to own a repair shop in order to have his own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarjargal is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in an apartment, in Khentii province, Mongolia. His wife Narantuya is 36 years old. His daughter Anuujin is 14 years old. His son Temuujin is 11 years old and goes to the local primary school. 

He has been running a tire repairs service business since 2007. He is now requesting loan of 400,000 MNT to purchase inventory and other equipment to improve his business. He is a hardworking, well behaved and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and other equipment to improve his tire repair station business.

loans.name: Eydi Melissa

texts.es:
Eydi es una joven de 22 años de edad agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 3 hijos con un grado de educación primaria completa. Ella es agricultora y ama de casa que en compañía de su compañero de hogar se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como ser maíz y frijoles realizando actividades como limpieza, abono, corte, recolecta entre otras. Ella aprendió esta actividad desde niña con sus padres ya que ellos son agricultores por tradición familiar y la tierra que en compañía de su pareja trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia familiar la cual está ubicada cerca de su casa de habitación aproximada mente a 100 metros de distancia al cual se trasladan diariamente. Los clientes que ella tiene son bodegas de la zona, intermediarios, vecinos, familiares y amigos.
Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL que permitirá adquirir insumos agrícolas como herbicidas y abonos que ayudaran a mantener sus cultivos de maíz y frijol sanos de plagas. Su mayor anhelo y más grande sueño es poder graduar a sus hijos de la universidad para que en el futuro puedan valerse por sí mismos ya que con lo que ellos ganan no les alcanza para dejarles un patrimonio digno y puedan enfrentar de manera favorable los problemas económicos.
texts.en:
Eydi, 22, is a young farmer and homemaker, with a complete primary education.  She has three children.  She and her husband grow basic grains such as corn and beans and take care of chores such as cleaning, fertilizing, cutting and harvesting, among other activities.  Eydi learned farming from her parents when she was a little girl.  Farming is a family tradition and the land the couple works on was inherited from family and is located near their home, about 100 meters away.  The customers they sell to are stores in the area, intermediaries, neighbors, family and friends.

She is requesting a loan through COMIXMUL to buy farm supplies such as herbicides and fertilizers to help keep the corn and beans free of disease.  Her greatest desire is for her children to get a university degree so they can support themselves and take on economic challenges, since she and her husband do not earn enough to leave a decent inheritance.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Juliana works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. Juliana is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like a nail cutter, nail polish, a nipper, etc. for her business.

Juliana has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like a nail cutter, nail polish and a nipper for her business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Juliet works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling herbal medicine in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling of personal collection products. Juliet is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of herbal medicines to sell in her herbal medicine business.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of herbal medicines to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 43 years old and married. They have two children attending school. In order to gain income, she raises hogs for sale. She even sells processed food products such as cured pork and hot dogs for additional profit. She usually earns about PHP 5,000 each month in her businesses, just enough to cover daily expenses and the allowance for her children at school. 

She wants to earn more funds to use for her family's unexpected expenses. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to invest in giving good nutrition to her hogs. She will buy feed and medicines for her hogs. It will help the hogs to gain more weight which will mean they can be sold at a higher cost someday. In the future, she hopes to become a successful entrepreneur in their village.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines to sustain her hogs.

loans.name: Angielyn

texts.en:
Angielyn is 22 years old and married with two children. Angielyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Angielyn has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, vinegar, noodles, detergent soap, soy sauce, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL TRIUNFO, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Yolanda tiene 28 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche, golosinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz y leche para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de frutas, artesania, elaboracion de chicha, mototaxi, venta de productos secos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank El Triunfo. The bank is located in the district of Lamay, in the province of Calca and department of Cusco. 

The member, Yolanda, is 28 years old, has one child and is single. She alternates her daily activities with her business, a grocery store. She sells different types of products, like rice, sugar, milk and candies, among other items. She has been running her business for a good amount of time, and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts in every day. The member is a responsible and earnest person, since it is in this way that she helps her family to get ahead.

The member is requesting this loan to purchase rice and milk for her business. She feels grateful for the credit she has been granted and is committed to meeting her established payment schedule.

The other members of the group work in fruit sales, handicrafts, making corn beer, mototaxi, and selling dried goods.

loans.use: to buy rice and milk for her business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. Analiza is single and has a business selling electronic mobile load in the Philippines.

Analiza requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional electronic mobile load to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for a year now.

In the future, Analiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic mobile load to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. Emma is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Emma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Emma has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Emma would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten bundles of wheat flour, sugar and ten cartons of cooking fat.

loans.name: Ron's Group

texts.en:
Ron is married with three children. She is 50 years old and has been farming rice to support the family for more than twenty years. Lacking working capital is the main problem of her business. 

Ron, after successfully repaying her previous loans, has been selected to be a leader to lead a loan group of three female members including herself. Ron used her portion of the loan to pay plowing fees for her rice farm. She really hopes that the crop this year will produce a higher yield allowing her to sell for higher price so that she can better support her family with sufficient and nutritious food.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Savath's Group

texts.en:
Savath is a resident from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is 44 years old and a married mother of three children. Two of them rely on her as they are in school. 

To strive for a living, she sells dessert as her main source of income and catches fish to sell to supplement her income. She has been involved in her business for 15 years. She is a former borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for seven previous loan cycles, which she has repaid back completely. This had a positive impact on her family, as well as provided timely support toward her business. 

Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to renovate her house and to buy ingredients for making dessert to sell. She hopes her family’s business will improve so she can increase her income to keep supporting her family.

loans.use: to renovate her house and to buy ingredients for making dessert to sell.

loans.name: Bona's Group

texts.en:
Bona is 44 years old and married with six children of whom five are under her care and still in school. Rice farming is the family's main source of income and they have been doing this business for more than twenty years. To make additional income to support her big family, sometimes Bona works for others for fees. 

Bona is now leading a group of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund. She will use her portion to pay plowing fees as she needs to hire someone to help with this. Bona wishes to make more income for the family to live healthily and so her children can remain in school.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana es una mujer de 36 años de edad la cual es madre de seis hijos siendo estudiantes 4 de ellos, casada quien acompaña a su esposo al campo para la siembra de maíz y frijol dedicándose a esta actividad por más de 20 años ya que a muy temprana edad aprendió de sus padres quienes se han dedicado al trabajo de campo por años. Doña Juana únicamente tiene 2 años de educación cursados en la primaria ya que sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron apoyarle por lo que a temprana edad le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra para que en un futuro ella trabajara y pudiera generar sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia y su hogar. En el trabajo de campo se involucra la familia (sus 6 hijos y su esposo) contribuyendo todos a la causa para fortalecer los ingresos en el hogar y así sentirse parte de algo y ser un apoyo para sus padres quienes son muy humildes pero trabajadores.
Sus planes a futuro son los de poder seguir ampliando más sus parcelas de tierra para poder seguir cultivando más granos básicos, poder arreglar su casa de habitación la cual necesita mejoras, diversificar sus cultivos para no depender de uno solo y así generar mayores ganancias para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. Es por esa razón que actualmente ella ha solicitado apoyo financiero para poder comprar semilla certificada de maíz y frijol para poder sembrarlo así como también la compra de insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a dar un excelente mantenimiento y protección de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Doña Juana is a 36-year-old woman and the mother of six children, four of whom are students. She is married and accompanies her spouse to the fields to plant corn and beans. She has dedicated herself to this work for more than 20 years, since she learned it at a very young age from her parents, who worked in agricultural activities for years.

Doña Juana only has two years of primary school education, since her parents had limited resources and couldn't manage to send her to school. For this reason, they taught her to work the earth at a young age, so that in the future she would work and be able to generate income to support her family and her household. Juana's whole family (her six children and her spouse) are all involved in working in the fields, so they all contribute to strengthening the family's income and they feel as though they are part of something. They are a source of support for their parents who are very humble but hardworking.

Juana's future plans are to be able to continue increasing her plots of land and to grow more bulk grains. She would also like to be able to fix up her home, which requires improvements, diversify her crops so that she doesn't depend on only one, and generate more earnings to support her children in their studies. It's for this reason that she is currently requesting financial support, so that she can buy certified corn and bean seeds to plant. She will also buy agricultural inputs which will help her to give excellent maintenance and protection to her crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and high quality corn and bean seeds to plant.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea, 33, is a farmer from Battambang province and a mother of three children. Presently, all of them are still under her responsibility as they are in school. The main source of her income is rice farming and a paid working job.  She has been involved in this business for 15 years and it has earned her 37,200 KHR per day. 

This is not her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan, with a successful repayment, has enabled her to improve her living conditions over time. Now, she is leading a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline, and to pay for labor fees. She strongly hopes that she can gain a better income better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline, and to pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Carlos Bernardino

texts.es:
Carlos de 43 años de edad, es una persona que estudio hasta el 9° grado, se acompañó y tienen 6 hijos  de 2, 5, 8, 10,12 años de edad los mayores están estudiando y los menores pasan en casa con su esposa, él trabaja de albañil es contratista y la va muy bien en el trabajo ya que es muy conocido en la zona, esto se debe por el buen trabajo que desempeñan.
Su esposa solo se dedica al oficio de la casa, y también al trabajo de la agricultura en la época de siembra del maíz, es una familia muy numerosa pero todos ayudan en la casa para salir adelante en la vida cotidiana.


Carlos trabaja en la construcción y remodelación de casas y también en la agricultura este trabajo lo desempeña hace 27 años, esto lo aprendió poco apoco cuando era un joven era ayudante y hoy él es el contratista. Trabaja desde la 5:00 am hasta las 4:00 pm.  

El señor, con el crédito que solicita comprará materiales para construir una habitación  mas en la casa,  como lo es cemento, arena, ladrillo; ya que su familia tendrá un nuevo miembro que viene en camino  y con los materiales que comprara terminara la habitación adicional que él realizara.

Sueña con ver en un buen estado la casa,  donde él vive y que sus hijos tenga una buena educación, para que el día de mañana tengan un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Carlos is 43 years old. He went to school through 9th grade. He has a partner and they have 6 kids, who are 2, 5, 8, 10 and 12 years old. The oldest are in school and the youngest stay home with his wife. He works as a mason on contract and is doing very well in his work as he is well known in the area for the good work that he does.
His wife looks after the household and also works as a farmer during the corn sowing season. They have a very large family, but everyone helps at home so that they can succeed in daily life. 
Carlos works building and remodeling houses and also in agriculture, and he has been doing this for 27 years. He learned little by little when he was a young assistant and today his is a contractor. He works from 5:00am until 4:00pm. 
He will use the loan to buy materials to build another room onto his house. He will buy cement, sand, and bricks. His family will have a new member coming soon and he will use the materials that he buys to finish the additional room that he is building. 
He dreams of seeing the house in a good state and that his children will have a good education so that tomorrow brings a better future.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks to build a room.

loans.name: Socheat's Group

texts.en:
Socheat is a resident of Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 39 years old and she is also a mother of four dependent children, three of whom are of school age and one remaining is helping her at home. Rice farming is the main source of income and rice-selling business is the supplementary business for her to earn extra income. She has been in this business for six years. 

This is the eight cycle for Socheat and her two co-borrowers, and first cycle for one remaining borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The past loan which she has repaid back completely has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle so it is better than before. The total amount requested by her entire group is 5,200,000 KHR. Socheat, whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR and who is a group leader, will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticides and to pay labor fees. She hopes her rice will produce more crop yield for her than last year.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and to pay labor fees.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, un comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia e Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la comercialización de mercadería y abarrotes, como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, art. de aseo, desde hace 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, Teofilo ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 53 years old. He lives with his wife and a son in the district of Oyotún. This community's people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. Oyotún is located in the province of Chiclayo in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Teofilo works selling merchandise and groceries like milk, oil, rice, sugar, soft drinks, and toiletries. He has had his shop in his house for 10 years.

Teofilo has asked for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy a variety of products for his clients. By this, he wants to earn more money for his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for his customers.

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.en:
Hikmatullo was born in the year 1991. Hikmatullo is married but he has not got any children yet. He began his driving business three years ago. Little by little, Hikmatullo developed his business. Thanks to his good service he has his regular customers. From his profits, Hikmatullo improves his living conditions. He tries to buy all necessary furniture before the birth of his first child. 

He needs the loan because his car has broken and he must repair it. Hikmatullo is asking for a loan of 1,600 Somoni to repair his car. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To repair his car.

loans.name: Anie

texts.en:
Anie is 27 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Anie works very hard to provide for them.

Anie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like snack foods, biscuits, soft-drinks, coffee, juice, sugar, etc. to sell.

Anie has been in this business for a year and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, soft-drinks, coffee, juice, sugar, etc. 

Anie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like snack foods, biscuits, soft-drinks, coffee, juice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been a well-established farmer for over 26 years. She lives in Muranga area of Central Kenya where her primary income is milk, tea, crops. She enjoys working on her farm because of the income she gets out of it, while her biggest challenge is insufficient water for her crops and livestock.

Mary chose Juhudi Kilimo because of the development which Juhudi brings to farmers.During the training,she learned more about loan management. This dairy loan will enable her to acquire a dairy cow which will bring in more income to her and improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Orfa Lía

texts.es:
Orfa es una mujer pujante, servicial y carismática, a sus 61 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos a los que sacó adelante con mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y sacrificio.
Desde hace 17 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, pues tiene un restaurante y cafetería ubicado en la vía troncal a la costa atlántica, por lo que es un sector bastante transitado especialmente por conductores de camión y buses interdepartamentales por lo que son ellos los que constituyen su principal clientela, trabaja sola durante toda la semana y con empeño y constancia ha logrado darle continuidad a su negocio, a pesar de los obstáculos y factores externos como problemas de orden público que, en ocasiones afectan negativamente sus ventas.
Con el crédito que solicita actualmente desea cancelar el saldo del crédito que tiene vigente, cambiar la baldosa del piso del establecimiento y comprar insumos al por mayor (carnes, granos, gaseosas, mecato), esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen del negocio, lo que permitirá cambiar la perspectiva de los transeúntes y así atraerá nuevos clientes para continuar prestando un servicio de excelente calidad, esto se reflejará en el incremento de las ventas y las ganancias.
Orfa tiene como propósito ampliar y acreditar mejor su negocio, para poder generar oportunidades de empleo y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Orfa is a vigorous woman, helpful and charismatic. At 61 years of age, she is a single mother to 3 children who she is bringing up with much effort, dedication, and sacrifice. 

For 17 years, she has worked as an independent business woman. She has a restaurant and cafeteria located on the main road along the Atlantic coast, which gets a lot of traffic, especially from truck drivers and interstate buses and these are her main customers. She works alone all week and, with determination and consistency, has been able to keep her business going despite obstacles and external factors such as problems with public order that, on occasion, have a negative affect on her sales. 

She will use the loan that she is currently requesting to repay the loan that she already has, to change the floor tiles in her business, and to buy supplies in bulk (meat, sodas, snacks). This will enable her to improve the image of her business and change the perspective of passers-by and so to attract new customers so she can continue offering high quality service. This will be reflected in an increase in the sales and profits. 

Orfa's goal is to grow her business further so that she can generate employment opportunities so that she can improve the living conditions and well being of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and change floor tiles in her business in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 12 crates of beer and ten crates of soft drinks.

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn, 22 years of age, is married to a utility man, and blessed with one child. She has managed a hog-raising business for almost three years and is earning a net income of PHP 6,000 per hog. Her income from her business is usually spent on purchasing other hogs to raise and sell. 

Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase hog feed to supply the needs of her hogs. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed to supply the needs of her hogs.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se encuentra cerca al valle del Río Jequetepeque, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de cuyes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, Juan también se desempeña como jornalero agrícola y ha solicitado un préstamo de Edpyme Alternativa de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra cerdos pequeños y cuyes para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Juan is 50 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Zaña, a community close to the Rio Jequetepeque valley in the province of Chiclayo, which is part of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The people there work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising. 
Along with his wife, he works raising and selling guinea pigs. His business is located in the back part of his home. Juan also works as an agricultural day laborer and has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative for $450 to buy small pigs and guinea pigs so that he can fatten them and offer them at a better price.

loans.use: to buy small pigs and guineapigs.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de sus cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Humberto is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the District of Callayuc. This community has green pastures and is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located in Cutervo Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Humberto works in agriculture and grows coffee. He has worked in growing coffee for 10 years and his wife helps him. 

He has asked for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy manure to maintain his coffee crops, and by this to have a timely harvest to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy manure for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Loriefe

texts.en:
Loriefe is 24 years old and married with one child. 

Loriefe is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Loriefe requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Loriefe has been in pig-fattening for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Loriefe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Artemia is 45 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Artemia has a general store business in the Philippines. Artemia requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Artemia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Artemia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Zebuniso

texts.en:
Zebuniso is a woman with kind heart. She is married and has two children. Zebuniso’s husband is a builder. She is smart and a person with a higher education. She has a higher pedagogical education. Zebuniso has worked in a local school for more than 20 years. She is one of the best teachers. She has a lot of pupils. Her pupils who graduated from school work in different spheres of society. 

She wants to repair her house because her house is in a bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 2,800 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood and etc. to repair her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en: Sarin is 33 years old and a local villager from Battambang province. She is a mother of three dependent kids who remain in school. To deal with the daily cost of living, she does rice farming and pineapple planting as the main sources of income. She has been involved in her current business for several years. Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, she is now forming a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for land preparation and to buy fertilizer for her pineapple field. She hopes to gain more yield and sell at a good price so she can earn more money to support the family.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation and buy fertilizer for her pineapple field.

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elvera works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Elvera is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell through her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Elvera has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
Kheng is a 59-year-old and a citizen from the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and blessed with two children. To struggle for a living, she does rice cropping and sells fish paste to supplement her income. She has been involved in her current business for ages. This is the first cycle loan for her and her group member, who are requesting 1,000,000 KHR each with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

As the leader, Kheng is planning to use her entire loan to buy more fish paste for resale. She hopes that this purchase will enable her to support her fish paste selling business in a timely manner and bring her a decent income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more fish paste for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Kinyua

texts.en:
Kinyua is a resident of Kerugoya area of Central Kenya. He loves farming and has been doing it for 23 years with his income coming from the sale of milk, eggs, tea and a variety of crops. He is married and has three children whose ages range from 16 to one. His biggest challenge in farming is raising enough money for his farming projects.

Kinyua chose Juhudi Kilimo because he wants to grow in farming and Juhudi will help him finance his projects. This dairy loan will help him build a favorable place where his dairy cows will produce more and thus will lead to an increase in income. This will bring an improvement to his family's living standards.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: My

texts.en:
My, aged 59, is married and a responsible mother of six children. Most of her children are employed and live independently; only her youngest child still needs her support. To meet the needs of her family, she and her husband operate their own farm in Bakan district, Pursat province. After 40 years of farming rice, My has improved her farm successfully and earns well for her family.

Recently, she has asked for a loan amounting to USD 500 to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and so as to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), My is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Mosoc Runa Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MOSOC RUNA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la señora Livia, la socia  tiene 60 años de edad tiene 05 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa ,correas, zapatos entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia de forma independiente vendiendo su mercadería a todos sus clientes que solicitan ,la socia trabaja a pedido, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas para su negocio.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de ropa, ferretería, carpintería.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank Mosoc Runa. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco,
One member is Lívia. She is 60 years old and has 5 children and is married. She combines her day to day work with a business selling clothes, belts, shoes, and other things. She puts a lot of time into her business and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day. She sells her products independently, selling to all the customers who make orders. She works to order. She is a responsible and earnest person and she is bringing up her family with these attributes. 
She is requesting the loan to buy jackets for her business.
The members in the smaller photo asked permission to be late for the meeting for work reasons. 
Lívia is grateful for the offered loan and promises to repay it as agreed. 
The other members of the bank work selling clothes, hardware, and carpentry services.

loans.use: to buy jackets for their business.

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es:
Dagoberto tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc una comunidad con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café desde hace 10 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 501 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dagoberto is 38 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Callayuc district, a community with green scenery whose residents work in agriculture, commerce, and cattle raising. It is located in the Cutervo province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern mountains.

He has worked in agriculture for the past 10 years, growing coffee crops. His wife assists him with this work. 

He has requested a loan of 2,501 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizer to maintain his crops so that he will have an appropriate production to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia works hard to support her family. Eugenia is married and has a business buying and selling scrap materials in the Philippines.

Eugenia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more scrap metal for her business.

Eugenia has been in this business for six years now.

Eugenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metal for her business.

loans.name: Ma Angel

texts.es:
Doña Ma Angel es una señora de 45 años de edad luchadora, con mucha fuerza a pesar de su edad y no deja de soñar en grande con un grado de estudio primario incompleto que por la falta de recursos económicos no pudo terminar su primaria ya que desciende de una familia económicamente humilde. Ella tiene casa propia e independiente y con ella viven 5 hijos quienes dependen de ella y su esposo los cuales le ayudan en sus cultivos de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo. Doña Ma Angel tiene mucha experiencia ya que ella se ha dedicado al cultivo siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. El terreno lo adquirió por medio de una herencia de sus padres el cual está ubicado a 100 metros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada caminando diariamente. Sus clientes son los diferentes intermediarios de la zona, familiares, amigos y demás.  
Actualmente solicita financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder invertir en la compra de semilla certificada de maíz y frijol, abono 12-24-12 y 18-46-0 los cuales ayudaran a dar un excelente cuidado y protección a sus cultivos. Su planes a futuro es poder ahorrar para seguir ampliando sus cultivos, fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos ya que uno de sus mayores desafíos es poder graduarles para que sean personas preparadas académicamente y con muchas más opciones en la vida.
texts.en:
Ma Angel is a 45-year-old, tenacious woman who is very strong despite her age. She hasn't stopped dreaming big. She was unable to complete a primary school education due to a lack of economic resources, since she is from an economically humble family.

She has her own home and lives with her five dependent children and her husband. They help her to tend to her crops, which include corn, beans, and sorghum. Maria Angel is very experienced since her parents taught her at a very young age how to work the land. She inherited her land from her parents and it is located 100 meters from her home. She walks to the land every day.

Her customers include different intermediaries in the are, family, friends, and others. She currently requests a loan from COMIXMUL to invest in the purchase of certified corn and bean seeds, and 12-24-12 and 18-46-0 fertilizer, which will help her to provide excellent care and protection to her crops.

Her future plans are to save money to continue to increase her crops and strengthen her estate for her children, since one of their greatest challenges is graduating so that they can become academically prepared individuals with many options in life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and certified corn and been seeds to grow.

loans.name: Farukh Javaid

texts.en:
Farukh is 34; he is a young and energetic person living in the area of Sahiwal, Pakistan. He is married and has recently taken over a clothing business from his father. In fact his father begins the clothing sales business; after his father Farukh will be the next person earning for the family. Farukh’s father has great expectations from him. Now this garment shop is the only source of income for his family this is the reason he devotes his all concentration and time to the garment shop. 

His shop is situated under the garment market and there is lot of competitors in the market. Due to this competition it is very difficult to convince customers over a high price. This competition becomes the cause of low sales and more efforts as well. He has to maintain the latest designs, prices and also have delightful colors in his shop so that he could maintain the rate of sales.

Now the major problem is that the summer season is about to start and he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy clothing for the summer season. If he becomes unable to replace the winter season’s clothing with the summer season clothing then it might highly affect his sales. He does not want to reduce his sales and monthly income as well.

Therefore, Farukh has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be empowered to buy clothing for the summer season. 
Farukh  hopes that he will purchase clothing according to his desire on right time so that he can cope with the market competition and can grow his income as well. He thanks Kiva and its field partner for this support.

loans.use: To buy summer season's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Oeurt's Group

texts.en:
Oeurt is a resident from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is 42 years old and married with nine children, seven of whom are still under her support. Rice farming is the main source of income and they have been in this business for around twenty years. Crops destroyed by insects is the main challenge for their business. 

This is Oeurt's fifth loan with VisionFund. Oeurt used her loan portion to buy rice seeds, pesticides and spend on necessary expenses such as plowing. Oeurt wishes that this loan will enable her to make more profit from the crops and hence her family's living standard will improve and the children will be able to go to school regularly.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, pesticides and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Ortikjon

texts.en: Ortikjon is a repeat client of IMON. She is a kind and hardworking woman. Ortikjon is 58 years old. She is married and has adult children. She is also a lovely grandmother. Ortikjon has been busy with animal husbandry more than 20 years. She has a great amount of experience. She has additional income from growing potatoes and wheat. With profit from her business, Ortukjon organized the traditional ceremonies of her grandchildren. She is going to increase the number of her cattle. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy cattle for increasing her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is 70 years old, married, and has five children of various ages. She is engaged in an agricultural business, farming rice on her own farmland located in Kampong Thom province. After 51 years of experience in farming rice, Touch has improved her farm successfully and plans to expand her planting in order to increase her production. She also earns additional income from selling Khmer natural medicines.

She has applied for a loan to buy a cart for transport. This purchase will allow her to transport fertilizers to the field or transport rice from the field back to her home. It’s also used for providing transportation service to local people for additional income. Being patient and industrious, she believes that she will expand her farm and increase her production.

loans.use: to buy a cart for transport.

loans.name: Eva Consuelo

texts.es:
Eva Consuelo tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a l agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Se dedica a la compra y venta de animales de corral pato, gallinas y cerdos desde hace 4 años, Eva se dedica a esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y una segunda parte para la compra de arreglos de su corral con la compra de calamina.
texts.en:
Eva Consuela is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Oyotún district, a community whose residents work in agriculture, commerce, and cattle raising. It is located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

She has made a living for the past 4 years by purchasing and selling farm animals like ducks, chickens, and pigs. She does this to help her husband with the household expenses.

She has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed and also to purchase corrugated iron to repair her corral.

loans.use: to purchased balanced feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia tiene la edad de 42 años, está casada y vive con el esposo y tres hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de gallinas y la alimentación de las mismas. Ella desea  poder iniciar con esta actividad de gallinas ponedoras y vender los huevos a sus vecinos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 42 years old, married, and is living with her husband and three children. She wants the loan to buy hens and food for the hens. She wants to be able to start with laying hens and sell the eggs to her neighbors. Eugenia hopes that in the future, she will be able to offer her family better quality of life and economic stability, and that she will be able to continue to grow as a person.

This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She hadn't had other loans with state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR offered her the loan with less difficulty and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy hens

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo  tiene la edad de 24 años, es soltero y vive con los padres y dos hermanos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado  y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a el y sus padres. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 24 years old, single, and currently lives with his parents and two siblings. He requests the loan to purchase cattle so that he can sell them when they are fattened and earn a profit. His cattle-raising business will help him and his parents. He hopes that, with this project, he will be able to grow and achieve his goals so that he can provide a better quality of life and more stability for his family.

This is the first loan that he has requested from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans with state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him a loan with better terms and with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es:
Doña María Paula de 54 años de edad, es agricultora por tradición ya que en su familia por generaciones se ha dedicado al trabajo de campo siendo este rubro el factor económico principal de su familia. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el sexto grado, es madre de 10 hijos de los cuales ayudan a sus padres en el trabajo de campo y algunos estudian. La siembra y cultivo de maíz y frijol es el rubro que ella y su familia trabajan la cual al final de la cosecha es vendida a los intermediarios y vecinos de la zona donde ella habita, estos a su vez la re venden en el mercado local o a nivel nacional. Sus cultivos están ubicados en la misma propiedad donde está construida su casad de habitación permitiendo esto ser una gran ventaja para poder darle una asistencia permanente y evitar el contagio de plagas, aves, etc.
Sus planes seguir fortaleciendo el patrimonio para sus hijos, enseñarles a trabajar honradamente, diversificar lo que cultiva para así aprovechar el espacio de su propiedad. También seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que ellos puedan graduarse y superarse, alcanzar un mejor nivel de vida y puedan enfrentar los problemas económicos de manera favorable. Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara semilla certificada de maíz y frijol para poder cultivar e insumos agrícolas con los cuales dará el mantenimiento necesario posible para obtener una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Maria Paula is 54 years old. She is a farmer by tradition since her family has worked in the country for many generations and have supported themselves this way. She attended school until the sixth grade. She has 10 children who help their parents with the farming and attend school. Her family has grown corn and beans and sell their final product to intermediaries and neighbors in the are where they live. Then, these people re-sell the products in the local or national market.

Her crops are located on the same property where she built her home, which gives her a great advantage because she can provide constant assistance and avoid pests, birds, and other things. Her plans include strengthening her estate for her children, teaching them to work honestly, and diversifying her crops to take advantage of her property's space. She would also like to continue to support her children in their studies so that they can graduate and improve themselves, achieve a better quality of life, and face economic problems favorably.

She has requested a loan, which she will use to purchase certified corn and bean seeds and agricultural supplies so that she can provide the maintenance necessary to obtain an excellent  harvest.

loans.use: to purchase certified corn seeds and agricultural supplies to help her corn crops.

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en:
Dilfuza was born in 1975. She is married and has 4 children. 

Dilfuza lives with her family in a village. She has no source of income. Now, she is going to set up her own business and in this way earn a living. Dilfuza is going to establish an animal husbandry business. She took part in a course called ‘To Get Ahead’, offered by a women's organization, and got a lot of new information for herself about business. 

She is asking for a loan of 6000 Somoni to buy cattle for establishing this new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for establishing her new business

loans.name: Virgen Inmaculada Group

texts.es: Zuleica  de 23  años de edad soltera   y  con 1  hijo,  zuleica  tiene una  pequeña bodega (alquilado) ya hace unos  1 año. zuleica   ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar, En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos  y así obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos como (arroz, azúcar, menestras, aceites, cubiertos, platos etc.) Para su posterior venta  y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  zuleica  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Zuleica   se encuentra parada  en el medio se le distingue por su  bivirí de color negro y pantalón verde oliva, adjunto la foto de la Señorita Tania alegría  por el motivo que no pudo estar en la reunión de desembolso por motivo de trabajo,  Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Zuleica is 23 years old, single, and has one son. She has rented a small store for the past year. Zuleica has been able to make her customers loyal, which has allowed her to generate enough income to cover her household expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own location where she can sell products and earn more money.

With the loan, she hopes to invest in more products like rice, sugar, legumes, oil, cutlery, plates, etc. so that she can sell them and continue to satisfy her clients' needs and move forward. 

Zuleica and the other members are very grateful to Kiva for the loan and for the confidence that they have shown. Zuleica is the one standing in the middle of the photo wearing a black tank top and olive green pants. Tania is in the photograph on the right; she was not able to attend the meeting due to work. She promises to comply with all of the proposed goals.

loans.use: to purchase legumes.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 58 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y un  hijo y un nieto  actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigaciones, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Luis, age 58, is an enterprising man.  He is married, and he currently lives with his wife, a son, and a grandson.

He requested a loan because he wants to buy supplies like fertilizers and fumigants.  He wishes to provide care to his coffee crops in order to keep them in good condition as they are developing.  He wants to do this in order to get a good quality product.  

The only limitation that this gentleman has is the lack of money to continue growing.  He is dependent upon this business activity in order to be able to get ahead.  That is why he is requesting the loan.  It is the first loan that he has had with FUDECOSUR.

He does not have other loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR provided him the loan with better terms, and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers and fumigants.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Alaglowa Shkabolo Group

texts.es: Doña Yonoris es una mujer con 32 años de edad, casada y madre de 5 hijos menores. Vive con su esposo y sus hijos, en una comunidad rural llamada Shiroles. Es una clienta trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación. Ella se dedica a generar ingresos mediante la cria de pollos y su venta, la cual es su actividad principal y en ocasiones también vende por catálogos, debido a que su esposo es jornalero y lo que gana no es mucho, entonces ella le ayuda economicamente un poco aportando a su hogar, pagando los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos y más. Ella desea crecer en su actividad para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y la de su familia, a pesar que habita en una zona alejada. Sus otras 3 socias que la apoyan en éste programa también refuerzan sus negocios de la avicultura y la porcicultura con el financiamiento. Su moral de pago ha sido excelente.
texts.en: Yonoris is a 32 year old woman. She is married and the mother of 5 young children. She lives with her husband and children in a rural community called  Shiroles. She is a hardworking children who really wants to get ahead. She generates income from raising chickens and selling them. It is her main activity and sometimes she also sells via catalogs. Since her husband is a laborer and doesn't earn a lot, she helps him financially a little. by contributing to the home and paying for her children's education expenses and more. She wants to grow in her activity to improve her and her family's quality of life, despite living in a very remote town. The other 3 members who support her in this program are also reinforcing their businesses with the loan, which are raising chickens and pigs. Their payment ethic has been excellent.

loans.use: the loan is going to be invested in buying chickens, pigs and feed.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en: Rin, a divorced mother of six children who is 60-years-old, has been farming rice to support her family for over ten years. This is the main source of income for the family. Crops destroyed by insects is the main challenge for her business.  That is why this time Rin is asking for another loan from VisionFund to buy pesticides and also fertilizers for her farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to make a higher yield of crops and then sell them for higher profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina owns and manages a rice farm, planting rice for sale and family consumption. Her previous loan from GDMPC (Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative) was successfully repaid. In order to improve the farm, she plans to expand the farm, for there were many available seedlings in the area. She took a new loan to cover replanting costs.  She will use the income generated from her farming to finance the costs of her children’s education. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her entire family.

loans.use: to cover replanting costs.

loans.name: Pemy

texts.en:
Pemy is a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is 42 years old and she is happily married to Wilfredo, who works as a mason. God has blessed them with loving children and all of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Pemy owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, aPhp5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg, or many other things. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns Php300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a loan of Php15,000.00. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Pemy dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that all her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer guerrera y trabajadora, a sus 28 años de edad se gana la vida trabajando de manera independiente como moto taxista, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. La actividad la realiza desde hace 1 año con una moto que alquila por $10.000 diarios, y su mayor desafío es la competencia actual que existe en el municipio, pues es una tradición que las personas de la región utilicen este tipo de transporte para su movilización.
El crédito que solicita está destinado para la compra de una moto, con lo que podrá continuar prestando el servicio de transporte de personas pero generando mayor rentabilidad, ya que ahorrará en gastos de alquiler.
