Sandra tiene como propósito seguir trabajando arduamente para así tener la posibilidad de ahorrar y en un futuro a mediano plazo estar en la capacidad de adquirir una vivienda propia, lo que mejorará notablemente las condiciones de vida y bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is a woman who strives and works hard. She is 28 years old and earns her living as an independent driver of a mototaxi. She learnt this trade from experience because of the need to help her husband generate the necessary income for the household. She has worked in this activity for one year, with a motorbike she rents for $ 10.00 per day. Her biggest challenge is the competition in her neighborhood, because it is a tradition that the people in the area use this kind of transportation to get around.

The loan she asks for will be used to buy a motorbike. With this motorbike, she will be able to continue offering the transportation service, but generate more profits because she will save on the expense to rent a motorbike.

Sandra’s plan is to continue her hard work and by this to have the possibility to make savings, and in the mid-term future to be able to buy her own home. This would very much improve the living conditions and the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 23 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Leah has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She aspires to saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María Rosa es agricultora y ama de casa, madre de dos hijos quienes viven con ella y su padre y ambos estudian. En compañía de su conyugue trabajan la tierra especialmente el cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijol ya que la zona es apta para este tipo de cultivo. Ella tiene un grado de escolaridad primario incompleto por lo que no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra siendo ellos agricultores por descendencia y la tierra que trabajan junto a su pareja es propias la cual están ubicadas contigo a su casa de habitación. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo de campo ya que son más de 10 años en compañía de su conyugue con quien ella ha desempeñado dichas actividades. Sus clientes son las mismas personas de la localidad amigos, familiares, vecinos entre otros que llegan a la zona en busca del grano. 
Ella ve la necesidad de poder ampliar más sus cultivos de maíz y frijol por lo que hoy en día solicita pueda ser apoyada con los fondos de KIVA para la compra de semilla certificada de maíz y frijol para poder sembrar de igual forma los insumos agrícolas que ayudaran al crecimiento y fortalecimiento del mismo evitando ser dañados por plagas y animales. Sus planes a futuro son los de extender sus cultivos y comprar más tierra para sembrar una mejor variedad, comprar vestías para poder trasportar la semilla en costales hasta otros sectores y poder generar más ganancias y buscar otros mercados. Sus sueños como madre es poder darle una educación completa a sus hijos y que sean mejores cada día que pasa.
texts.en:
María Rosa is a farmer and a housewife. She is the mother of two children who live with her and their father. They both go to school. She and her spouse work the land, specifically, growing basic grains such as corn and beans, because the area is suitable for those types of crops. She has an incomplete primary school education because she couldn't keep going due to a lack of financial support from her parents. Her parents were the ones who taught her to work the land. They were farmers by tradition and the land they worked was theirs and is located by her house. She has a lot of experience working the fields and has been with her spouse for more than 10 years and with his she has done these activities. Her customers are the people from her community, friends, relatives, neighbors and more who come to the area seeking grains. 

She needs to be bale to expand her corn and bean crops so today she is asking for help with KIVA funds to buy certified corn and bean seeds and agricultural materials. These will help her grow and fortify her crops and avoid damage from pests and animals. Her plans for the future are to extend her crops and buy more land to plant a wider variety, to buy animals to transport the seed in packs to other areas and be able to generate more income and seek other markets. Her dream as a mother is to be able to give her children a complete education so they can become better every day.

loans.use: to buy certified corn seed and agricultural materials for help and maintenance.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a hardworking woman. She is married and has 4 children. 

As her family is big, her husband's income is not enough to provide their children with all the necessary things. So, Aziza began her own business selling women’s dresses. Aziza runs her business well. Each season, she renews her goods. She is going to buy goods for the new season. 

She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy women’s clothes for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy women’s clothes for the new season

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie provides for her three children's needs from the little income she gains monthly from her transportation service business. Her husband is a driver. She had successfully repaid her previous loan buying tires and spare parts.  Recently, she took a new loan to cover the renewal of licenses and registration costs. She saves a portion of her generated revenue to achieve her dream of sending her children to school until they finish their studies.

loans.use: to cover the renewal of licenses and registration costs

loans.name: Luís Antonio

texts.es:
Luis de 66 años de edad, es una persona que estudio hasta el 9° grado,  él se dedicó a trabajar porque sus padres no podían sostenerle el estudio, eso a él lo motivo a buscar trabajo y poder ayudar a sus padres.

Luego se casó y tuvieron un niña que hoy en día, tiene 14 años de edad y estudia; luego se separó de su esposa por su problema al alcohol. Hoy en día solo vive con su hija, ya que su madre no la quiso mantener y el señor la recibió, el señor trabaja de compra y venta de hierro, también vende en la mañana el periódico y agua embolsada todos los día de la semana. Lo realizado desde hace 15 años, desde las 3:00 am de la madrugada y tiene que recorrer 2km para llegar al lugar de venta del periódico, pero también él sale con su carro a comprar y vender hierro ya que le genera un buen margen de ganancia para mantener a su hija y darle lo necesario para su ropa, el estudio y la comida de todo los día.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más hierro y a la ves a abastecer de agua potable a los clientes que ya tiene en su ruta de venta, para tener mayor ingreso, esto le generara un buen margen de ganancia y le mejorar su condición de vida.

Sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y en el futuro terminar crecer a su hija y verla  como una profesional ya que él no tuvo la oportunidad de llegar al bachillerato.
texts.en:
Luis, age 66, went to school through the ninth grades.  His parents were not able to support his education.  This motivated him to look for work to be able to help his parents.  He devoted himself to work.

Then he got married.  They had a daughter, who is now 14 years old and goes to school.  Then he separated from his wife due to his problem with alcohol.  Now he only lives with his daughter because her mother did not want to keep her.  He took her in.

Luis works by purchasing and selling iron.  In the morning he also sells the newspaper and packaged water every day of the week.  He has been doing this for 15 years.  He starts at 3:00 a.m., and he has to travel two kilometers to the place where they sell the newspaper.  He also goes out with his car to buy and sell iron.  The generates a good profit margin in order to support his daughter and to give her what she needs  like clothing, an education, and food every day.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy more iron and to provide the customers that he has on his sales route with potable water.  He will do this in order to have greater income.  This generates a good profit margin for him, and it improves his living conditions.

He dreams of making his business grow.  He also dreams of seeing his daughter become a professional in the future when she is an adult.  This is because he did not have the opportunity to get his high school degree.

loans.use: to buy more iron and to provide the customers that he has on his sales route with potable water.

loans.name: Dora Alejandra

texts.es:
Dora es una joven de 24 años de edad y madre soltera de una hija de 1 año de nacida; actualmente se gana la vida trabajando como madre comunitaria en un hogar del ICBF de la región; sin embargo, con el ánimo de mejorar sus ingresos, desea iniciar una venta de mercancía desde su vivienda, luego de cumplir con su horario laboral y así aprovechar la experiencia que adquirió mientras trabajaba por temporadas en almacenes de la ciudad.
Esto la impulsa para solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (ropa y cosméticos), así podrá dar inicio a su nuevo proyecto productivo, ofreciéndole gran variedad de artículos a sus clientes, pues con esto espera generar buenos recursos para el sustento de su hogar.
Dora, con su empuje, tenacidad y perseverancia manifiesta que quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de ser una microempresaria totalmente independiente y así tener la capacidad para brindarle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida y educación.
texts.en:
Dora is  a 24 year old woman and the single mother of a 1 year old daughter. Right now, she is earning a living as a community mother in a regional ICBF institution [Colombian Institute of Family Wellbeing]. Nonetheless, in order to improve her income, she wants to start selling merchandise from her home after finishing her work day. This way she can use the experience she acquired when she worked seasonally in stores in the city.  

This has driven her to ask for the help of a loan with which she wants to buy merchandise wholesale (clothes and cosmetics). This way, she will be able to start her new productive project, offering her customers a wide variety of items to her customers. With this she hopes to generate good income to support her home.  

Dora, with her drive, tenacity and perseverance, shows that she wants to keep fighting to make her dream come true of being a totally independent micro-businesswoman so she can offer her daughter a better quality of life and education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (clothes and cosmetics).

loans.name: Akhter

texts.en:
Akhter is 41-year-old man, living with his spouse and three children in the area of Sahiwal, Pakistan.

He owns a poultry farm near his hometown; he has many hens for getting eggs to sell. He supplies the eggs to a bakery, general stores and wholesalers. He wants to enhance his business buy offering broilers (chickens raised for their meat) as well, so for this purpose he wants to buy chicks and poultry feed. The eggs and broilers are the most demanded food items for the whole year. To cope with the demand and to get maximum profit, he wants to buy more chicks to get more eggs and broilers to sell. But due to household expenses, utility bills and miscellaneous expenses, he is unable to buy more hens. 

Therefore, Akhter has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy more chicks and can generate maximum income for his family. Akhter is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry feed for poultry farming.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar vive en compañia de sus 2 hijas en la ciudad de La Paz. Se dedica a la copmpra y venta al por mayor de productos de limpieza textil,  necesita el crédito para realizar una compra al por mayor de quimicos de limpieza ya que a la fecha hay demanda y se puede tener mayores ingresos.

El sueño de Oscar es que sus hijas salgan profesionales y brindarles las comodidad que se requiere.
texts.en:
Oscar lives with his two daughters in the city of La Paz. He works as a wholesale buyer and seller of textile cleaning products. He needs a loan to realize a bulk purchase of cleaning chemicals, because at the moment there is a high demand and he can make high profits.

Oscar’s dream is that his daughters can take up a professional career and he wants to give them what they need.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for textile cleaning.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba was born in 1979 and is married. She is a careful mother of 3 children and her husband is a welder.

Since childhood Habiba has helped her father with a retail business. Five years ago she began her own business selling household products, and her father helped her with managing the business. Habiba's shop is in the center of her region, and she is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy more household products to increase her working capital. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy household products to increase working capital

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.en: Bahriniso was born in 1981. She is married and has four children. Some years ago, they had no house and lived in a rental flat. Now, they are building their own house. Bahriniso is a sewer. She sews national women's dresses in her house. She also sews bedclothes. Bahriniso has additional income from animal husbandry. She feeds six cows. Bahriniso sells milk to local people. Bahriniso is going to buy windows for her house, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy windows. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy windows for her house.

loans.name: Mary Ricthel

texts.en:
Mary Ricthel is 39 years old and married with three children.

Mary Ricthel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like seasonings, canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar, coffee, etc.

Mary Ricthel has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Mary Ricthel aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like seasonings, canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
Doña María Santos es una señora muy capaz y muy trabajadora, casada la cual en compañía de su pareja y sus 6 hijos los dos mayores ya están graduados y los últimos 4 estudian aun quienes viven bajo su techo y ayudan en la agricultura siembra y cultivo de maíz y frijol. Ella tiene un grado de estudio primario completo por el cual agradece el apoyo moral y financiero por parte de sus padres. Tiene más de quince años de dedicarse a esta actividad en compañía de su pareja pero fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron todo acerca del trabajo de campo. El terreno donde están ubicados sus cultivos está a pocos metros de distancia desde su casa de habitación al cual se traslada caminando. Sus clientes son sus vecinos, familiares, amigos e intermediarios que viven y llegan a la zona para adquirir el producto el cual es considerado de muy buena calidad. 
Por lo que hoy ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas y semilla de maíz y frijol certificado para sembrar al igual que la compra de los insumos que ayudaran al desarrollo y crecimiento del mismo. Sus metas poder graduar a sus últimos 4 hijos, prepararlos con carreras que les ayuden a crear sus propios negocios, que sean personas preparadas y bien educadas para que puedan abrir puertas en el futuro y mejores oportunidades. Seguir incrementando sus parcelas de tierra para poder seguir cosechando y sembrando maíz y frijol ya que de esa forma sus ingresos serán mejores.
texts.en:
María Santos is a very capable and very hard-working woman.  She is married and has six children.  The two oldest have already graduated.  The last four go to school and still live under her roof.  They help in planting and growing corn and beans.

She completed her primary education.  For this she is grateful for her parents’ moral and financial support.

She and her life partner have been engaged in this business activity for 15 years.  However, it was her parents who taught her everything about working in the field.  The land where their crops are located is a few meters from her house.  She gets there by walking.  Her customers are her neighbors, relatives, friends, and intermediaries who live in and come to the area to get the product.  It is considered to be a very good quality product.

She is requesting the loan now to buy agricultural supplies and certified corn and bean seeds to plant.  These purchases will help with the development and growth of her crops.

Her goals are for her last four children to graduate, to prepare them for careers that will help them create their own businesses, and for them to become well-prepared and well-educated.  She wants this so that they are able to open doors in the future and have better opportunities.  She wants to continue to increase her land in order to be able to continue harvesting and growing corn and beans.  This way her profits will be better.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and certified corn and bean seeds to plant.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Felina has owned and operated a general store for more than five years, earning well for the family. With the support of her husband, her business runs successfully. With the revenue generated from her business, she repaid her previous loan successfully.  Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Masika Group

texts.en:
Salumu, who is in his mid-twenties, is single and has a baby girl. For three years now, he has been running a food shop selling rice, maize, baking flour, beans and other items.  His shop is open from 12:00 pm to 9:00 pm daily and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.
This is his sixth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania and he will use the loan to buy food stocks to resell.  He used the previous loans (all of which were paid back successfully) to restock on food items like sacks of rice, beans, sugar, maize and baking flour. He managed to earn extra income which he used to cover home food expenses and house building expenses. He dreams of finishing building his house and painting it with nice colors. 
Salumu will share this loan with his loan group, "MASIKA" which consist of six members. The members of this group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food stocks to resell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is aged 53, married to a farmer and blessed with five children. She's been into a business raising hogs for almost ten years and earning a net income of 5,000 PHP per hog. Her net profits on her business are usually spent on their daily expenses and the school allowances of their children.

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase hog feeds to supplement the needs of her hogs. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and be more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hog feeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes and blankets from South Africa to supply to tobacco farmers who are selling their produce.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith was born and brought up in Kisumu,a county in Kenya. She later moved to Nairobi in search of employment and settled in the expansive Mukuru Kayaba slum where she is a member of one of the youth groups in the area. 

Judith noticed the sanitation issues in the area through her youth group and wanted to find and provide a solution to the same. She hopes that by investing in a Fresh Life toilet it will help solve the sanitation issue in her area. She seeks a loan to help her purchase and run two fresh life toilets. The proceeds earned will be used to expand her franchise and also help her improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor was born in the year 1978. She is married and has 4 children.

Gulbahor is going to organize her own business because she needs the money. Gulbahor wants to open a men’s barber shop. Gulbahor’s husband will help her with managing the business. She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ at a women's organization and got a certificate.

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 somoni to buy equipment for her barber shop. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy equipment for opening men’s barber shop

loans.name: Sreyva

texts.en:
Sreyva, aged 26, is married and she has only one child. For 6 years now she has been in the business of growing rice in Prey Veng province. Her business is going well and she spends the majority of her profits on her family. As farming is the sole source of her income, Sreyva plans to expend her planting in order to increase her rice production.

As of now, Sreyva has applied for a loan which will be used to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members and build water storage to ensure enough water for the family’s consumption. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sreyva is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members and build water storage to ensure enough water for the family’s consumption.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn, aged 65, is a widow and a resident from a rural area of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She has five children who are in various careers; two of them work in the construction industry. To earn a living, she is engaged the agricultural business, farming rice in her village.

This loan will be used to buy construction materials to support Vorn’s two children in their construction work. She hopes this will bring in more income and increase their profit. She has been a client with HKL for one loan already and successfully repaid her loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to support her two children in their construction work.

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en: Nelie has been earning from her farm for many years. This is her main source of income. She earns so well from her farm that her previous loan was successfully repaid. Some portion of the farm was not covered in her previous fertilization. So Nelie decided to apply a new loan to purchase additional organic fertilizer. She wants to ensure a better source of income for her family. Nelie hopes to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional organic fertilizer

loans.name: Winrose

texts.en: Winrose lives in the Muranga area of Central Kenya where she has been doing farming for 25 years. She has one child who is now grown. Her primary income source is selling milk and tea. Farming is very important for her because it generates her income. Her challenges are capital and labor. Winrose chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they assist farmers in capital funding and training their clients. They also give their loans at a low interest rates. She says that the assets acquired will generate income for the family and thus their living standards will improve.

loans.use: Construction of a grazing unit.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is from Meria, a village in Ozurgeti region. She is 48 years old and lives with her husband, 2 children and mother-in-law.

The family's significant income is from agricultural activities. Manana and her husband cultivate agricultural land and grow nuts and maize. They are also extensively engaged in cattle and pig breeding, and in producing milk-products from 2 milked-cows they take care of. All mentioned products are sold to the local market. This income, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of her family.

As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Manana wants to expand her agribusiness in order to more effectively meet their daily expenses. She received credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Program gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. A loan of 4,000 GEL will be a great support to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to set up a poultry farm, buy chickens and nutrition vitamins and, after raising them, she will get significant earnings. Manana relies on the goodwill of the lenders and greatly appreciates their support.

loans.use: to buy chickens and nutritional vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials to finish his car wash and vehicle repair service station

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 58 años de edad, es una persona que desde que era un niño no estudio, sus padre no podía mandarlo a la escuela porque no tenían, dinero pero hace unos años él comenzó a estudiar en la escuela para adultos mayores, donde les enseña a leer y escribir el curso hasta el 6° grado y se graduó. Él tiene una familia muy grande son 7 hijos y su esposa la mayoría ya están casados otros están con eé pero trabajan y los demás pequeños están estudiando, es una familia muy unida trabajadora.    

Pedro solo se dedica a la agricultura, desde los 15 años, lo aprendió de su padre; él no posee otras actividades. En la siembra del maíz siempre participan los hijos que están en el país, ya que son muchos no necesita mozos para el trabajo.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar los útiles para el hijo que estudiando en la universidad y pago del alquiler de la habitación en donde vive, para no estar viajando por que le genera más gastos.

Él sueña con ver a su hijo que logre alcanzar su meta, para ser un profesional, ya que Él no tuvo esa oportunidad hoy la tiene su hijo con el apoyo de sus hermanos y él.
texts.en:
Pedro is 58 years old. When he was a child, he did not go to school. His parents could not send him to school because they did not have any money. However, a few years ago he started to take classes for adults where he learnt to read and write and he finished the 6th grade. He has a very big family: seven children and a wife. Most of his children are already married, some others live with him but already work, and the small ones go to school. His family is very close and hard-working.

Pedro has been working in agriculture for 15 years. He learnt this trade from his father and he does not have any other work. When sowing corn, he always has the help of his children who are in the area – since he has many children, he does not need paid help for the work.

He asks for a loan to buy study materials for his son who is at university, and to pay for the room where his son lives, so that he does not have to pay for transportation, which costs even more.

It is his dream that his son can achieve his goal, which is to have a professional career. Since Pedro did not have this opportunity, today his son can achieve this with the help from his brothers and from Pedro.

loans.use: to buy study materials for his son who is at university, and to pay for the room where his son lives, so that he does not have to pay for transportation, which costs even more.

loans.name: Gelita

texts.en:
This is Gelita. She is 45 years old and a resident of Malibay, Pasay in the Philippines. She is married to Dominador, a driver, and Gelita is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Gelita operates a food stall. She sells snacks like banana cue and kamote cue. Banana cue is a popular snack food in the Philippines of deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar. Banana cue is made from Saba bananas. Kamote cue is made from sweet potato. It is coated with brown sugar and then fried to cook the potatoes and caramelize the sugar. It is usually skewered on a bamboo stick, and is sold on the streets. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil and gas. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gelita hopes that her business will expand soon and she dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil and gas needed in her business.

loans.name: Armando De Jesus

texts.es:
Armando, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de un granero para almacenar el maíz y conservarlo en óptimas condiciones para el consumo familiar y su comercialización.
El crédito anterior le ayudo  a que su cosecha fuera abundante y libre de plagas, su situación económica ha mejorado su familia se encuentra saludable.
texts.en:
Amando decided to ask for a new loan to use it for the purchase of a barn. In this barn, he wants to store corn and thus keep it in the best possible condition for the use by his family and for selling.

His earlier loan helped him to achieve an abundant harvest without any pests. His economic situation has improved and his family is healthy.

loans.use: to buy a barn.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a farmer living in the Murang'a area of Central Kenya with his wife and they have been blessed with 4 children all of whom are in school. He has been doing farming for 5 years and his primary income source is selling milk and crops. He really enjoys what he does because of the income he gets out of it.
Josphat chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer their loans at a low interest rate. This loan will bring a good environment for his livestock to feed and produce more and thus it will improve his income and thus upgrade their living standards.

loans.use: Construction of a cow shed.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad por sus escazos recursos económicos no estudió ningun grado en la escuela, él era el mayor de seis hermanos, y tenía que ayudarle a sus padres a trabajar ya que sus familia era muy pobre está acompañado, su esposa  trabaja con él en el campo y solo tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad.
José actualmente se dedica a sembrar maíz  y lo ha hecho desde que era niño ya que su padre le enseñó este trabajo en aquel tiempo no tenían otra forma de sobrevivir mas que la agricultura, tambien cuando era niño trabajó en las tabacaleras con su padre además de trabajar en la agricultura, también trabaja como empleado en los cañales los cuales es un dinero extra para su familia, se levanta a las 4:00 AM y tiene que trasladarse al campo donde tiene la milpa, hace un recorrido de unos 3 kilómetros en bicicleta, hora de salida no tiene pues hasta que termina de hacer lo que tiene programado en ese día regresa a su casa y le ayuda a su esposa en los que haceres diarios.
Jose utilizará el dinero del préstamo, para sembrar una hectárea de maiz ya que en estos dias es donde empiezan a limpiar las tierras donde trabaja ademas comprará laminas para el techo de su vivienda ya que el invierno esta cerca.
En un futoro él sueña con tener una mejor casa de la que ahora tiene y poder darle a sus hijos el estudio que él no tuvo.
texts.en:
Jose is 45 years old and did not go to school because of scarce resources.  He was the oldest of six siblings and had to help his parents work, since his family was very poor.  He is married and his wife works in the fields.  He has a three year old son.

Jose raises corn and has been doing this since he was a child.  His father taught him and at the moment they don’t have any other way to survive besides farming.  He also worked for tobacco companies with his father when he was a child.   He also works as laborer for sugar cane growers, which provides extra money for the family.  He gets up as 4:00 am and has to go to the fields where he raises corn.  He travels 3km by bicycle and stays until he’s finished with his tasks for the day.  Then he returns home and helps his wife with the daily chores.

Jose will use the money to raise a hectare of corn, since they are beginning to clean off the fields where he works, he will also buy metal for the roof of his house now that the winter is near.

He dreams of having a better house in the future and to be able to provide his children with the education he didn’t have.

loans.use: to plant corn and fix his roof.

loans.name: Haneefan

texts.en: Haneefan, aged 54, is a mother of four children. She is a responsible house wife and looks after her family at home. Her husband owns a ready-made garments shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a variety of garments for the shop including shirts, pants, frocks, skirts, etc.  This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Haneefan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will use the loan to purchase the needful things. Haneefan is happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy ready-made garments for resale.

loans.name: Kobul

texts.ru:
Кобул мужчина в возрасте 53 лет. Семейное положение, женат, имеет двоих  детей. Жена Каноат позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Кобул вместе со своей семьей проживают в сельской местности Дж Расуловского района. Его дети уже обзавелись своими семьями и у Кабула уже несколько внуков. Так как Кабул не смог обучить своих детей он очень хочет чтобы его внуки учились в хороших учебных заведениях. Чтобы достичь своей цели Кабул работает не покладая рук. 
Кабул вот  уже несколько лет занимается откармливанием скота. Это его единственный доход на сегодняшний день. Но ему его бизнес очень нравиться так как приносит хороший доход. Он  понемногу  откладывает денежные средства на учебу своих внуков. Кабул на данный момент хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота. По совету своих знакомых он решил обратиться в организацию Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. На полученный кредит Кабул купит несколько голов скота и расширит свой бизнес. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за содействие и реализацию своих планов.
texts.en:
Kobul is a 53-year-old man. Regarding his family, he is married and has two children. His wife, Kanoat, is a positive and hardworking woman. Kobul lives with his family in the countryside of the J. Rasulov District. His children have already started their own families and Kobul already has several grandchildren. As Kobul was unable to provide an education for his children, he really wants his grandchildren to be able to study in good educational institutions. In order to achieve this goal, Kobul works his fingers to the bone.

Kobul has undertaken fattening up cattle for resale for several years now. It is his only income presently. But he really likes his business as it brings in good revenue. He is saving money for his grandchildren's education little by little. Now Kobul wants to increase the size of his herd. On the advice of his friends, he decided to turn to the Arvand organization for financial assistance. With the received loan, Kobul will buy several cattle and expand his business. He thanks Arvand in advance for the assistance in realizing his plans.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Babati Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is a father of one child and a married man. He is known for being a hard worker and managing different activities. He is aged mid thirties and has had several businesses, which gives him an extra income to manage his family's needs. Genge business is one of his businesses selling charcoal, fruits and vegetables. Mohamed has also a water storage tank where he stores waters from big suppliers and resells the water to his neighbors. He is in these businesses for five years now. He runs his business from 07 am to 09 pm daily and is able to make a very good profit. 

This is Mohamed's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to restock the business with charcoal, fruits and vegetables. He bought a three wheel motorcycle for business purposes. Mohamed repaid his previous loans successfully. With the profit earned he build a house, bought a TV ans covered food expenses for his family. Mohamed will use this loan to take part in the local market center to start selling carrots to small sellers. He wants to buy a large stock of carrot from farms and supply them to small sellers at the market. Mohamed dreams that one day he will be able to take his own loan to expand his business. 

Mohamed will share this loan with his loan group" BABATI" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to take part in the local market center reselling carrots to small sellers.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat is 39 years old and married, with three children. He lives in a peaceful village of Kien Svay district, Kandal province. He earns a living by farming rice with support from his wife and children when they are free from school. He has been a farmer for almost 20 years, earning a proper income to meet the family’s daily needs.

Sophat is asking for a loan amounting to 1,000 USD to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of his family members so as to improve his household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sophat is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of his family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of his family members.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car for his taxi service business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 48 years old and married, with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Judith has been in pig-fattening for two years and earns additional income from food-vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 70 years old and married with four children.

Flora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like noodles, cooking oil, beer, seasonings, bath soap, etc. to resell.

Flora has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Flora aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like noodles, cooking oil, beer, seasonings, bath soap, etc. to resell

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell feed business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed to sell for her buy and sell feed business.

Sheila has been in this business for 10 years. Sheila earns more income from a general store.

Sheila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed to resell

loans.name: Carlota Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carlota de 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, está acompañada y su compañero de vida trabaja con ella en la agricultura, de los 4 hijos solo 2 viven con ellos ya que los otros 2 estan en Estados Unidos.

Carlota actualmente se dedica a sembrar maíz  y  frijoles desde hace muchos años, ella se levanta desde las 5:00 AM a preparar el desayuno para su familia luego  tiene que trasladarse al campo donde tiene la milpa, hace un recorrido de 1 kilómetro a pie, hora de salida no tiene pues hasta que termina de hacer lo que tiene programado en ese día regresa a su casa  con su compañero de vida.

Ella utilizará el dinero del préstamo para sembrar una hectárea de maiz, ademas terminará de sacar la cosecha que tiene en este momento ya que donde ella vive se puede trabajar a base de riego.

Ella sueña con seguir trabajando con su esposo para que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Carlota, 54, did not have the opportunity of going to school, she is in a couple and her life partner works with her in farming. Out of their 4 children, only two live with them as the other two are in the United States of America.

Carlota currently makes her living sowing corn and beans and has done so for many years now. She gets up at 05:00 in order to prepare breakfast for her family, and then she heads to the field where she grows the corn. She travels 1 kilometer on feet, and doesn't have a set time by which to finish as she has to finish what was planned for the day and returns home with her life partner.

She will use the money from the loan to sow a hectare of corn as well as to finish reaping the crop that she has at the moment as the area in which she lives operates with irrigation systems.

Carlota dreams of continuing to work with her husband so that they are not wanting for anything.

loans.use: to sow a hectare of corn, as well as to finish harvesting the crop that she has at the moment as the area in which she lives operates with irrigation systems.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred  owns and operates a vegetable business to earn a living. She has been  growing and harvesting crops for more than four years earning well for the family. Her revenues increase with her efforts and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for fertilization. She took a new loan recently to buy a new variety of seedlings and organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of seedlings and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily has been selling flowers in the market for a living. She used to plant and grow different varieties of ornamental plants. She also buys some of them in order to offer more to her customers. From her revenue generated, she successfully repaid her previous loan. Lily used this to buy pots and seedlings. 

To improve sales, Lily took a new loan to purchase additional varieties of flowers to sell. She uses her additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of flowers to sell

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is 29 years old and she lives in Stepanavan city of Lori region. Lusine has graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute. Now she works at the city's special school as a specialist, working as a teacher of vicious children. She is a perfect specialist of Armenian language and literature and she also gives private paid courses to a group of pupils who are going to pass entrance examinations. 

As Lusine says, she does her work with great pleasure and devotion, and she feels great happiness when she sees the results of her teaching, the activeness and enthusiasm of the pupils during her lessons. 

Lusine is married and she has a three-year-old son. Her husband works at a gas station and simultaneously is a welder and works by order.

Lusine asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams to buy a computer and some professional literature for her courses and teaching lessons at the school.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature for her courses and teaching lessons at the school.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support two children. She is married and has a livestock-raising business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 4,600 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light, in case of emergency.

Delia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Evilla

texts.en:
Evilla is 57 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Evilla works very hard to provide for them.

Evilla runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like canned goods, soft-drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell.

Evilla has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Evilla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like canned goods, soft-drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Erika Elizabeth

texts.es:
Erika, se dispone a fortalecer su tienda y la venta de revista, ve en los créditos una oportunidad de hacerlo de manera rápida y con facilidad de pago, el capital que solicita lo utilizara para realizar la compra de jugos, aceite, arroz, frijol, bebidas, lociones, cremas, maquillaje, etc.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar la mercadería que ofrecía a sus clientes, teniendo así mejores ventas, sus ganancias son mayores y es con ellas que ha cancelado de manera puntual sus cuotas y mejorado el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Erika is about to strengthen her store and the sale of magazines. She sees the loans as an opportunity to do so in a quick manner and with ease of payment. She will use the money that she is seeking to buy juices, oil, rice, beans, drinks, lotions, creams, make-up and so on.

Erika's previous loan helped her improve the merchandise that she offered to her customers, therein obtaining better sales. Her profits are larger, and it was with these profits that she met the loan repayments in the punctual manner and improved the family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fruit juices, oil, rice, beans, drinks, lotions, creams, make-up and so on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, pure water and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dry goods, such as coal, sugar, rice, oil, biscuits, and candy.

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.ru:
Махмуджон трудолюбивый, общительный молодой человек в возрасте 33 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. У Махмуджона дружная семья. Его жена Зарина занимается торговлей. Они имеет свой продуктовый магазин на центральном рынке района. Бизнес у молодой семьи налаживается хорошо. В основном торговлей больше занимается Зарина, а сам Махмуджон занимается животноводством. Разводит дома мелко рогатых скатов. Махмуджону очень нравиться свое занятие. Ведь это занятие и прибыльное и интересное,у него на сегодняшней день имеется несколько поголовье крупно рогатых скатов.
 В дальнейшем Махмуджон хочет умножить поголовье своих скатов и расширить свое деятельность. Но для покупки крупно рогатых скатов Махмуджону не хватает денежных  средств. В надежде решить свою материальную проблему Махмуджон обратился в МДО "Арванд" за кредитом. Махмуджон заранее  выражает свою благодарность  МДО "Арванд" за поддержку и за своевременное обслуживание со стороны сотрудников организации Арванд.
texts.en:
Mahmudjon is a hardworking, gregarious young man. He is 33 years old and is married. He has two children. Mahmudjon has a close-knit family. His wife Zarina works in retail sale. They have their own grocery shop in the central market of the district. The young family's business is working out well. Mainly, Zarina works in the shop more and Mahmudjon practices livestock breeding. He raises sheep and goats at their home. This business is profitable and interesting and he currently has several cattle as well.

In the future, Mahmudjon wants to increase the size of his herd and expand his business. But Mahmudjon does not have enough money to buy more cattle. In the hopes of resolving this financial obstacle, Mahmudjon turned to MDO Arvand for a loan. Mahmudjon thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support and for the timely management by the employees of the Arvand organization.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 53 años de edad, esta acompañado su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene dos hijos, uno de 13 años que estudia 6º grado y el otro de 15 años que estudia 9º grado, sus hijos estudian por la mañana y en la tarde que tiene libre le ayudan a Carlos en el trabajo de la agricultura. De Carlos depende su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos

Para Carlos, la única fuentes de ingresos que tiene es el trabajo que realiza en la agricultura, se dedica desde muy pequeño; lo aprendió por medio de su padre,con  el cultivo de maíz es con el que logra el sostenimiento a su familia y a sus hijos y con lo que le da la educación

Carlos comprara los insumos necesarios como la preparación de la tierra, el abono,fertilizantes, semilla, para la siembra de 16 hectáreas de maíz y con la ganancia que adquiera podrá ayudar mas al sostenimiento de su casa

El sueño de Carlos es poder sacar a su compañera de vida y sobretodo a sus hijos adelante y darles un mejor futuro para que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales Y que a él le quede la santificación que le enseño a cultivar la tierra para que el esfuerzo que él haga no sea en vano.
texts.en:
Carlos is 53 years old. He lives with his partner, who is a homemaker. They have two children, one who is 13 years old and is in 6th grade, and the other is 15 years old and is in 9th grade. His children study in the morning and they have the afternoons free to help Carlos in agricultural work. Carlos’s partner and his two children are dependent on him.

For Carlos, his only source of income is the work he does in agriculture, which he has worked in since he was very young. He learned it from his father. It is through cultivating corn that he provides for his family and his children’s education.

Carlos will buy necessary inputs, such as preparing the soil, manure, fertilizers, and seed to plant 16 hectares of corn. With the profit he earns, he will be able to help provide more for his household.

Carlos’ dream is to be able to help his partner and, most of all, his children, to get ahead in life and to give them a better future so his children can become professionals. And he hopes to always have the divine help that taught him to cultivate the land so that the work he does won’t be in vain.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seed, and manure.

loans.name: Djekadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Djekadi vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Somonodougouni dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce, de condiments et des ustensiles. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 12 éme  cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Nana (deuxième femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments  dans le village de Somonodougouni et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de condiments pour ses clients. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement féminine.
 Madame Nana espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour  des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women in the group Djekadi all live in polygamous families. They are on average 40 years old and have 4 children. They all live in the village of Somonodougouni in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through neighborhood, family, and marriage ties, and through their income-generating businesses in the village. They are shopkeepers selling condiments and utensils. With the goal of increasing their business, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 12th group loan cycle.

Madam Nana (the second woman standing from right to left in the photo) is a great seller of condiments in the village of Somonodougouni and its surroundings. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of condiments for her customers. The sales are made for cash and often for credit to a primarily female clientele.

Madam Nana hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be used for some of her children's small needs and equally to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 47 años de edad,  esta casado su esposa se dedica a los oficio domésticos, han procreado 6 hijos, 4 que ya son mayores de edad y dos menores de edad de 13 y 15 años que se encuentran estudiado. 

Para Daniel y sus 3 hijos varones su única fuente de empleo que tienen es la agricultura, ellos se dedican desde muy temprano a trabajar en el campo, a la esposa de Daniel aparte de hacer el oficio domestico también le gusta la crianza de ganado el cual ella cuida y con eso le ayuda a Daniel al sostenimiento del hogar. Mientras sus dos hijos menores se van para la escuela los demás hijos y su esposa quedan trabajando para brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación.

El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de semilla y en el abono en preparación de la tierra y fertilizantes para el cultivo para asi poder sembrar 16 hectáreas de terreno, Daniel espera que con la siembra y la producción que saque le pueda brindar una buena ganancia para sostener económicamente a su familia.

Uno de los principales sueño de Daniel es lograr sacar adelante a su familia y que sus dos hijos que se encuentran estudiado pueda cursar un bachillerato, para que no solamente se dediquen a la agricultura sino en encontrar un empleo mucho mejor en su futuro.
texts.en:
Daniel is 47 years old and is married. His wife is a housewife. They have 6 children four of whom are adults and the younger two are 13 and 15 years old and they study. For Daniel and his 3 sons the only form of employment they have is farming. They start their work very early in the fields. His wife besides doing the housework likes to raise cattle. She takes care of them and through this helps Daniel with the support of the household. While his two youngest go off to school the other sons and their father stay working in order to give them a good education.

The loan will be used to purchase seed and manure to prepare the land and fertilizers for the crops so they can seed 16 hectares of land. Daniel hopes that the seeding and product he reaps will offer a good profit to financially support his family. One of Daniel's main dreams is to get his family ahead and that his two children who are studying can get their High School graduation so they are not just limited to farming but can find a much better employment in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and manure.

loans.name: Ndeye Gorgui's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 6 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 25 juin 2002, il regroupe des membres qui habitent le même village et ceux des alentours. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations et font comme activité le commerce et l'embouche.
Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Aminata est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle fait comme activité le commerce de détail. D’ailleurs avec le prêt elle compte faire du commerce de tissu. Elle va acheter diverses qualités et cela dépendra de la période et de la demande des clients.
Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle va gérer les besoins de la famille en particulier les frais de scolarité de ses enfants qui sont dans des écoles privées.
texts.en:
This group of 6 women belongs to the Banc Villageois created 25 June 2002. Its members all live in a small cluster of villages. They all get along, and they practice commercial activities and animal fattening. 

Aminata, age 45, is the group member seen in the photo standing on the right and raising her hand. She is married with children, and she is a retail merchant. She plans to use her loan to buy fabrics. She will select various grades, depending on the time frame and customer demand. 

Aminata will use the profits earned to provide for her family’s needs, especially the tuition fees for her children who all attend private school.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Jenevive

texts.en: Jenevive has been helping her husband work on their own farm for a living. For more than ten years, she has earned a better income to supplement their needs. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used in buying fertilizer, for it resulted in higher productivity. She is determined to improve the farm. Recently, she took a out new loan to purchase additional fertilizer, such as manure. She wants  to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Cindy Paola

texts.es:
Cindy es una joven emprendedora, activa y enérgica de 18 años de edad, que luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios, comenzó a buscar oportunidades de empleo sin tener éxito, debido a la inexperiencia, fue por ello que, desde hace 1 año comenzó a vender productos por catálogo, como alternativa para generar recursos que le permitieran aportar a la economía de su hogar, ya que su familia es muy humilde y en algunas ocasiones pasan necesidades por falta de recursos.
Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar surtido como camisetas, jeans, blusas y otros, así incluirá nuevos productos para ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes que principalmente son familiares, amigos y vecinos, de esta forma mejorará los ingresos por ventas.
Cindy manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es montar su propio almacén en un local abierto al público, en el que pueda ofrecer gran variedad de productos y así mejorar la entrada de recursos a la economía familiar, mejorando la calidad de vida de todos los suyos.
texts.en:
Cindy is a young entrepreneur, dynamic, and energetic and 18 years old. After finishing secondary school, she started looking for job opportunities without success, due to her inexperience. This is why about 1 year ago she started to sell products from catalogs as an alternative to generate income that would allow her to contribute to her household’s economy. Her family is very low income and sometimes they go without necessities for lack of funds.

With the loan she is requesting, she will buy stock such as t-shirts, jeans, blouses and other items. She will also include new products so she can offer more variety to her clients, who are mainly family members, friends, and neighbors. In this way, she will improve her income through her sales.

Cindy explains that her greatest wish is to have her own store where she can offer a great variety of products and thereby improve her family’s income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, blouses and other items.

loans.name: Kutfi

texts.ru:
У Кутфи  большая семья. Ей 51 год.Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Как  и большинство жителей села традиционным источником дохода семьи является животноводство и земледелие.   Для удовлетворения потребностей большой семьи Кутфи в образовании, питании, расходов на одежду и транспорт семье необходимо получать максимальный доход на минимальном участке земли. Так как Кутфи сама не имеет высшего образования она мечтает чтобы ее дети получили хорошее образование и в будущем имели хорошую профессию. Для этого необходимо ее трудолюбие и  хороший уход за землей, чтобы получив хороший урожай она могла накопить деньги на образование своих детей. 
Кутфи занимается сельскохозяйственной культурой. Она выращивает пшеницу.   Перед подготовкой к посевному сезону  Кутфи хочет взять кредит в Арванде. Она на полученный кредит Кутфи хочет купить минеральных удобрений. Она очень надеется что с поддержкой организации Арванд сможет получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Kutfi has a large family. She is 51 years old. She is married and has five children. Like the majority of the village residents, the traditional source of income for her family is animal breeding and crop farming. To satisfy the needs of her large family regarding education, food, and expenses on clothing and transportation, it is necessary to receive the maximum profit on the smallest plot of land possible. As Kutfi never obtained a higher education herself, she dreams that her children will be able to get a good education and have good careers in the future. For this goal, it is necessary to for her to work diligently and work the land well so that she can receive a good harvest and save money for her children's education.

Kutfi practices crop farming. She grows wheat. Before preparing for the sowing season, Kutfi wants to take out a loan through Arvand. Kutfi wants to buy mineral fertilizers with the received loan. She really hopes that, with the support of the Arvand organization, she will be able to receive a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Will Alexander

texts.es:
Will de 35 años de edad,  por sus escasos recursos económicos no estudio ningun grado, él era uno de los mayor de los catorce  hermanos y tenía que ayudarle a sus padres a trabajar , ya que su familia era muy pobre. Está acompañado su esposa se dedica a trabajar con él en el campo y solo tiene 2 hijos que tiene 8 y 5 años, los cuales dependen de él.



Will actualmente se dedica a sembrar maíz  y lo ha hecho desde que era niño ya que su padre le enseñó este trabajo en aquel tiempo no tenían otra forma de sobrevivir mas que la agricultura, tambien cuando era niño trabajo en las tabakaleras con su padre, además de trabajar en la agricultura, tambien trabaja como empleado en los cañales los cuales es un dinero extra.  Se levanta desde las 5:00 am y tiene que trasladarse al campo donde tiene la milpa, hace un recorrido de unos 3 kilómetros en bicicleta, hora de salida no tiene pues hasta que termina de hacer lo que tiene programado en ese día regresa a su casa y le ayuda a su esposa en los que haceres diarios.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrdaos de maíz, ya que en estos dias es donde empiezan a limpiar las tierras donde trabaja, ademas comprara un ternero.


Will en un futuro sueña con tener una mejor casa de la que ahora tiene, poder darle a sus hijos el estudio que él no tuvo, pues hoy en día quien esté mejor preparado académicamente puede conseguir un buen trabajo, ademas sueña con comprar un vehiculo y poder salir a pasear con su esposa e hijos, él está seguro que el crédito es un compromiso pero también sabe que solo así puede lograr sus sueños, confiando primero en DIOS, será un mayor esfuerzo pero así obtendrá una mejor situación económica.
texts.en:
Will is 35 years old. He has few economic resources and did not go to school. Of 14 children, he was one of the oldest, and he had to help his parents with their work because the family was very poor. He lives with his wife and she works with him in the field. They have only two children, who are 8 and 5 years old and depend on him.

Will currently grows corn and he has done this since he was a child. His father showed him this work and in those times, they did not have any other way to survive but farming. As a child, he also worked in the tobacco factories with his father. Today, in addition to farming, he works as hired help in the sugar cane fields, by which he earns some extra money. He gets up at 5:00 a.m. and travels to the field where he grows the corn. He travels this distance of roughly 3 kilometers by bike. He does not have a fixed time when he stops work, because he always finishes what he has planned to do for the day before he returns home and helps his wife with the daily tasks.

He asks for a loan which he wants to use to plant 7,000 square meters of corn, because at the moment they start to prepare the fields where he works for sowing, and also he wants to buy a plot.

It is Will’s future dream to have a better house than he has now, and to be able to let his children have the education he could not have, because today a person who has a good academic education can get a good job. Also, he would like to have a car and thus to be able to make trips with his wife and children. He knows that the loan is a compromise, but he also knows that only in this way he will be able to fulfill his dreams, trusting in God. It will be a major effort, but by this he will be able to improve his economic situation.

loans.use: to sow 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Myriam Clemencia

texts.es:
El nombre es Myriam Clemencia, tiene  48 años, es madre de 3 hijos y deseo con ansias  cumplir el sueño de ser enfermera, ya que de esta forma se le abrirían muchas puertas a nivel laboral. 
En el momento no cuenta con los medios económicos suficientes para realizar el pago de las cuotas mensuales, por eso solicita el convenio con kiva para que de este modo el valor a cancelar de las cuotas sea mas económico, ha perdido varias oportunidades de trabajo, ya que no cuenta con el título y tarjeta profesional pertinente se le ha negado la posibilidad de trabajar en la carrera que se encuentra estudiando.
texts.en:
This is Myriam Clemencia. She is 48 years old and a mother of 3 children. She eagerly wishes to fulfil her dream of becoming a nurse as this will open many doors for employment. 

At the moment she doesn’t have sufficient financial resources to make the monthly payments and that is why she is requesting a loan with Kiva so that paying the fee will be more economical. She has missed many job opportunities because she doesn’t have qualifications or pertinent professional license. She has been denied the possibility to work in the field that she is studying.

loans.use: to pay for one semester of enrollment.

loans.name: Djidja Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Djidja vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Somonodougouni dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce, de poisson fumé et des condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 12 éme  cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Massitan (la femme assise à droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de poisson fumé dans le village de Somonodougouni et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de poisson fumé pour ses clients. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Massitan espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  20.000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour  des petits besoins de ses enfants, aider aussi son mari et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The six women in the Djidja group all live in polygamous families. They are on average 42 years old and have 3 children. They all live in the village of Somonodougouni in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through neighborhood, family, and marriage ties, and through their income-generating businesses in the village. They are shopkeepers, selling smoked fish and condiments. With the goal of increasing their business, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 12th group loan cycle.

Madam Massitan (the woman sitting to the right in the photo) is a great seller of smoked fish in the village of Somonodougouni and its surroundings. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of smoked fish for her customers. The sales are made for cash and often for credit to a mixed clientele.

Madam Massitan hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be used for some of her children's small needs, and also to help her husband and equally to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Viviana Aracely

texts.es: Viviana, es una mujer de 24 años de edad, responsable y muy trabajadora, es madre soltera, tiene una hija tiene 4 años de edad, estaba estudiando administración aduanera, pero suspendió sus estudios por cuidar de su hija y por atender su negocio de compra venta de calzado. Este negocio surgió alrededor de 5 años atrás cuando ella trabajaba en un almacén de venta de calzado donde aprendió del negocio, ahora trabaja de forma independiente y tiene gran variedad de calzado almacenado en su casa, esta mercadería la vende de puerta en puerta. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para la venta. Su sueño es terminar su carrera de administración aduanera y con estos conocimientos poder  realizar los trámites de importación de calzado directamente de los proveedores del extranjero principalmente de Colombia y junto con su negocio educar a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Viviana is a 24-year-old-woman. She is very responsible and hard-working. She is a single mother and has a 4-year-old daughter. She used to study customs administration but had to interrupt her studies in order to care for her daughter and to run her business of buying and selling shoes.

She started this business approximately five years ago, when she worked in a shoe shop where she learnt this trade. Now she works independently and has a great variety of shoes on stock in her house. She sells her goods from door-to-door.

She needs a loan to buy more merchandise for selling. It is her dream to finish her studies in customs administration, and with this knowledge she could import shoes directly from the foreign manufacturers, mainly from Colombia, and run her business and at the same time raise her little daughter.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: shoes for women, men and children.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 49-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. 

Nasreen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. Her husband is a leather jacket and shoe maker and very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing shoes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot of experience in his profession. He sews leather and Rexine (imitation leather) shoes and jackets on a machine. In this way he is getting income for his family. 

He has been making jackets and shoes at home, and now he has established a shop to continue his business on a higher level. But he does not have enough funds to buy the initial raw materials for making jackets and shoes. Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan for her husband so he can buy the raw materials.

She is thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making leather shoes and jackets

loans.name: Natalia Alejandra

texts.es:
Ella se llama Alejandra, tiene 16 años, cursa grado 11º y el día sábado estudia cosmetología y estética integral en Campo alto, estudia estética porque cree que tiene habilidades en esta área y le gusta mucho, otra de las razones primordiales para realizar este técnico es porque quiere ser independiente, y al terminar el bachillerato poder conseguir trabajo más fácilmente. 
Le gustaría adquirir el convenio de “KIVA” para ayudar en los gastos de la casa, pues no hay muchas posibilidades económicas, los gastos del colegio, sumándole los gastos del técnico son bastantes altos, por esta razón a ella le gustaría adquirir el descuento anteriormente mencionado.
texts.en: This is Alejandra, 16, who attends 11th grade and studies cosmetology and esthetics on Saturdays at CampoAlto. She learns esthetics because she has skills and passion for this field. One of the primary reasons she wants to study is to be independent after high school and to find a job more easily. She's applying for this Kiva loan to help with household expenses because they do not have much economic opportunity. Her high school costs and the costs of studying cosmetology are also too high for her and, for this reason, she would like to use this loan.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pigs and improve the infrastructure of the pig pen.

loans.name: Javier Alonso

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre humilde, pujante y trabajador de 36 años de edad que se gana la vida trabajando como comerciante independiente, pues tiene un quiosco ubicado en los principales balnearios del municipio donde reside, el oficio lo aprendió mientras vendía refrescos y gaseosas en un costado de la cancha de fútbol del pueblo y desde hace 3 años atiende su propio negocio.
Su mayor desafío es mantener la estabilidad económica pues en temporada escolar bajan las ventas, pero lo compensa con las temporadas de vacaciones donde aumentan notablemente las ventas a medida que van llegando los turistas y visitantes. Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio solicita el crédito como apoyo para comprar un refrigerador y surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, cervezas, mecato y otros), esto le permitirá ofrecer una mayor diversidad de artículos y especialmente aquellos que deben ser refrigerados, pues en el municipio el clima es bastante cálido; así podrá aumentar las ventas e ingresos para solventar los gastos del hogar y velar por el bienestar de su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad.
Javier manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener un estadero con servicio de restaurante y diferentes atracciones para el entretenimiento de los visitantes, pues esto mejoraría la estabilidad económica de su hogar y podría garantizarle a su hija una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Javier, 36, is a humble, strong and hard working man who earns a living working as an independent trader. He has a kiosk located in the main hot springs in the town where he lives. He learned this trade while selling beverages and soft drinks in a soccer field in town and has had his own business for 3 years. His biggest challenge is maintaining economic stability because during the school year sales are down but it’s balanced out during the vacation season when it increases noticeably when tourists and visitors start arriving. 

In an effort to strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan to purchase a refrigerator and supplies at wholesale such as soft drinks, beer, snacks and others. This will allow him to offer more of a variety of items especially those that need to be refrigerated as the climate in town is very hot. This way he can increase sales and revenue to cover household expenses and ensure the well being of his one-year-old son.

Javier says that his biggest wish is to have an inn with restaurant service and different attractions to entertain visitors. This would improve the financial situation at home and he could guarantee a good education and better quality of life for his son.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and supplies at wholesale such as soft drinks, beer, snacks and others.

loans.name: Mirian Yeny

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 33 años de edad, no logro estudiar estudiar un grado académico debido a la situación económica de sus padres ella esta acompañada, su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura tiene 3 hijos de 7, 11 y 13 años ellos están estudiado, Mirian y su compañero de vida trabajan juntos en la agricultura ya que es el medio que ello utilizan para el sostén de sus familia.

la actividad que mas realiza Mirian es la siembra del maíz, pero ademas aprovecha el sacate que le queda de su cultivo de maíz para la alimentación de dos vacas que ella tiene. La distancia que tiene de su casa a la siembra de maíz es de 2 kilómetros de sus casa. Sus hijos cuando no están estudiado le ayudan a ella y a su compañero de vida a las actividades que realizan en el campo.

El crédito lo invertirá para cultivar 16 hectáreas de cultivo de maíz, lo cual invertirá en la preparación de la tierra, comprar semilla para la siembra, el abono y los demás fertilizantes para el cuido de su cultivo.

Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida poder sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, ya que ella desea seguir estudiado y lograr sacar una carrera Universitaria, como un doctorado o una licenciatura. Por dicha razon Mirian pone todo su esfuerzo y dedicación al trabajo, para ayudar a sus hijos a salir adelante y que tenga oportunidades que ella no pudo tener.
