Thanks to her polite, kind and patient attitude towards all her customers and her nice smile, she manages to gain more buyers and very soon they become her regular customers.
 
Now Lusine needs some support and greatly hopes that Kiva lenders will help her. She is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams, as she wants to buy a colorful, fashionable Spring collection of men's and children's clothes to sell in the coming season.

loans.use: to buy a colorful, fashionable Spring collection of men's and children's clothes to sell in the coming season.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 24-years-old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Ma. Theresa works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Theresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like soy sauce, vinegar, noodles, bath soap, toothpaste, laundry soap, etc. to sell.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, vinegar, noodles, bath soap, toothpaste, laundry soap, etc. 

Ma. Theresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like soy sauce, vinegar, noodles, bath soap, toothpaste, laundry soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es:
Aquilino de 62 años de edad. Padre de familia de 4 hijos, acompañado. Cada mañana emprende su labor de Agricultor ademas de eso se dedica a la siembra de Hortalizas (chile, tomates y ejotes) en el negocio se involucran 3 de sus hijos mayores quienes salen a vender al mercado lo cosechado. Lastimosamente, su esposa ha estado mal de salud quien es un pilar muy importante para él. El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para  solventar gastos médicos para ayudar a su esposa a superar este mal momento. Ellos confían en que todo mejorara y podrán seguir adelante con sus negocios. 
A futuro sueñan envejecer juntos, ver que sus esfuerzos no han sido en vano, ademas ver a sus hijos con sus metas realizadas y con un negocio propio, así como ellos lo han venido realizando año tras año, pues esto les ayudara a superarse a si mismos, ademas sera de gran ayuda en la alimentación diaria que día a día se presenta.
texts.en:
Aquilino is 62 years old. He is the father of 4 children and lives with his partner. Each morning he begins his work as a farmer. He also plants vegetables (bell peppers, tomatoes, and green beans. Three of his children help him with his business by selling the harvested crops in the market. Unfortunately, his wife has been in poor health, and she is very important to him, a pillar of his life. The loan that he is requesting is to pay for medical expenses to help his wife get through this difficult time. They trust that everything will get better and they will be able to continue with their businesses. 

For the future, they dream of growing old together and seeing that their work hasn’t been in vain. They would also like to see their children achieve their goals and have their own businesses, just as they have been doing year after year. This will help them to provide for themselves and it will also be a great help to the issue of having enough food that presents itself day after day.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medical expenses.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 46-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. She began her business because she wants to create income to take care of her child and her parent.  

Fatmata runs a retail business, selling palm oil. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her area of operation.

She has requested a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family's welfare and repay her loan. In the future she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia se dedica a la venta de hojas de coca, animales menores y refrescos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para mas gallinas y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Celia sells coca leaves, small animals, and soft drinks. She has been in these businesses for several years and they are going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into them. She belongs to the “Señor de Huanca de Patria” communal bank. She needs the loan at this time for more chickens, and in this way increase her working capital for this line of work. She is grateful for and values the loan and pledges to make her monthly repayments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 37 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming cassava and bananas in the Philippines. She has been farming cassava and bananas for 2 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Gregoria is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Irish Mae

texts.en: Irish Mae is 19 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, noodles, etc. In the future, Irish Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina is 57 years old and has ten children. She is married and three of her children are still in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Joaquina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: José Oscar

texts.es:
José de 59 años de edad estudió hasta primer  grado, está casado y su esposa se encarga de la casa mientras él trabaja en el campo.

José  actualmente se dedica a sembrar maíz y frijol y lo ha hecho desde que era niño, también trabaja en la alcaldía como seguridad, el horario que tiene en la alcaldia es de 24 horas seguidas y descansa 24 horas, cuando trabaja en el campo se levanta  las 4:00 AM y luego se traslada a la milpa, hace un recorrido de unos 2 kilómetros en bicicleta, en este moemento está sembrando maiz  ya que el terreno donde trabaja es muy fértil.

José invertirá el dinero del préstamo para sembrar 7000 metros cuadrados de maíz, ya en estos dias empiezan a movilizarse para trabajar en este año  y quiere terminar de cultivar la parcela de de maiz  que tiene, él ya cuenta con un efectivo y con el préstamo terminará de hacer lo que tiene pensado.

En un futuro él tiene la visión de comprar un vehiculo en el cual pueda trasladarse a su trabajo, y poder hacer un muro alrededor de su casa y desea tener los fondos necesarios para poner algunos empleados y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Jose is 59 years old and has a first grade education.  He’s married and his wife works in the home while he works in the fields.

Jose raises corn and beans and has been doing this since he was a boy.  He also works as a security guard in the city call, 24 hours on and 24 off.  When he works in the fields he gets up at 4:00am and then travels 2 km by bicycle to the corn fields.  He is currently raising corn because the land he works is very fertile.

Jose will use the money from this loan to plant 7,000 square meters of corn, as things are beginning to move for this year’s work and he wants to finish planting the parcel with corn.  He will be able to finish what he has planned with another person.

He wants to buy a vehicle in the future so he can drive to work.  He also wants to build a wall around his home and have some funds to hire employees and keep working.

loans.use: to plant corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, pure water and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
Martha es una persona de 33 años de edad, sus estudios los realizo hasta bachillerato, es una mujer emprendedora, trabaja con las escuelas realizando los uniformes escolares, también su esposo  trabaja de albañil y su hijos uno de ello estudia cerca de su casa ,es una niña que tiene la edad de 10 años y el niño tiene 3 años de edad, es una familia muy unida y muy conocida en la zona donde ellos viven, participan en las actividades de la comunidad y también religioso. 


El negocio que pose es la satreria, este conocimiento lo obtuvo desde los 15 años, ya que ella trabajaba con su madre; ella no posee otra actividad, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa y esta esta cerca de la escuela a una distancia de 50 metros. 


Con el dinero comprara materiales para terminar de construir su casa, ya que le hace falta complementar el piso de la casa, ademas el techo del corredor y otras cosas mas, esto le beneficiara a su familia ya que teniendo la casa terminada ya no tendrán que estar en casa ajena. 


La señora menciona que lo que quiere realizar a futuro, es terminar la casa por completo ponerle las puertas, el piso en toda su casa y tener una casa digna donde vivir.
texts.en:
Martha is 33 years old. She studied up until high school. She is an enterprising woman and she works with schools, making school uniforms. Her husband works as a mason. Their daughter, who is 10 years old, goes to school near their house and they also have a 3-year-old son. They are a very close-knit and well-known family in the area in which they live. They participate in community and religious activities.

Martha has a tailoring business. She acquired this knowledge when she was 15 years old because she worked with her mother. She doesn't have any other jobs. Her business is located in her house and is close to the school, which is 50 meters away.

With this loan, she will buy materials to finish building her house since it still needs a floor, a roof over the hallway, and other things. This will benefit her family because when the house is finished, they will not have to be in someone else's house anymore.

Martha mentions that in the future she would like to completely finish her house, put in doors and the floor, and to have a decent place to live in.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building her house since it still needs a floor, a roof over the hallway, and other things.

loans.name: Mariela Lourdes

texts.es: Mariela vive en la hermosa ciudad de Patria por la Selva de Cusco y se dedica a la venta de hojas de coca. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas
texts.en: Mariela lives in the lovely city of Patria.  She makes a living growing and selling coca leaves.  She has operated the business for several years and says that it is a success because she has worked hard to make it a success.  Mariela belongs to the Senor de Huanca de Patria community bank and will use this loan to buy seeds.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her coca leaves business.

loans.name: Marcial Humberto

texts.es:
Marcial Humberto tiene 64 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad con clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de frutales comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de arroz, desde hace treinta años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra sus cultivos de arroz y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marcial Humberto is 64 years old and lives with his wife and children in the District of Pucará, a community with a warm climate. The people engage in agriculture, especially the cultivation of fruit, as well as trade and livestock breeding. This area is located in Jaén Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Marcial is a farmer who specializes in growing rice. He has been doing this for 30 years and his wife helps with the work. Marcial is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN so that he can pay for labor in order to maintain his rice crop. This will allow him to have a timely production so that he can offer his crop to his customers.

loans.use: to pay for labor in order to maintain his rice crop.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen works hard to help support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. Karen has been in this business for 1 year now. Karen requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, vinegar, soy sauce, etc. In the future, Karen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, vinegar, soy sauce, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 38-years-old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Maria has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from buying and selling purified drinking water.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Ricardo Arturo

texts.es:
Ricardo, está planeando su próxima siembra para la época de verano por lo que solicita capital para comprar insecticida, abono, plaguicida y semilla, será de gran ayuda para continuar mejorando sus circunstancias familiares y cumplir con el pago de las deudas.
La inversión anterior le dio la oportunidad de tener una cosecha abundante de maíz y frijol, no tuvo problemas con plagas, sus ventas aumentaron con los nuevos ingresos ha mejorado grandemente su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Ricardo is planting his next crop for the summer season. For this reason, he is requesting capital in order to buy insecticide, compost, pesticides, and seeds. This will be great help for continuing to improve his family’s circumstances and being able to pay off his debts.

Ricardo’s previous investment gave him the opportunity to achieve an abundant harvest of corn and beans. He did not have any problems with pests. His sales increased and the newly-earned income made a huge improvement in his family’s life.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, compost, pesticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Adama from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 8 children. She began her business to develop herself. She runs a retail business of selling soap. She has been running this business since 2004. She works at the business 8 hours per day and 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Adama has requested a loan in order to purchase more soap to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her daughters' living conditions and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Gbassay

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Gbassay from Waterloo2, western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children. Three of her children are going to school. She started her business because she wants to empower herself.

Gbassay runs a retail business selling charcoal and wood for resale. She has been running this business since 2009. She works at the business for eight hours per day and six days per week. Gbassay says that the main challenge to her business is a poor road network within her operation area.

Gbassay has requested a loan in order to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. 

In the future, she plans to open a general store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and wood

loans.name: Ana Evelin

texts.es:
Ana de 29 años de edad,  es una persona que  estudio hasta noveno grado y es una persona soltera, su esposo la abandono. Ella se levanta a las 4:30 a.m.  para realizar sus actividades diarias, mientras sus hijos van a la escuela.

Ana se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura oficio que le ha enseñado su esposo, durante la mañana trabaja en la parcela camina 2 K.m. Para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas para elaborar queso y venderlo 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar dos vacas, las cuales le ayudaran a producir más leche para la elaboración de queso y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana is 29 years old. She studied until ninth grade. She is single, her husband abandoned her. She gets up at 4:30am to do her daily work while her children go to school.

Ana works in agriculture, which her husband taught her. During the morning she works on her piece of land, which she walks 2 kilometers to get to. On her way there, and during the afternoon, she milks her cows to make cheese and sell it.

The loan she is requestinig from CREDICAMPO is for buying two cows, which will help her produce more milk for making cheese and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 39 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Leonisa has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. 

She requested a 7,500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Leonisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: In God Group

texts.en:
Hellen, who is in her early 40s, is married and has three children who are in school. Hellen has been selling fruits and vegetables, tilapia fish, chicken and yams for three years. This business enables her to increase her income. Hellen starts her business at 7:00 am and closes at 9:00 pm daily. She is able to make a good profit each month.

Hellen is requesting her first loan from ID-Ghana. She will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables, tilapia fish, chicken and yams to resell to customers. 

Hellen thanks Kiva lenders for their willingness to support her with improving the group businesses. She managed to earn a profit which she used to cover school and household expenses. She dreams that one day, she will be able to expand her business to other areas and to increase her income. 

Hellen will share this total loan amount of GHS 1,750 with her group members, which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables, tilapia fish, chicken and yams to resell.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been in the tailoring business for 10 years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the household expenses and the educational needs of the children. So, she started tailoring at home to support her family. 

Together with her husband, she manages the household while operating a business. At this time, Sumaira is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons, and laces in different colors. With the loan, she will then be able to meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Sumaira hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons, and laces in different colors.

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es: María del Rosario es una pequeña productora de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Se dedica principalmente a la caficultura, con lo cual ha sacado adelante a sus 3 hijos de 21, 12 y 4 años. Desde hace 8 años Dña. María del Rosario está a cargo de su pequeña finca de 7 hectáreas, la cual ha venido mejorando y en la que cuenta con 2 hectáreas de café. Su finca está certificada por Fairtrade, UTZ y C.A.F.E Practices. La producción promedio de café que ha obtenido en los últimos tres años es de 75 quintales de café pergamino. El mayor desafío que ha enfrentado en la producción de café, es la presencia de plagas y enfermedades, lo cual está segura logrará mantener bajo control con un plan de fertilización adecuado. Por tal razón, está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le permitirá darle un adecuado mantenimiento a sus plantaciones. Su meta es continuar mejorando su finca bajo un plan de manejo integrado que le permita continuar invirtiendo gradualmente en el desarrollo y diversificación de su finca, lo cual está segura logrará con una buena toma de decisiones y su dedicación al trabajo para poder seguir sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en: María del Rosario is a small producer in the northern area of Nicaragua. She mainly grows coffee, which is how she has provided for her 3 children who are 21, 12, and 4 years old. She has been in charge of her small, 7 hectare farm for 8 years. She has been improving it and has 2 hectares of coffee planted. Her farm is certified Fair Trade, UTZ and C.A.F.E. Practices. Her average coffee production during the past three years is 75 quintales [100-pound sacks] of parchment coffee [the dried green coffee bean still enclosed in its parchment skin]. The main challenge she confronts in coffee production is the existence of pests and diseases. She is sure she will keep these under control with an adequate fertilization plan. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy inputs and fertilizers that will allow her to provide adequate maintenance to her plants. Her goal is to continue improving her coffee farm under an integrated management plan that will allow her to continue gradually investing in the development and diversification of her farm. She is certain she will achieve this with good decision making and dedication to her work, so that she can continue providing for her family.

loans.use: to buy inputs and fertilizers for producing coffee.

loans.name: María Candelaria

texts.es:
María de 50 años de edad, es una persona que  estudio hasta sexto grado y es una persona casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposo, para realizar sus actividades diarias, mientras sus hijos van a estudiar.


María se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura oficio que le ha enseño su madre durante la mañana, trabajan en la parcela camina 1 K.m. Para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a elaborar comida típica para la venta


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar los materiales que necesita para arreglar una parte del techo de su casa que esta dañado y que en invierno se filtra el agua.
texts.en:
Maria, 50, left school after the sixth grade.  She and her husband are farmers.  The family starts their days at 4:30am, the parents in the fields and the children at school.  

Maria works her fields in the mornings, work that she learned from her own mother.  She walks the 1 kilometer from her house to her farm.  In the afternoons, she makes prepared food for sale.  

Maria is applying for a loan that she will use to buy building materials for repairing her roof.  The roof leaks and she wants to repair it before the rainy season.

loans.use: to repair her roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and cola nuts to expand her business.

loans.name: Dúo Cariño Group

texts.es:
DUO CARIÑO
La señora Elsa Magdalena de 47 años de edad, se dedica a la confección de delantales típicos, por su experiencia ella elabora nuevos diseños para atraer a  clientes  nuevos, esta actividad le ha generado ingresos que le ayudan a ser de gran apoyo económico a su familia, las ganancias que obtiene las invierte en la educación de sus hijos ellos han logrado la educación superior porque están asistiendo a la Universidad su sueño es que muy pronto sean profesionales  y puedan desenvolverse en la sociedad; ha sido muy responsable en sus pagos, le agradece a Dios y a FAPE porque le ha brindado los préstamos esto le ayudará a incrementar sus ventas esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elavoracion de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en:
“Cariño” (Affection) Group

Sra. Elsa Magdalena is 47 years old. She produces traditional woven aprons. As a result of her experience, Elsa comes out with new designs in order to attract new customers. This business has been a great help in allowing her to generate revenue to support her family. The income she earns is invested in the education of her children. They are working toward obtaining their higher education since they are attending the university. Her dream is for her children to become professionals soon and become integrated into society.

Elsa has been very responsible with her payments. She thanks God and FAPE for providing the loans since they have helped to increase her sales. Elsa is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies for producing her woven goods.

loans.use: to buy supplies for producing her woven goods.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a videoke (similar to karaoke) machine rental business in the Philippines for 20 years. She earns additional income from a general store. 

Marieta is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of sugar for resale

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells it to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Abida requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of different cloth for the summer season. She takes into account the choices and tastes of her customers. With this loan, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. 

Abida hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sticks for resale.

loans.name: Guillermo Isai

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 24 años de edad,  él con mucho esfuerzo logro sacar el Bachillerato, esta acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, un bebé y el niño de 6 años  que se encuentran estudiado, su compañera de vida hace los oficio domésticos en el hogar y en cuidar a los niños.

Guillermo se dedica a trabajar en las estructuras metálicas, se dedica a esta actividad desde que tomo la desición  de formar un hogar y de igual manera también se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura. El se levanta desde muy temprano para ir a trabajar en la agricultura, para llevarle el sustento diario a su familia para llegar a su trabajo recorre un kilómetro de distancia de su casa.

utilizara el crédito, para comprar dos novillos de repasto para cuando este grande poder venderlos y poder cancelar su crédito y la ganancia obtenida la utilizara para comprar algunos fertilizantes he insumos para la siembra del maíz

El sueños  de Guillermo es seguir Trabajando muy duro, para darle a su familia lo que necesita y lograr superar su nivel de vida y desea poderle dar un mejor educación a sus hijos
texts.en:
Guillermo is 24 years old. Due to great effort, he was able to graduate from high school. He is married with 2 children, a baby and a 6-year-old who is in school. His life partner does domestic work and takes care of the children.

Guillermo earns his living working on metal structures. He has done this work since he decided to get married and start a family. He also works in agriculture. He wakes up very early to go work in his fields to earn a livelihood for his family. He works a mile's walking distance from his home.

He will use this loan to buy two steers. He will sell them when they are grown and use the profits to pay off his debt and buy fertilizer for planting corn.
Guillermo would like to continue working hard to give his family what they need. He wants to manage to improve their standard of living and provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana , es separada tiene tres hijos, vive en casa de sus padres , la misma se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel secundario. Se dedida a la elaboracion y comercializacion del comida (sajta, biste , pollo dorado y otros.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de viveres (fideo , arroz, aceite y otros) ademas de papa 
El sueño de Juana  es tener un restaurant en la localidad
texts.en:
Juana is separated from her spouse and has three children. She lives at her parents’ house, which is located in the city of La Paz.

Juana only has a high school education. She prepares and sells food such as stewed chicken, beef steak, roasted chicken, and other dishes. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy ingredients (noodles, rice, oil, potatoes, and other items).

Juana’s dream is to open a restaurant in her town.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as noodles, rice, oil, potatoes, and other items.

loans.name: Nyetaa Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Nyetaa vivent toutes dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Missira l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le  commerce, de mil, de galettes  et des pagnes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 7éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djominé (1ére  femme assise à droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette dans le quartier de Missira et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de mil pour satisfaire sa  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Djominé espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour  des petits besoins de ses enfants, aider son mari et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The six  women of the group Nyetaa all live in monogamous families, and they average 41 years of age and four children each, living in Missira, a district in Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) They know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They do commerce in millet, galettes, and 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their seventh solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Djominé (first woman sitting from the right in the photo) is a major vendor of galettes in and around the Missira district. She intends to use her loan to purchase  5 sacks of millet to satisfy her customers. Sales are made to a mixed customer base paying in cash and often on credit. 

Ms. Djominé hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA with this loan. The profit will be used for her children's sundry needs, to help out her husband, and also to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase millet for her restaurant

loans.name: Galaxy (Flat) Group

texts.es: El grupo Galaxy está integrado por cinco personas. Don Juan tiene 43 años de edad está casado con la señora Hilaria desde hace 20 años juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos de los cuales aun dependen de dicha pareja. Don Juan se dedica  a la elaboración de muñequitos desde hace tres años, son muñequitos muy bonitos, platica que su actividad la inicio porque antes se vendía juguetes con otra persona él solo era empleado pero en el transcurso del tiempo conoció a un proveedor que le ofreció venderle la máquina para la elaboración de los muñequitos. Esta vez está solicitando un crédito para comprar materia prima como plástico de vinil, tela y pinturas. Dice que su única dificultad es la falta de dinero para dinero para invertir más en su negocio porque su materia prima es muy cara  y mas las maquinas, ahora lo que más le hace falta es la máquina para elaborar la ropita para vestir a sus muñequitos, “Este crédito no me alcanzara para mucho pero estoy muy agradecido con KIVA y Vision Fund porque de alguna manera podré comprar más materia prima y no tendré que preocuparme por comprar más material” Don Juan quiere lograr hacer crecer más su negocio para que con sus ganancias pueda beneficiar a su familia. Los integrantes del grupo son Dalia quien invierte en accesorios para teléfono, Elizabeth comprará materia prima para la elaboración de pan de feria, Esperanza invertirá en accesorios para teléfono para después venderlos y Alicia productos de plástico.
texts.en: The Galaxy community bank has five members.  Don Juan, 43, and his wife, Sra. Hilaria, have been married for 20 years and have three children, all still living at home.  Don Juan started a doll-making business three years ago.  He says that he used to work for someone else, selling toys, but he got to know a distributor who offered to sell him equipment for making dolls and decided to set up his own business.  He is applying for a loan to buy the materials he needs--plastic, cloth, paint, etc.--to carry on the business.  He says that his only problem is a lack of money to invest in the business.  The materials and equipment for making the dolls are expensive and he lacks equipment for making clothes for the dolls.  "The loan won't stretch as far as I need it to", he says, "but I'm grateful to KIVA and Vision Fund because I'll be able to buy more materials now and not worry about coming up short later".  Don Juan wants to grow the business because the more he earns from the business, the more he can help his family.  The other members of the group are: Dalia, who has a telephone accessories business; Elizabeth, who will buy supplies for making bread; Esperanza, who also has a telephone accessories business; and Alicia, who buys and sells plastic products.

loans.use: to buy materials for his doll-making business.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle, 28 years old, is married and has two children. She has been farming sugarcane in the Philippines for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store. Michelle is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia es una pequeña productora de café de 42 años de edad. Vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en la zona norte de Nicaragua. Cuenta con una finca de 7 hectáreas, de las cuales 5 aproximadamente son de café, siendo éste la principal fuente de ingresos para su familia. En los últimos 3 años, Dña. Virginia ha estado dedicada a esta actividad, tiempo en el cual se ha integrado al proceso de certificación Fairtrade a través la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria, y obtenido 1 préstamo de esta organización. Los rendimientos productivos de café en ese período (2011-2014), por parte de esta emprendedora, han sido de 260 quintales de café pergamino. Para este ciclo 2014-2015, su objetivo es incrementar la productividad de su cafetal y obtener más de 60 qq de café pergamino en este ciclo, dándole un manejo adecuado a su plantación y mejorando las aplicaciones de fertilizantes con las dosis completas para que las plantas puedan asimilar y dar mejores resultados. Para esto, esta pequeña productora está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar la compra de fertilizantes para su plantación de café. Su pasión por el trabajo y por salir adelante con sus hijos, es algo que siempre ha caracterizado a Dña. Virginia, y le ayudará a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Virginia is 42 years old and a small-scale coffee grower. She lives with her husband and their five children in northern Nicaragua. 

Doña Virginia owns a seven-hectare plantation, and grows coffee on five hectares to provide the main source of her family's income. Doña Virginia has run the plantation for the past three years, and has begun the process of obtaining Fair Trade Certification through the Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria [People in Community Action] Association. Doña Virginia has also obtained one loan from PAC. 

Doña Virginia's plantation has produced 260 quintales of parchment coffee from 2011 to 2014 [one quintal = 46 kg]. She hopes that effective management of her plantation will increase production to over 60 quintales of parchment coffee for the 2014-2015 season. An important factor will be to improve fertilizer application, using full doses so that the coffee plants can absorb the fertilizer and produce more coffee. Doña Virginia is therefore applying for a loan that will allow her to ensure the purchase fertilizers for her plantation. 

Doña Virginia has always stood out because of her passion for her work and for improving her children's lives. This loan will help her realize her ambitions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es: Julio César es un productor de café del departamento de Jinotega, Nicaragua. Posee una finca de 29.6 hectáreas, de las cuales 11.3 son de café. Tiene más de 15 años de estar trabajando su pequeña finca, la cual ha ido mejorando. La meta de este pequeño productor es incrementar el rendimiento productivo del área de café con que cuenta actualmente, lo cual se propone realizar con la implementación de un plan de manejo integral en su finca. Para este ciclo de café, Julio César está solicitando un financiamiento para garantizar el suministro de insumos y fertilizantes que requieren sus plantaciones, lo cual realizará con el acompañamiento técnico de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria a la cual pertenece. Confía en que su dedicación al trabajo y la disponibilidad de estos recursos le permitirá pasar en este ciclo de 150 a 180 quintales de café pergamino, lo cual le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en: Julio César is a coffee producer in the department of Jinotega, Nicaragua. He owns a farm of 29.6 acres, of which he plants 11.3 with coffee. He has over 15 years of experience working on his small farm, which has been improving. The goal of this small producer is to increase the yield of his current coffee-producing area. He intends to implement a comprehensive management plan for his farm. For this cycle of coffee, Julio César is requesting funding to ensure he has the inputs and fertilizers that his plants require with the help of the Association for People in Community Action to which he belongs. He trusts that with his hard work and these resources, he will be able to harvest 150 to 180 kilograms of coffee, allowing him to improve the conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase inputs for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Mareme's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 6 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 25 juin 2002, il regroupe des membres qui habitent le même village et ceux des alentours. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations et font comme activité le commerce et l'embouche. Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Sokhna  est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10  enfants dont 3 garçons. Elle fait comme activité l'embouche bovine. Avec le prêt elle va acheter 2 bœufs, un à 350 000f et un autre à 200 000f. Concernant l'engraissement des bêtes, elle a un apport personnel. 
Les bénéfices lui serviront à renforcer son épargne dans le banc villageois, à prendre en charge la nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
This group of six women are part of the'banc villageois' that was created on June 25, 2002. It is composed of members living in and around the same village. They keep up good relationships, and they do work involving commerce and livestock farming. Standing at the right in the photo with her hand raised, Sokhna is 55 years old, married, and a mother of ten children, including three boys. Her work is in fattening cattle. 

With this loan, she is going to purchase 2 head of cattle, one of them at 350,000 francs and the other at 200,000 francs. She has a personal connection to the raising livestock. The profits will be used to bolster her savings at the 'banc villageois' and to support feeding her family.

loans.use: to purchase two head of cattle

loans.name: Banco De Piedra Group

texts.es: Doña Patricia pertenece al grupo Banco de Piedra ella tiene 37 años de edad está casada con el señor Mario desde 15 años juntos han procreado tres niños los cuales asisten a la escuela, Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos por catalogo desde hace seis meses, anteriormente vendía cosméticos dice que el negocio estaba funcionando muy bien pero sus clientes le preguntaban por otros productos como ropa y zapatos  por eso decidió cambiar de productos. Esta vez está solicitando un crédito para comprar más zapatos Doña Paty, como la conocen sus amistades, comento “Me gusta socializar mucho con las personas” Todas las tardes sale a dejar mercancía o a ofrecer de casa en casa. Dice que ya tiene buenos clientes porque hasta su casa van a pedirle productos. Su única dificultad es cuando sus clientas se atrasan en sus pagos pero finalmente si terminan de pagar. La meta de Doña Paty es poder ser empresaria dentro de la empresa de Avon formar una red enorme de personas porque su logro estar en ese nivel tendrá más ganancias y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida. Los integrantes del grupo son Teresa quien invertirá en cosméticos, Laura, Francisca, Basilia, Rosa compraran borreguitos, Maria Albertha invertirá en tienda de abarrotes.El grupo “Banco de Piedra” está conformado por siete personas, el grupo se encuentra ubicado en una comunidad muy tranquila donde generalmente las personas se dedican al cultivo de maíz. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque en la comunidad donde viven hay un banco donde se extrae la piedra la cual se utiliza para construcción de las viviendas.
texts.en:
Patricia belongs to the Banco de Piedra group. She is 37 years old and is married to Mario. They have been together for 15 years and they have three children who attend school. She sells clothing and shoes by catalog, a business she has had for six months. Previously, she sold cosmetics and says that business was going well but customers asked for other products, like clothes and shoes, so she decided to change products. This time, she is requesting to buy more shoes. Paty, as her friends call her, comments that she likes to socialize with people. Every afternoon, she goes to sell from house-to-house. She says she already has good customers because they come to her house asking for products. Her only difficulty is when her clients are behind in their payments but they end up paying eventually. Paty's goal is to be an entrepreneur with the Avon company, a huge network of people that have achieved more profits and a higher quality of life. 

The members of the group are Teresa, who sells cosmetics; Laura, Francisca, Basilia, and Rosa who will buy lambs; and Maria Albertha who will invest in her grocery store. The group "Banco de Piedra" [Stone Quarry] consists of 7 people located in a pleasant community in which people usually are dedicated to growing corn. The name of the group was chosen because they live in a community where there is a stone quarry which they use for constructing their homes.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing to sell.

location.town: El Valerio, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 24-years-old and married with two children.

Nancy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Nancy has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns additional income from food vending.

Nancy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Narissa

texts.en: Narissa, 45 years old, is married and has one child. Narissa works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 20 years, Narissa has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as juice, candies, biscuits, soft drinks, snack foods, etc. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store. Narissa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials (chicken mesh, wood, steel sheeting) to improve installations at her small chicken farm. The remainder will be used to buy primary materials for preparing snacks and other dishes to sell.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 34 years old and already the mother of 4 children: three sons and a daughter. Narine’s husband is a hired worker. However, Narine and her husband's main occupation is farming and agriculture. Narine says that, in their farm, they have three cows and seventeen chickens. They manage to produce and sell a great range of dairy products, meat, eggs, persimmons, figs and nuts. As Narine says, the income is not big, but they love their farm and the work that they do. Since they were born in this village, it is only through farming that they imagine their family living. 

Narine has asked for a loan of 450,000 Armenian drams since she has plans to make their farm richer by buying a heifer, two piglets and animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy a heifer, two piglets and animal fodder

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn works hard to support her family. Roselyn is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Roselyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Roselyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Mbenda

texts.fr:
Cette femme fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 25 juin 2002, ce dernier regroupe des membres qui habitent le même village et ceux des alentours. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations et font comme activité le commerce et l'embouche. Debout sur la photo, Mbenda est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 garçons. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la restauration, le commerce de céréales et l'embouche. Avec le prêt elle compte acheter 200kg de niébé à 400f le kg qui va lui revenir à 800f. Elle va aussi acheter du bissap pour une valeur de 75000f, du mil 1000kg à 225 f le kg ce qui va être vendu à 250 le kg.Comme activité pareille elle fait de la restauration et de l'embouche ovine, pour cela elle va acheter 4 moutons à raison de 50000 l'un et compte revendre à 70000f. 
Les bénéfices lui permettent d'épargner, de payer la scolarité pour ses enfants et de construire sa maison.
texts.en:
This woman is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on June 25, 2002. It is composed of members living in around the same village. The women maintain good relationships and do work involving commerce and livestock farming. Standing in the photo, Mbenda is 48 years old, married, and a mother of five children, including two boys. She operates a revenue-generating restaurant business and does commerce in grains and livestock farming. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase 200 kg of black-eye peas at 400 francs/kg, which will bring in 800 francs of income. She is also going to purchase some hibiscus flowers valued at 75,000 francs; and 1,000 kg of millet at 225 francs/kg to be sold at 250 francs/kg. At the same time, she is in the restaurant business, and she fattens sheep, so she is going to purchase four head of sheep at 5,000 francs each and plans on earning 70,000 francs. The profits will enable her to save money, pay for her children's education, and build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase grains and sheep

loans.name: Nonet

texts.en: Nonet, 38 years old, is married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, Nonet has operated a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as vegetables, spices, rice, meat, fish, etc. for her food production business. In the future, Nonet would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as vegetables, spices, rice, meat, fish, etc. for her business

loans.name: José Felipe

texts.es:
José de 59 años de edad, es un hombre dedicado, responsable y trabajador, que junto a su esposa han podido lograr que sus hijos sean unas personas de bien y laboriosas. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 3° grado, para lograr cursar este nivel tuvo que estudiar en la noche, ya que en el día le ayudaba a su padre en trabajos de carpintería. Sus cuatros hijos ya formaron su propia familia, solamente viven con él, tres nietos que están estudiando.

Se dedica a la carpintería, tiene 25 años de experiencia y es bien conocido por los trabajos realizados a los clientes, aprendió esta actividad de su padre, este oficio viene de familia, tanto su padre como los demás hermanos son carpinteros. Anteriormente trabajaba también en la albañilería. Trabaja de lunes a sábado.

El préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de material para la elaboración de muebles que tiene encargados y necesita tenerlos lo más pronto posible, además, invertirá en el arreglo de algún equipo que tiene en mal estado. Con esta ayuda, aprovechara la oportunidad de generar mejores ingresos.

Su sueño es lograr establecer un gran taller de carpintería, donde sus nietos mantengan este negocio y que se puedan valerse por sí mismos de este trabajo. Dejarles de herencia el haberles enseñado un oficio, para que se ganen el pan de cada día de una manera honrada.
texts.en:
José is 59 years old. He is a dedicated, responsible, and hard-working man. Together with his wife, he has been able to raise his children to be good, hard-working people. José could only study through the third grade. To achieve this level of education he had to study at night, since he helped his father during the day with the carpentry work. His four children already have their own families. Only three of his grandchildren who are studying live with him.

José works in carpentry. He has 25 years of experience and is well known for the work he does for his clients. He learned the activity from his father, and it is a family business. Both his father and his other brothers are carpenters. José also previously worked in masonry. He works Monday through Saturday.

José will use the loan to buy materials to make furniture that has been ordered and that he needs to have as soon as possible. He is also going to invest in fixing some equipment that is in poor condition. With this help, José will have the opportunity to generate greater income.

José's dream is to be able to open up a carpentry workshop where his grandchildren can maintain the business and fend for themselves in this work. He is leaving them an inheritance by having taught them a trade so that they can earn their daily bread in an honorable way.

loans.use: to buy material to make furniture that has been ordered and that he needs to have as soon as possible. He will also invest in fixing some equipment that is in poor condition.
